text: Quaint Mediterranean venu not too far from the strip. Large menu. Food was very good. A little spicy. Had several choices from moraccan to greek to italian. Service was friendly and quick.

Itheir foods on the menu.  Especially the Athens Fries and Hummus.. They are super delicious!!! Everything on the menu ate darn good and tasty.  U won't even regret it. I go to the one on Sahara, not Maryland Parkway. Yummie!!!!

The food was good, the service was bad.We dine in the restaurant one night and got take out on another night.I ordered the gyro platter and was given no pita bread, called up and was told that you are suppose to ask for it.The person you answered the phone was rude, how you make gyro was any pitas.

The food is great. I get the koubedeh ground beef. The issue I do have  is the rice portion is way to small so I end up adding another $3.50 to my bill so it now ends up costing me $17.50 instead of the $14 it should cost. So ends up being a little pricey for the one meal.

Come here every time we come to Vegas! Every thing I've had has been amazing. From the chicken Marsala to the chicken pita! Had the kabobs last visit and man was it good! They have these awesome seasoned fries with dipping sauce that are so good. Wish I had more room in my belly.
I had a cosmopolitan martini the other day and it was terrible. Tasted like all cranberry juice.  No garnish.$9.00.  I won't order a cocktail there anymore.

Unfortunately, what was once a great restaurant in Las Vegas has now become nothing more than another example of a business that's forgotten who it's serving: their customers!  I was here with my husband to smoke some hookah in their lounge on a Saturday night.  It wasn't busy and that's probably due to the effects of the current economy.  We ordered our hookah and then I ordered a tea which they would not serve to me in the hookah lounge.  However, they serve coffee!  Having lived in the Middle East, I told the server it was tradition to serve tea with Hookah.  After that, I really didn't want anything but was told I had to order something since there was a 1 drink minimum.  People, in this economy, you would think they would make an exception seeing business is down everywhere.  Instead the lounge manager was rude when we asked to speak with him and we promptly walked out and took our business to Stephano's opposite UNLV where we were treated like we were the only customers in the world! Learn a thing or two, Paymons!

Great food and service. The waiter was really nice and offered substituting sides to our need, you don't find that kind of service at many restaurants nowadays, other places try to up sell other sides to increase your bill. Will go back soon.
My BF took me here for our date night. Let's just say he's gettin' some action tonight for his choice in dinner places.

Excellent food, great service!  I have been to a few Mediterranean restaurants and this by far is excellent. They have a wonderful selection of salads and dishes.  I am learning more each time I visit.  I like the staff, they have been friendly and helpful each time my friends and I have come.  I would definitely recommend this place. Only issue is parking is tough sometimes.  They have spaces in the back which some ppl may not know.  All in all a good place!

I came here for a school trip for one of my F&B classes at UNLV. I for some reason had high expectations, and after I ate their food, I was much disappointed. Although when I went it was buffet style, so of course the food sitting on top of burners won't be the cream of the crop, (especially when the manager was speaking for what seemed like eternity) there is no excuse ! I agree with MiRIAM w. that the fries were good; their seasonings were tasty, but I think they just topped it with whatever they had in the cupboard...

*Remember that Paymon's is NOT authentic Mediterranean food and they don't advertise it to be; I think some people forget about that.

I give it three stars. Eh

This is one of my favorite places but tonight with a near empty restaurant the server kept asking me if I was ready to go home. I sometimes could not answer with food in my mouth but it became so annoying that I don't know if I'll be back. I'll just order to go.
What happened to the good servers?
This is my to go place for hookah. Friendly service and the best tea

Came here with family on recommendation from "foodie" friends and was very impressed with food and service at this unassuming restaurant. We got saganaki (flipping amazing fried cheese), Athens fries (seasoning + the best sauce = more please), gyro salad (ask to add feta, it's a must), lentil soup (hit the spot), veggie kabob plate (came with some yummy marinara) and finished with Turkish coffee. Was recommended to have Samir make the turkish coffee for us, but he was off today. Our waiter Anthony made ours and it was the best coffee I've ever had!! When you go try to get him as you waiter - absolutely impeccable service. He was so welcoming and really anticipated everything we needed before we asked. He really made the experience for us and we will definitely be back & recommend to all!!

We used to frequent this location, the last few times we have gone on customer appreciation day (25% off) and the service and food have been less than stellar. 

We ordered chicken gyros and they were dry-- when we asked the waitress for extra tzaziki sauce she had a blatant attitude-- we didn't even mention the food being dry. I was extra disappointed because my mother was in town and I was so excited to bring her to Paymons. 

Another time I ordered a cup of their AMMAAAAZING lentil soup, the waiter brought me a bowl of it, which he insisted I ordered instead of the cup. 

We waited and waited for refills and our bill. As stated above we used to come here all the time but the last few disappointing experiences have deterred me from returning.

What a great find for us just a few minutes drive from the Flamingo with a really wide variety of dishes.  Love the casual atmosphere and am always looking for a local place when traveling.  The curry chicken was amazing.  Delicious hummus appetizer too.  Portions are generous and we had great service as well.  Definitely a place to go when you're here.
I have been a patron for years, but I think I'm done.  The food here is great, but the service is lousy.

I don't think this place tries hard enough, yes it is popular; but the food is adequite at best.  the service is adequite, at best.   the foodis fair, I just think they don't try hard enough to be GREAT... I think they rest on on thier history and  location. I have had better meals.

I used to love this place since it is really close to my house and food is really good. I normally went there after work and asked to go. I never waited more than 5minutes what is amazing after a long day at work. But today I had a really bad experience. I decided to pay with card and the hostess added 15% tip on my tab what I haven't ad, I just signed my paper. I felt betrayed cuz she didn't even had to give me the menu and not even offered me a water so I don't think she deserved a tip. I don't think I will ever go back there. Is too bad when you can't trust a place and just can pay with cash so ppl to do this to you.

Ordered broiled kebab trio. Beef is very tough. Ground beef was very salty. Chicken was under seasoned. Rice tasted weird. Would not recommend. 

They don't change the charcoal on hookah. You have to pay to get your charcoal refilled which is unheard of. Also your soft drinks are not refillable. Total scam.

Always an amazing experience! I eat here every couple of weeks. I can't say I have had a bad dish...I particularly love the fesenjan and the gyro platter though. I tried the combination plate recently because I couldn't decide on an entree, and it was great! You get a little bit of everything. Their food is reasonably priced and authentic, but they also have a variety of food for people who are not into mediterranean cuisine.

Stopped by here last night with some friends that hadn't really smoked hookah before. We had a great time, and were not disappointed.

The atmosphere is great, the service was amazing, and I would absolutely recommend this place to friends that want to try hookah, or just have a great meal.

I've been here several times. Service is good. I enjoy eating near the water fountain area because I feel the tables are too close together in the dining area where it's hard to hold your own conversation because you hear everyone elses. Try sitting near the wall.  

Let's move on to food... using a 5-point rating:

3/5 Shrimp artichoke dip with pitas. Pita had mold on it so look carefully. But the dip is flavorful.

4/5 Chicken pita.  They have been inconsistant with the chicken portion and sometimes it comes out dry.  But the overall flavor is good and it's a good size...sometimes.

5/5 Athen's Fries are great (seasoned with paprika, garlic and italian seasoning). It comes with with "fat" sauce, which the main ingredients are mayo, ketchup, paprika, italian seasoning, garlic powder etc.

5/5 Baklava was good but a bit on the small size. 

4/5 Hummus was a nice consistancy and flavor, again, watch out for moldy pita bread. 

Tip: Wednesdays are packed because you get a 25% off your bill.

Pretty good place for lunch, especially if you're a student or other at UNLV.   A group of us have gone for lunch or dinner a couple of times and everyone always it. I usually get the veggie deal, which is good. Downside is that you have to pay extra for the fries, but they're damn good fries! They have seasoned salt, which gives that extra kick.

Like I said, I've gone with groups ranging from four ppl to nine. They are gracious and accommodated us. It's a bit noisy in there, but doable for groups.

This restaurant failed to honor a Restaurant.com certificate saying they no longer participate, even though according to Restaurant.com, they signed a contract to honor all outstanding certificates. Do they think a 'Greek' restaurant can get away with what the Greek 'government' does? The food is mediocre.

We love this place. Athens Fries are a must. Get a full order and share between two people. The salads are fresh and crunchy. 

I usually get Chicken Tandoori and it comes with a healthy dose of rice and vegetables and a chutney for dipping. Occasionally I'll opt for some pasta and every option is delicious. The penne pesto is about $10.95, but you can get the same exact dish for a dollar less off the all you can eat pasta menu. The bolognese is very traditional and hearty, goes perfectly with the spaghetti.

My girlfriend always gets a bowl of lentil soup and occasionally the farfalle with  roasted garlic cream sauce or the chicken pita, or marsala. Both are fantastic. 

The iced tea is thirst quenching and they always seem to know when to top off the glass. End your meal with some robust and sweet Turkish coffee. This is a once-a-week place for us.

Really outstanding and correctly named. The menu has a great selection of Greek, Italian, Middle Eastern, and North African dishes. Normally a large menu makes me skeptical, but somehow these folks manage to never disappoint.
The portions are quite large, so be aware of that as you attempt to choose just one or two items from their comprehensive and well-executed menu.

Paymon's is THE Saturday brunch spot for me.  In this restaurant, I feel absolutely comfortable whether I'm going by myself for a bowl of lentil soup and a book, out to dinner with the guy, or with a group of friends.  

I love sitting in the indoor courtyard between the dining room and hookah lounge.  I spend a good ten minutes everytime I'm there trying to read the script that lines the walls at the ceiling.  I sit back into my comfy sofa and relax --it's usually much quieter than the dining room.  If I'm with a group, the sampler platter is a staple--excellent hummus, loads of the best pitas I've found in Vegas, great olives, the fries with Greek seasoning, baba ganosh, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, and plenty of tzatziki sauce.  The three dip platter is a great option too.  I seriously recommend the hummus, yogurt cucumber dip, and bouranni...also served with all the delicious, fresh pitas you can handle.  

Their lentil soup is to die for.  Their falafel and tahini sauce are addictive.  Guy loves the gyro pita, which is HUGE (like as big as my head huge).  Now they even give the option to have your pita wrapped instead...but how could you say no to those pitas?  Plus, pita means the paper bag, and you should always "Protect yourself, keep it wrapped!"  Sometimes I get the "falamus" pita--falafel, lettuce, tomato, and hummus instead of tahini sauce.  Of course, NOTHING is complete until it's properly doused in their super yummo Racy Red Sauce--their house blend of spices, vinegar, and tabasco.

I am terribly sad they closed their market down.  I had just decided to buy a hookah when I went in one day and it was gone.  BUT, no market means expansion which means more tables which means I never have to wait to be seated!

Oh yeah, if you really want all your teeth to fall out of your head, you have to try the baklava.  I almost cried.

Have been t this place twice, spring 2014 and spring 2015. Both cases were very pleasant. They are located off Strip which makes for very little noise and not too many people. Also great to go with kids. We called in advance to make a reservation for about 6PM for 6 ppl, but they say it's not necessary. When we arrived, however, they had our table served for us. Nice!

We were after Mediterranean cuisine, so can't really tell much about italian dishes there. We went with apperizer combo platter, ground beef kebab, vegetarian dish with couscous (forgot the name) and moussaka. For dessert we had bachlava, tiramisu and arabic coffee.

All dishes were good size, we did it family style for 4 adults and 2 kids, everyone was full at the end.

Hummus in appetizer was freshly made, all dishes overall were tasty, not oily or overly spiced.

Definitely return next time we're in Vegas.

Met a few colleagues from lunch here, as I have done many many times in the past.  What I love about Paymon's is the Atrium seating area with natural light and the feeling that you are not in a busy busy lunch spot on Maryland Parkway.  

Without question, I always NEED the Paymon's french fries and dipping sauce.  Hands down these are some of my favorite fries ever!  But who goes to a Mediterranean Cafe for French Fries???  Me.  Okay, I also enjoy the other food!  

On this day I ordered the traditional lamb Gyro in a pita (not the pita pocket).  Paymon's gyros offer the best combination of ingredients.  Plenty of veggies, just enough sauce, and just enough meat.  I couldn't eat the whole thing, it was too big!

As some others have said in their reviews, the Passion Fruit Iced Tea is a big hit for me as well.  I LOVE their Lentil soup - simple but flavorful and served with a side of pita.  

Paymon's does not have "Lunch Specials" and a typical lunch here can run about $15.  If you want a cheaper gyro meal, you will have to go elsewhere.  I prefer to pay the few extra bucks for Excellent service, clean and ambient restaurant setting, and for good food!

Pretty tasty food.  I ordered the persian chicken that had been slow cooked in crushed walnuts and pomegranite juice.  I mean, whats not to like about that?  They accomodated a large party very well and we even were seated in the back area (which is substantially nicer than the front of the restaurant.  And, the coffee was served in a very authentic and beautiful way.
Food is great, service is good and ambiance is non existent but if you want great Med food, give this place a chance.
We love this place. Staff is attentive, the iced tea is wonderful and the food is exceptional. Go here and eat.
We tried the grilled salmon and the veggie kabob plate. Their pita breads are super soft and tasty. The rice pilaf is out of the world. Loved the food!

Today it has been the worse experience of my time at Paymon's I am a regular at Paymons, since 2008, I came in and my sever Valerie was rude, distant and didn't recognize me. I ordered my hookah and regular drink. She forgot and I had to wait for 20 mins for my hookah. Jake and kyra came to my rescue before that I wanted to leave! Seriously Unless they change the staff I don't want to continue to go there.. If Valerie is there talking to the bar coustomers bout how many times she gets drunk instead of checking on you leave.. She is bringing this business down.. #Fireher!!

Calamari is really good. French fries with their own hot sauce also very good. Like the old school feel. 
Pastas are the real deal.

Service was horrible. Clueless waitresses! Thankfully, Ahmad came by to save us but it was too late to rescue the evening. The place was full of tables with dirty dishes. Food was great, but no manager in sight to manage the disorganized wait staff. What a shame!

Jeff, please tell Paymon, whom I knew 25 years ago when he started with a grocery store, that he needs to leave his exclusive Summerlin enclave, re-visit the place he started,and kick some a$$.

Stay away if you have issues with smoke!

Every time I eat at Paymons I have an allergy/asthma attack. I eat Mediterranean all the time, so it's not the cuisine. I think it is the open doorways between the restaurant, breezeway, and lounge. Smoke does come in, even though it is mitigated. Even my very healthy husband was coughing by the end.

Otherwise the food is average quality. The hummus is a tad bitter. And they've switched from a good pita to one that is far lower quality. 

Positives would be the high number of vegan and gluten free options. Prices are also moderate/reasonable.

I am beyond amazed!!! I was too tired to go out and get food myself, so I found this gem through an app that connects you to independent drivers that will go and pick up your order and deliver it to your front door for a pretty reasonable service fee. So we all know anytime you either order through a drive-thru or ask for delivery something is bound to be missing, right?! Well let me say I was surprised that not one item was missing and not only was the restaurant on top of things, so was the driver!! They both made sure even my side of lemons were included!! That sure shows they work well with customers as well as companies!! So whether it is through a delivery app or that you walk in, I definitely recommend this spot!! I can't wait to visit in person!! Well goodbye for now, away I go to stuff my face ja!!

The food here is delicious. It would have kept me coming back for more, had it not been for the terrible service. Our waitress took half of the drink orders and then walked away without taking anymore. When she returned with two drinks we were finally able to order the other three. She did the same thing when we ordered appetizers. She was extremely rude through the whole meal and took over 15 minutes to get our check. I will never be returning here, and I suggest you do the same.

You a local?  You visiting for more than just the weekend?

I got a place for you!!

Paymons is a great hangout place if you're a hookah lover or not.  The flavor selection is great, you can blend your own and come up with something new every time.

I don't care if you just ate, eat some more!!

The Athens fries are a favorite, but you gotta try their pesto pizza, I recommend pepperoni, mushrooms, and pepperoncinis.  There's just something magical about that combination.  Hookah wings, hummus, and the calamari are all winners as well.

I assure you, you haven't see service until you've meet the crew here.  

Stephanie behind the bar and Monica serving is a dynamite combination.  They're your servers and your best friends.  You throw in good music (and I really mean good) and you have an awesome atmosphere you can easily spend a couple of hours in.  

One last thing...TUESDAYS!!  They have an all night happy hour!

Hummus. The best, bottom line! Chicken pita wrap. The best, hands down. The food has always been great. The ice tea is awesome too. The food is very flavorful. If you want, you can add hot sauce and spices made by Paymon's to your food. The your in the mood for Mediterranean food, this is the only place in Vegas that will deliver. If I wasn't on a health kick, the Athens fries would have been destroyed!!

I've also been here a few times to smoke Hookah in the lounge side and have some drinks. Again, great hookah and service.

Neon sign is partially blown out outside.  Located in strip mall, a hidden gem.  Old world decor.  We were greeted immediately when we entered.  Everyone friendly.  Didn't know what to expect.  Food was delicious.  Had spinach pie, greek salad and hubby had gyros/beef and lamb.  Again, delicious.  Service was excellent.  Will return next week.

Ordered fries and they were the ONLY thing that was good! The struggle is the hookah. I can honestly say that this must be the worst hookah experience I've ever had. There was no smoke at all and all my friends were trying to see if it'll get better but it's basically just cheap cigarette smoke coming out. It was very disappointing. On top of it all, the server looked like she didn't know how to set up the hookah. We addressed the issue to  Christin (server) but she said we'll have to buy another bowl. We just asked to change the charcoal since it's not even producing smoke. We looked around and none of the hookahs were working. Food seems to be ok but honestly, it was my first time trying this place and will never go back again. I came in looking for good quality hookah but all I got was disappointment. Also please do not tell us and your future guest coming in that your "short staffed" and to bare with you when your not even busy. Please get it together.

Ok so I've eaten here a few times now, and the food is perfectly alright, it just doesn't wow me in any way.  It gets points for convenience since I'm a grad student at UNLV and it's easy to get to and eat in under an hour for lunch.  I should say that I've never been for dinner, but I don't think that there's any change in menu items.

In my opinion, the Saganaki might be the best thing on the menu, because who doesn't like hot, melting cheese?  I've also had the combination platter, the baked Kibbe, the fesenjan, the moussaka and the pastitsio.  For the most part all are tasty, and usually done correctly, but I've never had that *wow* factor that would have me rank this place higher.  I will say this though, their food does tend to be on the salty side, so be prepared to drink plenty of liquids for the rest of the day.


The service is also usually pretty good, but sometimes I think it might depend on the server.  Overall, a perfectly decent place that I'm content with going back to time and again.

This is a place for regular las vegas locals to dine so I decided to give it a try. Not impressed. I guess by now I'm turning into a food snob but if I'm going to spend money on dining out (when I have my own personal chef at home (my partner)) then it better be worth it. This place did not make the cut. Worth spending a few extra bucks to get a better meal.

My husband and I go here every year. The food is amazing . I had grilled salmon and my husband had steak kabob. The taste of the salmon was amazing and the steak kabob was so tender. Service and atmosphere was great. A must to visit and enjoy

Food is pretty reliable and good. Great for sit down and eating though. It can be a little pricey, but that's ok. Order ahead of time for pick up for sure. Lots of people for lunch because it's next to a lot of businesses and UNLV. There is also a hookah lounge attached attached to the main eating area. I ordered the chicken pita and shwarma gyro, no drinks and it came out to $21. It was good though.

Paymon's is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is superb and the service is excellent. I have eaten there during happy hour and in the restaurant.

Happy hour is great, too! The only downside is happy hour is served in the hookah lounge, and I don't smoke hookah. However, as long as people aren't waiting for a hookah spot, you are allowed to sit in the lounge and enjoy the happy hour experience of half-priced drinks and reduced appetizer prices. 

The prices are reasonable, especially for the quality and quantity of food. My go-to is the vegetarian platter, and that easily feeds me for two meals.
amazing place the food was yummy id definitely come back really nice place good service ive in another places but this one is by far my favorite

The food was excellent! The ambiance was lovely. The waiter we had wasn't very good, but that happens from time to time. So I don't blame the restaurant. There is another location on the westside of town I'd like to visit. Staff said it is a bit larger in size. Over all the food and ambiance was fabulous. I highly recommend this place if you are in the area.

Not quite sure why this is listed as "vegetarian". Sure theres vegetarian options but this is a straight up Gyro and souvlaki place. And a pretty nice one at that.  

The real star room here is the hooka lounge. Full bar. Great late menu. With or without hookah this place holds up.
Tasteless food and expensive. Chicken tandoori and falafel were ok. Would not recommend.

Love this place. Great music variety. Friendly staff. Delicious hookah! The environment is very serene. Great food and beer choice. If I could go here every night to unwind, I would! My favorite spot in town without the crowded noise.

Came here for lunch today around 1pm, not very busy.
I ordered tilapia florentine that 
"Seasoned tilapia filet sauteed with artichoke hearts and mushrooms. Served with angel hair pasta and topped with our lemon-butter sauce over a bed of spinach sauteed in fresh garlic and olive oil" 
The fish is very fresh and decent size, veggies are also delicious. I can not finish the whole plate.
My friend had eggplant pita and she likes the eggplant a lot.
The waiter is very gentle and nice service.
We spent less than 45mins for the whole lunch. Very full.

Went in on saturday 6-16 around 12:30pm. Hadnt been there since 2009, and could hardly wait, as we loved this place. Our current visit this time around was Very Disappointing to say the least. As stated, we were there around lunch time, less than 1/2 the tables in the place had patrons. We knew exactly what we wanted, same and only choice we ever get here: The combination platter & the Broiled Moroccan Lamb.

Tammy, our server (or should I say one of three servers we had) seemed nice enough, but unfortunately thats where it ended. If your going to take someone's order that has a few particular requests (i.e. crispy athens fries, xtra sauce, etc.) and not write it down, no problem, your awesome, but when the food does come, and wasnt to order, and it was like talking to wall, then yea, im a little peev'd. 

The grapeleaves have been and will always continue to be, a store bought product (I believe wild oats store bran from a jar) and are the worst you could ever want to eat, I mean, if you like mush and all. The rest of the combination platter lacked lemon!!!!! Come on Paymon's, your serving mediterranean food, put some damn lemon on the food, had to ask for a side of lemon, then it was just edible.

Asked for the Lamb cooked medium, came to us "well done" No self-respecting person would ever eat Well-Done lamb. Oh by the way, I even question whether it was even lamb or beef, I honestly could not tell, and you lamb lovers know what a distinct taste lamb has, it was very difficult to tell if we were eating lamb or beef, but either way, it was tough as hell, so who cares at that point.

So out of the three or so food servers who were serving us, Not One of them EVER asked us how anything was, not Once, ever, nor did we recieve a thank you for coming in from our server Tammy.

Here's a tip (because you know this was the only one you recieved from me) if your going to work in customer service, you better have a clue (or get one fast) what it is you are doing, it does go a long way.

I know I couldnt do this type of service, too many a$$holes to deal with, but some people can do it, and they love it, I applaud you, otherwise, please, find another occupation.

I did bring our experience this trip up with the manager very politely, there is no need to be rude or mean, just pointed out all the shortcomings of this trip, and stated that there are too many other business competing for business, and customer service (you know, the good kind) goes along way in my book.

Needless to say, wont be going back to Paymon's Las vegas anytime soon, will seek out other mediterranean establishments till we find a good one again

FOOD: 5/10
SERVICE: 2/10
PRICE/VALUE: 5/10

This is my favorite lounge spot in town! Tuesdays is locals night and they offer 1/2 off appetizers and cocktails. I love their Sailor Jerry Babylon Spice! This is a great place to chill with friends, hang out before going out, or even grab a great meal. Their food is awesome and has a great selection of Greek / Mediterranean and Italian fare.
This place is the worse Mediterranean food I ever had. The staff had no idea what they were serving and had the worse attitudes.

The place was clean.  The service overall, was good.   A little slow on seating you. The menu was more than just Mediterranean cuisine.  I came for the Gyros with tziki.  

I spent time on Greece.  I had authenticate gyros while in greece.  The gyros here were very authentic. The best I've had in vegas, except for the ones at the Greek festival.

LOVE THE GYROS!!

Very good. You've just got to give it a try. Both locations have really tasty food, but I like the "outdoor" area at the location on maryland best. Great salads, yummy fries, feta is great and best of all its within easy driving distance!

If you're looking for great Mediterranean food , this is the place !  So far, everything I've tried has been excellent. Good size portions so for me, there's always a " to-go " box for the next day's lunch !

Ordered the Gyros platter. The meat was absolutely tasteless - nothing like what I get from a "real" Greek restaurant in Chicago. Lentil soup was so -so. Could have been thicker. Calamari was the best part of the meal, although the sauce tasted like basic spaghetti sauce. Will not be returning.

Everything was delicious:  falafel were light; pita fluffy and tender; lamb gyro, Greek salad and rice pilaf perfectly seasoned and cooked; kale salad with goat cheese, pine nuts and dates a perfect combination; baklava just enough sweetness.  

Pepe, the waiter, was awesome!

I wanted to give this restaurant a better rating, as the food I ordered was good especially the lentil soup! The problem was the bread was not very fresh, and my suspicions were confirmed when some was sent home with us, and it molded 2 days later even after being kept in a sealed zip lock container.

The part that really set me off was the service we received. We tipped well, but we were treated poorly for no reason at all. We came here to kill some time before an appointment we had, and at the end when we were all finished I was asked if we needed anything else, and I mentioned just the check. We ended up waiting about 10-15 minutes after that to receive the check, with our waiter no where to be found.

I got up, and walked around looking for the waiter, with no luck. I looked through the window in the door, and had seen one of the waiters doing their nails in the back (with the same color hair and type), but I wasn't exactly sure it was her because I didn't think our waiter would be that rude.

Sure enough when our waiter came out about 10 minutes after that, her nails were shiny freshly done, and that's when I knew it was her. I'm not sure why she seemed to be so offended when I asked for the check, but that has never happened to me before. Like I said, we still even left her at least a 20% tip, but I don't think we will be coming back any time soon.

I had couple of my friends in town they wanted to try Pamon I tried it when it first open.  At that time the food was good and service was not bad. But yesterday when I took my friends there we had to wait by the door for at least 5 minutes there was no 
waiter no hostess nobody to great us or show us to our table. after 5 min I saw the 
waitress that was serving another table screaming from that table "you can seat anywher you want' that made me very upset in front of my guests.Then we sat .
we placed our orders I would not recomend the combination appetizer it is a big 
mess in a plate there is one  teaspoon of hummus, one teaspoon of every thing else 
there is four of us and 3 dolmas.Nobody enjoyed that appetizer.Don't ask me how every thing tasted I don't know because every thing was mixed up together. The food came. Thank God the food was not too bad.We had the ground beef and the chicken
kabob.I don't know if I would go back there or not. You have  judge this place your selves.I gave two stars because bad service is not acceptable.

I came to paymon's for the first time with two girlfriends. Both of my girlfriends eat at paymon's frequently and suggested that we go there before a concert and have dinner. When I got there we had a table and the waitress was nice. We ordered the combination plater and a side of athens fries. The food was absolutely amazing. Hummus, pita, stuffed grape leaves, cucumber yogurt dip,  and more came with this plater. Paymon's has various different food choices and anyone can enjoy eating there.  I plan on eating there again and I would recommend paymon's to anyone.
I wish it had negative stars!!! Ugly waitress! Horrible service! Horrible place to be at! Stay away from it! Won't believe me?! Try it!

The service is always great at Paymon's.  Love the salads, kabobs, and pitas. I haven't delved into any of the Italian dishes available.  In most cases I shy away from restaurants that try to do multiethnic dishes.  In this case I just stick to the original menu and love it.
The best middle eastern food I've tried in Vegas!

Asian woman at front EXTREMELY RUDE. I'm all about service and getting my pick up order wrong is already an upset. But to not apologize and to try to justify their mistake is ridiculous. I'm sure the food is good but the service is horrible as soon as you walk in.

I ordered Broiled Moroccan Ground Lamb Kabob. It came with rice and greek salad on the side. Even though it was a bit expensive, they gave plenty of food. Based on my limited experience, highly recommended.

this is where we go after we turn in any big paper, take exams and/or have oral arguments

basically, it's good enough to keep going back to

and worth of a celebration

try the mezze platter and sample everything!!!

Restaurant:
Ordered the all you can eat pasta with pesto and mushroom sauce which tasted ok but was swimming in sauce. Portion was big so there was no need for ordering seconds.

Thought for sure I can't go wrong with steak kabobs. But it just tasted like low quality meat which they didn't even bother to negate with flavor as it was pretty bland. And since when does pita and hummus not come with a damn kabob?? 

As unauthentic as it may be, I would prefer Daphne's.


Hookah Lounge:
This place is great for Happy Hour! Ambiance is nice, staff is friendly and pretty attentive, and you can't go wrong with cheap appetizers and drinks.
Amazing place! Happy hour at the lounge is amazing! 1/2 off drinks and hookah from 5 to 7 pm. Come see Abby, Ashley, Cynthia and Grabriel, the hookah master! Best Happy hour in town!!
Vegan options were clearly labeled. Staff was super nice and food was great.

Awesome mediterranean food!!! athens fries are yummm!! and the rice pudding definitely a must-have! the chicken kabobs were also pretty good! the helpings are pretty large though.. btw, love the ambience too!

I can eat mediterranean food everyday of the week, but not here. I have visited both locations a few times, but no more. The food is low quality and always has a funny taste. I ordered the vegetarian combination dish; it was the worst I have ever had. The saganaki was Ok; I prefer ones that aren't breaded. It's a waste of carbs and adds nothing desirable to the dish. My date had the Fettucini alfredo. He said it was fine. He said Macaroni grill had better pasta; It's sad when a budget italian restaurant serves better food.

Late one night, my husband and I were looking for Greek food and found this restaurant. It was late, after 8PM and there were few restaurants open.  We were pleasantly surprised to find they were open and serving food.  

We were seated in a quiet location within view of the hookah lounge.  The staff was attentive and helpful with explaining the menu.  The restaurant had a Persian flair and a romantic feel.  My husband and I felt like we were on a date.  It was nice.

The menu had various Mediterranean flavors - Greek, Persian, Italian, there was even Indian food on the menu!   Being familiar with Persian food and seeing this was probably their strength, I ordered the Koubideh plate.  My husband ordered the gyro.  The portions were huge and the food was delicious.  My husband liked the food I ordered more than his own.

We loved this place so much that we will be back to try more of the menu. I can't wait to visit Paymon's!

This is the BEST place for Mediterranean food in Las Vegas. Everything is good from the iced tea through the appetizer to the dessert. 

Started with the hummus. The bread was soft, warm and like a cloud in your mouth. Love the hot sauce. Had the falafel for the main course and it was crispy, tasty heaven. DON'T pass up the Athens fries!  I love this place.

I live in LA and I'm too familiar with the hookah scene and can distinguish good vs bad pretty well. Paymon's has great hookah especially when its happy hour time! If you don't smoke hookah, the happy hour is ridiculously amazing and the food is SOOO yummy. I love the Pesto Pizza and Athens fries! Good quality for a Good price. The drink menu is pretty great too! HOWEVER, this one time I went to Paymons (April 2012) I was with 6 other people and all but 1 of us were over 21. We wanted to smoke but the 1 guy who was under 21 was not allowed in the lounge area where you can smoke. We asked to speak to the manager and no exception was allowed since the bar is in the lounge area. Pretty lame since he was NOT going to drink or smoke, just came to eat in the lounge and watch us smoke. In anycase, just be aware its 21 & OVER for happy hour inside the lounge/smoking inside the lounge/drinking inside the lounge. Oh and happy hr is ONLY given inside the lounge : )

Came here for dinner while on a business trip, and my team and I were looking for a place to have dinner after work off the strip. I found this one yelp obviously. The place is sketch as hell in some random little plaza across from another sketch ass plaza. However, this place does not disappoint. I ordered the athens fries and was not disappointed. Honestly, they were the best fries I've ever had (plain fries) they are drizzled with rosemary and seasoning salt and come with some kind of dip for the best combination since peanut butter and jelly. The athens fries are a must have. I also got the steak kabob plate (medium) with a side of gyro meat. I didn't eat all of these things, but I will say the gyro meat was excellent, the steak kabob was a little bit plain compared to the gyro but still good. The grilled veggies that came with the kabob plate were quite the surprise. Overall I would definitely recommend this place for mediterranean food when in the Las Vegas area.

Fries with tadziki sauce. What else do you want. I love the fries here and I could eat them all day long. I like the gyros and kabobs because they taste really good. I would have to agree with some of the yelpers that this place is a bit expensive. It is a great break from your typical lunch fare but eat here for lunch everyday and you might just break the bank.

So paymons is an absolutely incredible lounge. It has a vibe you cannot replicate anywhere else. The service is incredible. I have been coming here regularly for 3 years, and my good friend Jaime is only here on Saturdays but we are struggling right now.

We have by far the worst bartender imaginable named Valerie. She is horrific. She constantly complains while she is working, she tries to overcharge customer, she does not know which drinks she is making more often than not. She is god awful.

Do not let her deter you from coming here. Everyone else works their ass off and will give you phenomenal service. However, she is truly the worst. I cannot wait until they find a replacement and I doubt she will be here much longer. 

I love Paymons and I will always come here whenever I am in town, but I cannot wait to order a Maccallan 18 and cheers to when she is fired. 

Come on down and have an awesome time! Plz do not let her horrific service deter you!

I went to this location a few days ago, and was pleasantly surprised. I've been to a few hookah places before, and it can be dirty, overpriced, hokey, or just off. The decor inside is warm and welcoming. It has beautiful gold Moroccan style lamps overhead and an eclectic mix of furniture and stools next to the booths. It reminded me of  place i'd see in NYC, kind of boho-chic-eclectic. It was dark and welcoming. My friend ordered the iced hookah and I believe we had the jasmine-mint. The waitress was attentive and came around with the different flavors in these little intricate silver boxes, and the hookah was awesome. We came during happy hour, so it was cheaper and oh so relaxing. I'd recommend it if you just want to relax and let go and simmer down from the day.  Definitely something unexpected, but very pleasant.
Excellent food and very nice writers Charles so polite man I really appreciate it for service
Excellent service and awesome food. A fine array of vegetarian and non-veg options. Their pita bread is to die for; we couldn't just have enough of it.
Go during happy hour.  Prices are very reasonable. Portions are also very large. I recommend sharing dishes so everyone can taste a variety of foods.
Great ambience with good food. There was not a lot of hookah choices at this place thats the only reason i am giving this a four star. Overall worth giving a try.

I eat here frequently, due to non-restaraunt factors. It has an attached hookah lounge, which can entertain intimate groups who can chose to smoke either the hookah or cigarette while having a drink, and then move on to dinner. Their fare is solid, though not spectacular. They have a variety that can appease even the most finnicky or allow one to feel adventurous. They are open late and they have a decent turkish coffee, which for some is a substitute for sleep. 

Service is hot and cold, normally good, but one or two of the waitstaff could stand a stint in rehab. There aren't many Mediteranean Restaurants in Las Vegas of note, but this would be one of them.
Calamari with red sauce & spinach pie was very good. The 2 Greek side salads & veggies were an unexpected pleasant surprise. No leftovers, yum!

Fantastic food, warm atmosphere and great service from our server Andrew. For appetizers we had the fried cheese and the vegetarian stuffed grape leaves, both were excellent. The menu is impressive and includes an entire page of hot tea selections and I went with the delicious ice tea for my beverage and the server was very attentive and kept the refills coming. For my entree I ordered the gyro platter that was served with a house salad and rice, it was amazing and there was plenty left over to bring home. Overall it was a very impressive dinning experience.

Everytime I've left Paymon's I'm full, happy, and have lots of leftovers. The menu is very large as are the portions. Impressive tea list. My BF and I usually split the gyro salad and the chicken cabob plate. Both are excellent and huge. Great 25% off for locals special Wednesdays. Took my family from out of town here last week- everyone loved it, even my sister's vegan boyfriend. Poked my head in the hookay lounge/bar area- very cute..  Highly recommend.

This has been one of my favorite restaurants for over 15 years. The food is always amazing, as well as service. Some great dishes to try are the saganaki, lentil soup, athens fries, & the gyro salad. If you try one restaurant in Vegas, make it this one.

Saw them in a brochour at our hotel. Stopped in for a great lunch while on vacation in Vegas. GPS gave us bad directions, but we reached not long after. The starters were more then enough for me and by husband, and the all the mediterranean entrees were satisfying, They also have a hookah smoke lounge next door.

Our family was a group of 7 on this trip. We went to this place because we are Persian and wanted to have some good Persian food. What a shame! I couldn't even tell what  cuisine they really serve! The menu had Italian, Greek,  Persian and Lebanese  items on it so I wasn't sure what meal was gonna work best. I ordered the "koobideh" since they named it the Persian way and expected it to be a Persian kabob plate. What I received was a "non cooked at all" Arabic kabob. I wish it looked as good as some Arabic kabobs! It clearly had no resemblance to Persian kabobs and was so pink I got sick looking at it.  As I'm pregnant I had to send the food back to cook my kabobs longer. Our server could not be found for 10 minutes so my husband went to their kitchen to find someone and we were told they will remake mine and send it back. I waited for 25 minutes while our family ate their mediocre food. We received the bill and I asked the server to either cancel my food or pack it to go. She had no idea where my food was or anything. She brought a food back with her and gave it to me with no bag or silverware. We asked them to call a cab for us and she said: please wait outside for your cab. This is in Las Vegas! In the heat! Not welcoming at all. Don't go there if you want good food and a knowledgable server that can explain your options to you.

I went again with my friend who said this place was great. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't great. I had the salmon kebab, which wasn't on the menu and the waitress was surprised because she said they definitely have it. When I got it, it wasn't on a skewer, so it wasn't really a kabob. It was just put on the plate in chunks and had a weird dark artificial-looking pink color. It was just OK, but not worth the whopping $17 something. The rice was good and I liked the cold cucumber soup. I won't be back though and won't be going by my friend's recommendations any more because we definitely have different taste buds.

It was our first time and we love it ! It tasted like authentic Mediterranean food ! We order the veggie platter (grape leaves , falafels ,  tabouli , pitta bread , sauces for dipping ) it was delicious ! Then we order the chicken kabob plate / rice / salad  was so flavorful too  and the tea was so refreshing ! They didn't have music  or maybe they did but not like at other Mediterranean places / love Arabic music on the background but over all it was a great experience , our waiter was very nice and made sure we were ok  we sat "outside " it's not outside but it's feel like you are , they have a fountain / in front of it a hookah lounge , definitely will come back again , the prices were good too

get the hookah wings!!!!!!!!! this place is 
p-e-r-f-e-c-t, the staff is attentive and respectful, the hookah is fresh, this was my first time here and definitely not my last, there really isn't much more to say than, this is the best hookah lounge in nevada.oh and not to mention the first and finest hookah lounge in the united states!!!!!

One of my favorite things about Paymon's is their wonderful selection of teas -- more than 20 from half a dozen different varieties (I'm partial to the Moroccan rose and mint). There's also Moroccan and Lebanese beers available, which is far more exciting than the usual Blue Moon/Newcastle offering. And they're only slightly more expensive than domestic beers. 

Food-wise, I've only ever had their chicken dishes (kabobs and the like) and I thought the meat was well seasoned, moist and tender. The rice is always a little bland; I find myself making vigorous use of the salt and pepper shakers. 

For night owls, the hookah lounge next door has a great late-night happy hour, perfect for that 2am mixed drink to top off your night (or your sobriety).

Came here on a sunday afternoon.Only 3-4 people in there. 

Got the gyro plate and was not impressed. It just wasn't very appetizing.

If you want something to fill your stomach when you are drunk, this might do it as there was a good amount of food on my plate.

Very good food...BUT......seems to be not so clean...dirty silverware and just has that smell and feel of a typical Vegas employees that are "less than sanitary"....food was good but just seems to be a chance of getting something you did not want.

Not impressed. My friend ordered Gyro Salad.  Beautiful. I was shocked she didn't receive grilled pita along with it! We ordered their spicy fries. Excellent. I was looking for Souvlaki on the menu. NADA. I settled for 3 Dip Platter: Baba Ganoush, Hummus and Lebni. Baba Ganoush was tasty. Hummus tasted burnt. Like garbanzos had stuck to the bottom of pot while cooking. Lebni...meh.

I won't return.

Consistently good food! I eat here at least once a month.

The Baba Ganouj is some of the best I've had, with a dark, smokey taste. Served with fresh, hot bread...yummmmmm.

The Spanikopita is beautifully spiced - a must for any fan of the dish.
The Chicken Fesenjan is hit-or-miss, (depending on the chef,  perhaps?) Spectacular when it hits; only okay when it misses. My friends, who are into this kinda thing, love the Baked Kibbe.

The salads are always fresh and plentiful, and the Athens Fries are a treat.

For bevvies, I like the passion ffruit iced tea to start, and the Lychee Martini to finish up.

Pros: Excellent variety of good tasting food, really friendly and helpful staff

Cons: Can get busy, waiting for drinks in the hookah bar can take some time

Details: I have been to the hookah lounge a lot more than I have eaten here and between the two I prefer the restaurant. Overall the staff is super nice and the food is great. Easy to drive by if you are going fast on Maryland but it has a good size parking lot. Like I said above, it can get busy during the most obvious times.

I've been a big fan of Paymons for a long time, but always for lunch.  Just recently I tried their dinner service (served until 1 AM).  We've been looking for a good, unique place to eat after hours - someplace that doesn't serve the usual pub food - and I think we've found it with Paymons.

We were seated in the atrium, which was nice because we could enjoy the music from their Hookah Lounge next door without dealing with all of the "riff raff".  Fair warning - it is a club / lounge atmosphere.  

We started with hummus and pita bread, at $5.95.  The chicken pesto panini ($9.95) was excellent, and as always the Athens Fries are so good that we get one order per person, because no one wants to share.  

The Gyro (around $11.95) was also delicious, though it had (in our opinion) way too many onions.  

Service was good, not great.  Our server was attentive, but not proactive.  We asked, she did ... but she didn't think ahead ("oh, they're out of bread.  I'll bring some more").

All in all, we were very happy with our choice.  Paymons offers reasonable value for the dollar - not great, not bad.  About what you would expect for what you get.  Especially when you consider how good the food is.

I love this place because it's great for people who love Mediterranean food, but I think it's also a great spot if you aren't so adventurous. I am the former, but I feel confident that I can bring friends or family if they aren't willing to venture too far outside of their comfort zone.

First, I always always always get the dip plate: Hummus, Yogurt dip and Baba ganoush. It's so delicious I'm salivating just writing it out. 

Lunch options, I love getting the greek salad with gyro meat or anything with their delicious french fries. This past time that I went for dinner, our waiter recommended the Fesenjan dish (chicken dish, pomegranate + almond(?) sauce). It was so delicious that I ate every single bit of it and now I want to go back and ask that waiter to marry me.

Even if the customer service was crap, I would still go back for the yummies, but luckily, everything else is on par for them, too. They also have a great selection of spices to buy if you want to try some new flavors in the kitchen.

I ordered the chicken tandoori with basmati rice and I was super disappointed. The chicken was over cooked and dry with no flavor and so was the rice, I had to ask for some sauce to put on the rice to make it edible. The waiter brought some curry sauce which wasn't the best but better than eating dry tasteless rice and chicken. They got a 2 star because the waiter tried to please me. No I won't be back.

I was surprised to experience the food at this place after having seen such high yelp reviews. Maybe I'm spoiled where I come from, but the falafel sandwich I had at Paymon's was fine. The service was average as well. That's one thing that's missing in Vegas is a great falafel place. Well, maybe I just didn't look in the right places.
Great Ambiance, went strictly for the Hooka and the booze. Comfortable lounge and eclectic music. Waiters and waitresses were very friendly and knowledgeable. Great for small groups.

My friend and I both ordered gyros with Athens fries. The food was ok; certainly not the best gyros in Vegas, and to be honest not even the best on Maryland Parkway. 

Unfortunately what I'll remember from this visit isn't the food, it's the complete lack of any type of service. The waiter took our order ... and we didn't see him again until he picked up the plates and simultaneously dropped off the check (someone else delivered the food). No-one asked how our food was or if we needed anything (which we did), nor did anyone refill our drinks or ask us if we wanted coffee or desert (which we did). 

I guess business must be really good if they can afford to ignore their customers. 

Needless to say, neither my friend or I will be back.

The food for the most part is very good, it's not authentic but I never expect it to be at any "mediterranean" place. Nothing will ever taste like grandma's and I have learned to accept that. However I do think the Dolmas with meat are pretty on point but it is hard to screw that up. I do love the athens fries aswell. The best part of paymons is happy hour. I can come here during happy hour with a couple friends have some food, drinks and hookah and our total bill will come to $60 or so. Do remember this is not authentic mediterranean food, I took my dad here many years ago and he had a fit  the Shawarma was not to his liking!
Good Mediterranean food.  Decent prices.  Nice Medierranean grocery store connected to it and a Hookah lounge also connected to it.  Waits can be long sometime for a table.

Just ended up here late night because other places were closed. Had falafel pita bread with Tahini sauce. At first it looked little expensive but looking at the serving size, one wrap with one side should be enough for 2 people unless you are super hungry.
Oh, don't forget to order their house fries on the side as they are really well made.
The food was good, I tried lentil soup and grilled salmon and everything was very tasty. The place is nicely decorated and clean. The service was efficient.
This place is great!  Everybody should try it. I got a gyro and it was the best that I've ever had. The service was top notch!

Was picking up an order to go and the hostess seemed to think that me asking for cutlery and a bag so the soup wouldn't spill was too much to ask for. She snarked back and said "Aren't you delivering to a house?" It doesn't matter what or where I'm taking this food to, if I asked for something, please give it to me without an attitude. She then proceeded to talk about me to the other server in front of me before I left.
Great food. I enjoyed the lamb and chicken the most. Try something new there I think the experimenting with new flavors will be very rewarding

My salad was just terrible for the first time in this place. I was very disappointed. The ambiance, however, is always great. My night can't be ruined with staff like this.  Manager Julia was the problem solver I expected. She is as smart as she is pretty. Nikki was as good as the apple tiny she was wonderful. Jaime is the best hookah master. You must come!!!  These people know what service means and are only there to make your night better.

It's a bit small and stuffy inside, but to look at it positively, the place is very "cozy".  Probably not the best place to go with such a big group of people (we had about 12) since the table space can get very cluttered and passing the hookah pipe over can be a game of twister.

Huge (I'm talking like 50 flavors no joke) selections of hookah flavors can be a bit overwhelming, but I love the fact that we can mix and match them however we want.  I thought choosing a hookah flavor was tough, try the tea menu!  They also have a pretty decent selections of wine plus beer, a full bar, they have it all!

I had a plate of combination appetizer which was delicious, but I wish they gave us some pita bread so that I could've cleaned the hummus, baba ganoush and other flavorful things that were on that plate.  My favorite was the FRIES.  You MUST have FRIES here!  It is probably the best I've ever had, putting Boiling Crab fries down to second place!

This is my FAVORITE place to eat in Las Vegas! I come out there a few times a year and always make it a point to visit Paymon's. 
They have THE BEST FRENCH FRIES I HAVE EVER HAD!
Their Athens Fries are SO amazing!! I could eat them every day, 
They have this amazing dipping sauce too...oh!! SOOO good!
I am a Vegetarian so I usually get their combination plate with stuffed grape leaves, falafel, yogurt-cucumber dip,  baba ganosh and Athens fries. You get so much food for the money. Definitely enough for 2 meals. 
They have 2 locations in Las Vegas and they stay open pretty late.
If you are a vegetarian I highly recommend this place, All dishes are labeled Vegetarian and Vegan. 
This place ROCKS! Go for those fries....you will love them!

I enjoy Gyros for lunch and stopped by to order one to go.  While the taste was "good" it had to be one of the worst Gyros I've had due in large part to the skimpy portion of meat.  This Gyros was basically a salad wrapped in a pita which included a hint of meat at the bottom.  Gyros I've enjoyed at other restaurants are packed full of the tasty meat.  So for $10 your money is better spent elsewhere.
I ordered the spaghetti bolognese for takeout. it was alright. I could have made it myself. It was nothing special for $15.

Paymon's was fantastic.  A diverse menu for diverse eaters.  Met the needs of our large group.  2 in the group are vegan and found plenty to eat.  The Moroccan mint tea was fantastic!  The fries and dipping sauce was unique and delicious.  I had the "meatloaf" with pine nuts in the middle.  Flavorful and a huge portion!  Would def go again.

Ate at this place for the first time and I will be back. I had the chicken scallopini, and I got some garlic bread (extra) but it was all super. I think 13 bucks for the entrée and a dollar or two for the garlic bread. My friend had the spaghetti Bolognese and that was great! There was plenty of meat sauce too! His meal came with garlic bread.
Anyways, would totally go back and WILL go back. Thanks Lorraine for telling me about this place.
Oh one more thing, Our server was Korissa. Would not have been the same without her. She is super great. There if you need her and yet not all over you. Thanks Korissa!

Had the gyro to go and their fries. Yummy stuff, a little salty but still good. Eat it with a bit taziki and a drizzle of their hot sauce. Friendly hostess. Yummy fries, but definitely try to eat them while they are still hot b/c they aren't as good then they cool off.

It pains me to give Paymon's three stars, because the food deserves 5-stars. This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants ever, anywhere. The people are great and the food is wonderful to almost every sense... beautiful, aromatic, and not that expensive!

They recently added italian food and surprisingly it is very good. Generally, jack of all trades = master of none, but apparently this wasn't far enough a stretch for them. 

The reason they got 4 stars instead of five is for two reasons... one is that they used to have a fantastic "best in the world" falafel recipe. It was the best in any city I've visited. Unfortunately, they CHANGED IT. The falafel is now bland and pseudo-tasteless. You eat it for the sake of eating it and not for the sensory experience it was before.

Second, they have some ridiculous policies... for example, they do not accept take out orders after 8:00pm even though they are open until 1am. I assume this is because they are trying to mitigate "friendly fraud" ordering, but if you're a regular customer and you're willing to hand over your credit card, THIS SHOULD NOT HAPPEN.

Third, one night I called and asked what time they closed. They said they were open until 1am. I drove 1/2 way across town to get there only to have some newbie tell me that they don't accept orders after 12:15... (would have been excellent information before I drove over!)

Anyway, with the exception of the falafel they have now, it is a delight! Still one of my favorite places. I only wish I could give it 5 stars.

UPDATE 2.19.2010: I continue to dine here and the food continues to be excellent. Had a wonderful amazing server the other night. I wish I had gotten her name because she deserves mention here. This makes up for this older blonde lady server who works nights and is unattentive and rude to the point you want to punch her in the face. The falafel is still severely lacking compared to the fantastic recipe they used to have. I was wrong before when I said it was now pseudo-tasteless, because it is not pseudo, it is full-on tasteless (LOL). Also, I should mention that their hummus and kabobs are excellent.

Happened to be in Vegas this past weekend for work. Happened to stumble on Paymon's from a friends recommendation. We ordered the pesto pizza and fries, which were very good. We had the Cynthia was our server  and she was absolutely awesome.  She even made our hookah! One stop shop! I'll def check out this place again.

I'm amazed I haven't reviewed this place yet since I go here so often, strange. 

Anywho, I'm knocking it down a couple of stars because of the last time Matt & I dined here. 

Got seated quickly inside, and made our orders after getting our drinks. I got the bowl of lentil soup sans cheese and a falafel pita with hummus and fries. Matt got the unlimited pasta bowl, and his first round was bowtie pesto. 

Service was alright although our waitress was a total ninja and disappeared a lot so if we actually did need things it would have been very difficult to find her. 

My food was very good, although I think that the soup is a bit overpriced but still very yummy. I'm not a fan of their hummus at all but when it's wrapped inside the pita it's good, and the fries are always bits of pure heaven. Matt however, wasn't a fan of his pasta and had half of the big bowl left. He still wanted a second bowl of something different, and asked if I could take the rest of the pesto home as leftovers since he didn't like it. The waitress said due to policy they can't box up the first round of pasta. 

Okay, I would understand if Matt didn't completely finish his second bowl and kept asking for to-go boxes, but come on. I can't believe that they just wasted all of that food that I would have gladly ate for lunch the next day. They need to change the policy that you can only take home one portion or something. That policy just totally puts me off from coming back as soon as I usually do. 

Overall the experience was alright but wasting that food is upsetting. I guess from now on we won't be so adventurous with our first bowl. The food is always good usually though and the service is alright (although I can tell you a funny story about a waitress who kept blindly spilling water on my friend throughout the night - too hilarious) but I don't think I'll be back for awhile.

Awesome ambience, good music, awesome food, great service, and did I already mention how awesome the food is? We ordered the gyros platter, athen's fries, eggplant panini, and mozzarella cheese sticks. They have a decent to large serving of food that I had to share mine. The beef and lamb of the gyros plate was heavenly soft and flavorful. I love how they seasoned their athens fries and the dip was yummy too. The fries alone will make me come again.

My friend also introduced me to hookah here. It was nice and it smells really good.

This place is so much fun. The atmosphere is fun, if you're over 21 they have a hookah lounge attached. The food is authentic and they have many options for vegan or vegetarian. Our waitress was Beatrice and she was so sweet and took care of us very well.

Went here for an interview luncheon with co-workers. Overall experience was on point. 
I hadn't been here for a couple years, so I was pretty excited when everyone decided on this place to chat with the interviewee. Noticed our waitress was one I saw way back when... Usually has her hair in a braid, and goes down to mid-back or something. She's still nice and so was the guy helping her out for the lunch rush. They checked on us throughout our meal. 
Food was as good as I remembered. Hahaha... Only detail I forgot was the size of a portion. Y'all know that I had a to-go box at the end of the meal.

I was kind of bummed.  I figured after a great lamb-burger on my previous visit, that the falafel would have to be really good.  They weren't bad, but they didn't live up to my expectations.  They were GREEN inside (from the parsley--NOT mold).  They were kind of pasty and bland.  The iced tea is still outstanding, though..  I'm still not completely deterred--I'll give them another try, because I want to try either the lamb kebabs or the chicken fesenjan.

The food here is amazing . 5 stars!!! I had dinner with my girl and had the combination patter with a beet salad , the beets are incredible . The pita bread hmmmmm if come to vegas this place is a must !!!

I tend to go here for lunch with my co workers pretty often and i think they have some great food.  

The athens fries are delicious!! Love this stuf.  But some have tried and called them to salty which i can understand.  to each their own. ( and more orgasmic fries for me)  

Usually when i go i get the indian curry cause i'm an addict for spicy food. and man is it good but stupidly filling.  I walk out in a firy ball of food coma everytime i eat it.

What I like the most about this restaurant is that it's open 24 hours, has many vegetarian and vegan options and has great orzo salad. However, the food is not always great. Last night, I got two falafel pita sandwiches to go and they were very dry. My husband and I LOVE falafel sandwiches and we always get them at Greek restaurants. I am not sure if they fried the falafels twice or if the falafels were just not fresh, but it was hard to eat the sandwiches. In addition, they were very stingy with the lettuce and tomatoes in the sandwiches, which could have helped a little bit with the dryness. Also, they over-package everything. They wrap the pita sandwich with foil, then they put the wrapped sandwich in a paper baggie, then they put the baggie in a Styrofoam to-go box and last, they put the box in a bag, 4 different things to get a sandwich to-go. A bit wasteful in my opinion. They do something similar with their fries. They put them in a paper bag and the bag in a box. They also give you way too many to-go sauces, which they usually also put inside of another to-go box. I would like to continue going to this place because I'm in the neighborhood and I appreciate the late dining option. Hopefully, next time my food is better.

I'm not one to normally talk bad about a business online as I've been in the hospitality industry for years and I'm normally pretty understanding and try to see things from a service standpoint.  However,  after my experience last night, I felt the need to post something. I went to Paymon's last night for the first time with my fiancée and will not be returning. We loved the atmosphere and the hookah lounge but the service was subpar and in attentive at best. The worst part of our experience was the food poisoning that I got from Paymon's food and the rest of the night that I spent in my bathroom throwing up the gyro meat and dolmas that I ate. Beware of Paymon's. Something in their kitchen was not up to health code. Based on the average tasting gyro meat, I'm guessing it was expired, or the cleanliness in the kitchen is as subpar as the service.

Although the look of this strip mall restaurant is less than attractive - the atmosphere inside, the staff and the food were all amazing. 

Recommended by a friend - and we weren't let down. Our server gave his recommendations and we took his word and were not disappointed.

Holy cow!  I ordered the veggie kabob for lunch and I couldn't even eat half of it.  So much goodness!  Generous portions of veggies (the mushrooms, peppers & onions were wonderful!  Zucchini too, just not a fav of mine.  I like it, don't love it.) and it also comes with hummus, nice warm pita bread, and rice.  I was stuffed and still had more than half left over.  Yum!

The food is great and the service is even better. The servers seem to really care that you are having a great time and that the food is to your liking. Gyro plates are hands down great, and their fries are amazing!!
First time here and I'm impressed! Portions are ENORMOUS! Food quality is great! Will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu!

My girlfriend and I came for the first time and we thought the food was amazing.
Recommend this place

I read the reviews and I thought to go there with my family. We were 8 people and they put us in a tight table. Service was prompt and they brought the appetizer soon enough. It was ok but not great. We tried the combo plate. It did take longer than usual to bring the entree. We had ordered the kobideh, chicken kabob and steak salad. The food was awful. The only thing barely eatable was the kobideh. Oh my God, this was as bad as Persian food as I have had. Everyone else in the party felt the same way. Service was good and the prices were ok, but not for the food they served.

Handa down BEST Greek food I've had outside of Europe!  Fast ans friendly customer service.   Thwy even peovide 50% off discount for Veterans Day aa a special! !  If you don't go anywhere you have to stop by this restaurant and have lunch or dinner

party of 4, dinner on a monday nite. two of us had the moussaka, it was good but not great. food could have been hotter in temp. cuz had the curry chicken, other had the pesto pasta. both said they were good but nothing special. athens fries and hummus were good and i do reccomend for a starter. service was average. wait staff was nice but blah. unable to have mojitos because bar had no rum, after they were reccomended by the staff. thought that was strange. overall for us, just ok.
AMAZING!!!  Hardly ever leave reviews for places but this place is just outstanding!   Seriously planning on coming back a few more times before we leave.  Wish I could cook like this- so yummy!

The food and atmosphere was perfect. The hookah blends were smooth and flavorful, especially the French Toast and Lemon drop mix. The kabobs were great, especially the ground beef.. A must stop every visit to Vegas.

I first visited Paymon's about 4 years ago when a bunch of us went out for a friends Birthday. I must admit when I first saw the menu and prices I was a little worried. We ordered the pita bread with Hummus for an appetizer which was so delicious it was gone within minutes. I ordered Tandoori chicken with rice and an apple martini. The portion size is amazing and while it is a little pricey it is well worth it! The wait staff was very friendly and the environment is just so relaxing. If you haven't  tried Mediterranean cuisine, your missing out! Followed up by some time in the Hookah Lounge makes for a great night out. :)

Good enough food. Like a Mediterranean chili's.

Not the most authentic which is a good thing for some. 

Americanized mediterranean food made needlessly bland.

Their falafel and hummus was pretty good 7/10. 

But Kabob koobideh which is one of the tastiest dishes was under seasoned and bland.

Fresh good quality ingredients let down by management decisions and a staff that doesn't know their food well enough to get it right.

My husband and I come here once to twice a week. We will not be coming back or recommending them ever again. We walked in and Ahmed felt that he should school us on the signage about the right place to stand to be seated,... Scolding us both as he seated us. Properly chastized, we were greeted by Anthony our server. We ordered the combination platter (which I have ordered just this month, 3 times) to be told that a mannequin sized serving of taboulis is normal, and if I want more I will be charged. Then he proceeds to argue with me, in front of the tables of strangers around us watching. I then asked another server for a manager, and was told they didnt have one....Excellent customer service! After I have almost finished my meal, Anthony brings me a tiny plastic sauce cup of taboulis, and says, if I bring more I'll have to charge you. It seemed to have a "creamy mystery sauce " floating on top. I didn't touch it. HORRENDOUS customer service! BAD manners, and self importance are not good skills for a server, which was reflected in his tip. We are typical 20% and uppers, but not this time. We will never come back. Horrible experience! Don't eat here if you want to enjoy yourself. There are tons of restaurants that have great food, and excellent customer service...Let's support those establishments.
Gluten free friendly. Best crispy salads in town. Hummus delicious they brought me cucumbers instead of pita bread. You must try the rice pudding amazing creamy delicious

We were going to an evening lecture at UNLV and wanted a casual dinner, but more than fast food. Our friends had eaten at Paymon's years ago and wanted to try it again. At our friend's suggestion, we ordered saganaki to start. Our server, Anna, was very attentive and very patient. She explained to us novices that saganaki is keflotori cheese. Wikipedia told me that is deep fried and then set on fire. Apparently, they used to set it on fire at the table but the fire department had some silly objection to that practice. So now it is set on fire in the kitchen. Even without the drama of the fire, the dish, served with really good pita bread, was delish!! Based on some Yelp reviews, we also ordered a side of the Athens fries as a side dish. OUTSTANDING!! They come with a mustard based dipping sauce, also excellent but not needed since the fries themselves were so tasty. For a main course I ordered the chicken kabob. It came with a special rice (very yummy!!) and a Greek salad on the side. The chicken consisted of large chunks of white meat (usually not my favorite) that must have been marinated in something that made them juicy and flavorful. The grilled veggies on the plate were also great. The portions were huge. The next time I come here (and it will be soon), I will share an appetizer and a main course.

Ok, I was invited last night for dinner around 6:00 pm, parking was available as it is Tuesday mid September, the place had available tables for six people, the ambiance was below average and the place ok clean. Now comes the food, we ordered different types of dinner items, basically Kobiedeh Kaboob, lamb Kaboob variety, the minced meat type and the chunks of meat the other type. Kobiedeh came with white rice and I would rate it as average at best, the Lamb Kaboob came with brown rice and was basically horrible, the meat was rubbery and even with the knife difficult to slice and very chewy, the barbecued onions and peppers were burned beyond recognition.  the salad that came with dish was not fresh as the lettuces was old. I was disappointed since my wife was always praising this place. I would say service was acceptable level. I have been there once before and thought it was average for lunch time, but yesterday it was the first during dinner. I would not go there again.

What we ordered (ranked from best to worst):

Athens fries - These were really tasty.  They come with the Paymon's special seasoning (more about that in a second) and a dipping sauce that tastes a little bit like thousand island but not as relish-y.  I usually only really like shoestring fries, but even though these were medium cut, they were so crispy that I still gobbled them down.  The seasoning is SO GOOD - it has like ten thousand ingredients and tastes a little bit like old bay but without the background shrimp-y flavor.  If for no other reason, you should try this place just to try that seasoning.  You can buy it there and bring it home with you too, to sprinkle into your mouth at your leisure.

Hummus and baba ganoush (sp?) - they have a comp dip plate for 6 bucks, and we chose the hummus and the baba. It comes with a side of pita.  The hummus was okay (not bad but nothing special), but the baba was really good.  

Grilled salmon mediterannean platter - I'm not sure if this is what it was called, but this was pretty much just grilled salmon (really tender and not overcooked), with this "vermicelli pilaf" thing which was pretty much seasoned yellow rice, and a side salad.  The salad had lots of cheese on it, so if you don't like cheese be careful.  

Combo kabob platter - 3 kabobs - lamb, beef, and chicken, + the vermicelli pilaf (see above), and some sort of rice pilaf + side salad.  The rice pilaf was really good - it's a mix between white and yellow basmati rice.  The lamb kabob was SO GOOD - the lamb tasted like the gyro lamb meat that you get at the good halal carts in new york.  The beef was okay, though a bit chewy, and chicken was pretty tender.  

Tiramisu - We actually didn't order this, but the waitress gave it to us for free since she felt bad about having us wait so long for the check.  The tiramisu is homemade, and has a bit more rum flavor than most of your average tiramisus, and is pretty good.  I think the baklava is also supposed to be really good, although we didn't try it.

The main thing about this place (besides the magical spice seasoning) is that the portions are GIGANTIC.  I think one of those platters could easily feed two people with big appetites, no joke.  Given the portion sizes, I think the prices are pretty decent.  Also, they have one of those cool dessert trays (like the ones you see at steak houses) that they bring around so you can see all the desserts on offer.  And our waitress was really nice.  And that spice....mmm.
SO All I have to say is that I ate so much of the all you can eat pasta, they should of rubbed me down with butter as I tried to squeeze out the double doors.
