It was very dark! I couldn't see what I was eating. I almost tripped on the way out.
The best! My husband and I go every Friday for lunch. The service is great and the food is even better.

Came here for dinner and hookah through suggestion from a friend. Didn't think I would a good spot off the strip especially at a Mediterranean restaurant. Got the starter! Was so good! The fries were prop top 5 fries we've had. Loved it! The salmon kabob was delicious as well. Pretty cute lounge spot for hookah. Lots of options including Italian, Indian, and Mediterranean. Musty try! Happy I had someone suggest this! Will come again.

My boyfriend and I were returning from our Minnesota road trip and stopped off in Vegas for a bite. Paymon's was opened late and Greek food is appealing to me at any hour of the day. 

The cafe side was closed, so we went through the lounge area to the left of the cafe. It was darker? inside than it was outside so upon entering, I had to give my tired eyes a moment to adjust. A door to the left led to a hookah bar. No one was there to greet us so we grabbed a table in the dining room and waited. A server came in from the back to hand us menus and water. 

The menu had a lot of vegetarian options, which included three or four pita sandwiches, but I decided to go the deconstructed route and got the vegetarian platter. It came with hummus, baba ganoush, tzatziki, stuffed grape leaves, tabouli, four falafel balls, and a generous serving of seasoned fries. Additionally, there were three dipping sauces and warm pita bread. Everything tasted fine until I got to one of the dipping sauces. There was an odd, sharp flavor to it and took two tries before realizing something had spoiled. I didn't bother to ask for a replacement because I figured they would give me another scoop from the bad batch.

Service was good. I had to request a water refill, but after that our server came by frequently to top us off. It was so dark inside, I'm sure it was difficult for him to spot an empty glass.

We visited in June on an afternoon that reached 117 degrees. We were promptly greeted and asked if we wanted to eat in the dining room or the atrium? We didn't quite know what they meant by "atrium", but we're adventurous, so that's what we chose. It's a dining area that looks like it was between 2 buildings and they enclosed it overhead with glass. There was a door to the kitchen and a door to the hookah lounge which was the building "next door". The decor is kind of dated looking, but what pleased me so much was I got to enjoy the feeling of dining al fresco without melting in the heat!

We ordered the flaming saganaki, a very salty super oily delish cheese that is lit on fire to crust the top. It was very good and I felt like there was enough of the warm pita slices served with it. Sometimes I feel places skimp. We also ordered Athens fries. They were super seasoned and I wish I had more room in my tummy to stuff them all in! Loved them! My husband and I both ordered the gyros. The meat was perfectly seasoned, the tomato and onion were very fresh and crisp, and I thought the tzatziki was perfectly tangy and plentiful. They make their pitas every day. The gyro was HUGE! And I stuffed myself. I'm talking sauce all over my face and contented noises coming out of me!

The kicker for me was we told the server where we were from and compared our fav Greek place in Denver to Paymon's, which proved to be much better. After a pleasant quick conversation he went for our check and came out with 2 slices of baklava, packaged to go (no styrofoam!), on the house. While my husband doesn't like baklava, both of us were charmed. I love places that know how to create loyal patrons who spread the word!!!!  We will definitely return!

This place is delicious, try the Kabob plater OMGGG AMAZING, especially the Lamb. 

downfall- the greek salad, is not a greek at all, they need to work on this, last time I checked Greeks don't use lettuce and mozzarella cheese on their salad. Where is the feta?
They have fesenjan and that's hard to find. Athen fries are wonderful here! Hooka lounge is a great evening on the sideline from the strip. Cheers!

Wife and I went on a Saturday for a quick late-night bite...restaurant side was not too busy, about 6-8 people total. The night started out brightly, as we ran into Ahmad, a former student of mine...full of personality. The waitress took our order as we chatted with him (2 gyros and an order of Athens fries). Our friend eventually clocked out, and we waited, and waited, and waited. Another couple came in (we were the only 4 people in our section), got their apps, and then their food. We finally got our waitress's attention, and asked, "what about ours?" She asked if our server knew we hadn't gotten it yet, so we let her know (again) that she was our server. She was dumbfounded and had completely forgotten about us, even though she passed us several times on her way to the table who got all of their food before us, despite coming in at least 30 minutes after us. We did get our food for free (almost an hour after coming in, so we took it to go), but this shouldn't happen in a busy restaurant, much less an almost empty one. To top it off, the gyros were nowhere near as good as the ones from the Great Greek...very little sauce, very few veggies, basically just a big pile of meat on pita bread. Will not be coming back.

It was ok.. I seemed as if it was American/ Mediterranean fusion spot. Im so sorry.. im not trying to sound rude or anything.. Dont get me wrong its good. It does the job if your feeling like you must have Mediterranean food. The hummus was yummy so was the Greek salad. I got the trio combo.. it comes with chix, beef and lamb, with some rice and pita. And the side of tazikie sauce (not sure if I spelled that right) :) any who.. the chix was cool, nothing big just cool grilled chix. The lamb was tasty but the beef was to salty :( the rice looked like it was over cooked. It was missing a few things. I eat Mediterranean food a lot and im use to certain spices and flavors that sticks to you when you go to realllly good Mediterranean restaurant and this place was just missing it. Customer service was ok food was ok. Would I go back??? Maybe not.. would I recommend it?? depends on who's asking. If you have never eaten Mediterranean food, you might end up loving this spot. But for me it was just ok.

Best iced tea in Las Vegas let me say that right away.I always get the same thing, chicken curry, it's so good as are the Athens fries, gotta do it every time.Today I had the Kale salad with dates and loved it.The hummus plate is a great way to start and my girl gets the Greek salad and will add chicken or salmon.We sat with David and he is the man.

Paymon's Mediterranean Cafe and Lounge is the best-known restaurant in the Las Vegas. It is offering delicious food items in the Greek as well as Italian, Persian, Middle Eastern, Indian, gluten-free and vegetarian specialties. 

This place is a complete family environment oriented with the delicious delivery of the high quality of food servings. They never compromise on their quality and food serving.

My 2nd visit to Paymon's was even better than the first, thus the coveted 5th star has been added.

It was a late night visit and I needed a pick me up, so I ordered the Turkish coffee ... Thick, strong, and a fabulous energizer. Turkish coffee kicks Red Bull's perky little ass!  

Service was friendly, attentive and prompt. For the hookah, we really enjoyed the blueberry blend this time around. We ordered their awesome fries again (man, that dip is goooood) and they rocked as hard as ever.

Check it out for the very cool atmosphere, super service, yummy nom noms, and the killer Turkish coffee that will keep you boppin' til dawn.

Their Hookah Lounge is good, and knows how to make a good bowl. But the food here is terrible! I have never been to Paymon's (9 times) and had a decent meal!  Paymon's is one of the worst attempts at Mediterranean cuisine. The food tastes bad and their prices are crazy high, considering their dishes are usually soaking in oil and empty. 2 stars for the lounge and the server was friendly. Even he agreed that the what we got was unacceptable and he couldn't do anything because the manager was on break?

I would like to start by saying that I grew up in a mediterranean country and know this cuisine well. Paymon's is one of the worst attempts at mediterranean cuisine. The food tastes bad and their prices are crazy high, considering. Their dishes are usually soaking in oil and take forever to digest as a result. My suggestion, try Khoury's or Alibaba.

Paymon's has great food!  Their greek salad is, of course, great!  Their "Athens Fries" + sauce is AMAZING!!!!  Hummus and pita bread is very good too.  Very greek/mediterranean (just like the sign says) and delicious!  We order over the phone and pick up our order to go- which is a great time saver! (just make sure you call the right one, there are a couple locations)  Very friendly and everything is very fresh!

Went in on a Friday night. Surprisingly it was dead, but now i know why. The server only had four tables. The first round of drinks and hookah came out quick, the hookah burned pretty quickly but they were quick to fix it. Once the server started talking to some guy at the bar, we didn't have our server come over for over forty minutes. It was extremely unfortunate because the group I was with thoroughly enjoy the Paymons that is on Sahara.

Summary: The hookah lounge is of good quality. the café itself is spacious and accomodating, but given the pricing, the service and food itself, with a few exceptions, leave a bit of room for improvement. 

I am going to separate the hookah lounge and café in my review:

Lounge:
I haven't smoked at their lounge in a while but from what I understand, it's pretty much the same as when I used to come here weekly.
Product: I am unsure what shisha brand(s) they use, however, I remember it being on par with their competitors. They do have a good selection of flavors and they do a good job of mixing them. 
Service: The staff is usually prompt and friendly. They're good about checking back on you.
Cost: The price of their hookahs are pretty much in line with the industry standard. However, the happy hour deals are awesome. Having a beer/drink, as well as awesome appetizers, make the hookah experience much more enjoyable.
Lounge itself: The hookah lounge has a really relaxing darkly-lit, well-decorated environment. Seating is comfortable and can easily accommodate groups of varying size. 

Café:
Food: I have been heard plenty of times, since long-before I discovered Yelp, and I have to say, aside from a few exceptions, I haven't really ever been impressed with their food. They do carry a decent selection focusing on cuisine from Italian, Greek, Persian, Indian and general Mediterranean. Unfortunately, as with many restaurants: over-reaching diversity usually means that quality gets sacrificed (looking at you Cheesecake Factory).  I've tried all type of food there, except Italian since I refuse to eat Italian when out, and haven't found any stand out dishes. It's not horrible, I should be clear, but it's not dynamic. 

I will say, however, their appetizers are usually awesome, which is what getting appetizers in the hookah lounge is so enjoyable. This goes double for Athens Fries and, admittedly, I have taken several trips to this restaurant JUST to get these fries. Also, their Arabic and Turkish coffee are pretty good. 

Service: As with the food, I have never been impressed with their service. I wouldn't say I have encountered anybody rude but service tends to get mechanical: there's a bare minimum of personality/conversation and I haven't really seen any service instance that made me feel like we were building report versus them just providing a service. (Imagine getting served food by the Geek Squad at Best Buy). 

Cost: They do offer some interesting deals like all-you-can-eat pasta, however, there dishes are slightly pricey for what you actually get. 

Cafe itself: the cafe is pretty spacious and comfortable. I have yet to see a large party there personally, however, I can imagine they would easily accommodate.

What a nice server lady they have. She is so professional and great. Food was filling and rich. Taste perfect :) atmosphere was calm. Our long hair server lady was the great part of this experience of new place.  We are more looking to find out about people who gave their life and love to their job what makes their hard job making easy on those who work hard.

We just went tonight hoping that the reviews would prove to be mostly wrong.  My husband and I are pleased to say that they were, atleast for us.  We are vegetarians so it's nice to find a decent place to eat that offers plenty of selections. This place did that and the service was spot on.  Meals came quickly too! Falafel Pita good although pita fell apart (no biggie, just used fork) and sampler platter was very good.  Baba ganoush was a bit too smokey but not a deal breaker.  Worth the trip away from the strip!!

I've really come around to Paymon's. They actually have saganaki on the menu, which is something I just totally love. And their tzatziki and hummus is delicious. They also have great fries, gyros, pasta, etc. I wasn't much of a fan when I first came here a few years ago. But I've definitely grown to enjoy it. I actually opted for take out on my last visit. It was a large order, but it was prepared quickly and packaged perfectly. I think I've found my go-to mediterranean place.

I went for dinner on Tuesday night. Nice environment. Lots of empty of seats. The hosts was very nice. I ordered gryro dish. Taste ok, the meat was of kind of dry. The second dish i ordered was chicken curry. Now this one was the bomb. Pepe, our server was good. Overall if I would return to this place.

The courtyard of the Maryland parkway store has been the scene of many girlfriend lunches over the years. I went last week to sit for a lunch and I was greeted by the waitress who has always worked out there, (she is so nice and friendly). I will say that I have narrowed down the menu to my favorites and so I sit down, and order a combination plate of cucumber dip and the best hummus in the city. I usually follow it with a big Greek salad or chicken pita, and I'm always so full after that!! I wont leave without a Moroccan tea or a Turkish coffee and I'm never upset when I leave!!
Falamus sandwich is to die for.  Their portions are huge!  Their service is fantastic!  This place is awesome.  I go there every time I visit Las Vegas!
This could quite possibly be the worst middle eastern food I've ever had!!!

Looking for something a little different, off the strip, and quick, and this place popped up. It's nothing special inside but it fills up quite quickly. We had the saganaki, some hummus, and a steak kabob. They were all fine but not fantastic. Based on the reviews, I guess I expected more. It was great to check out but I've had better.

Awesome tabouleh with smoked salmon- definitely their best- The place is O-K... nice sexy little hookah lounge and a bit better than average food, 

the tahini and tziki sauces are delish- good for lunch, i probably wouldn't have dinner here again.
The hummus, falafel and eggplant panini were amazing. Service was quick and waiters were very courteous. Definitely will come back again!

I like this location way better than the one on Sahara....the food seems to be better on Maryland. I also like the feel of the hookah lounge better as well, it's more cozy and intimate feeling. Definitely in love with the frozen hookah...yum. Blackberry....yum.
Love everything about this place, good decor, food, ambrosia hookah is the best! Happy hour is also a good time to go, 4-7pm! I will come here often!
First time I visited this place the service was ok, the food was really bad the chicken and vegetables was burnt and the curry was tasteless.

Went here with some friends that were visiting after a long week of partying. Surprised to see how nice it is inside and is a really chill place to smoke hookah. I had a hookah expert with me that made the best combinations of hookah imaginable so that could have made me like this place more than usual but it was a good way to chill and relax with everyone on their last night in town. You have to get the Athens Fries.... They are BOMB!!

My coworkers were headed out the door and told me I had to go with them to a place really close by with the best Mediterranean in town. I was in! 

We went for lunch and the place was absolutely packed. That's actually a good thing for me. 

We started with the hummus and pita. Very tasty. I give it top ratings. 

I decided on the tandoori chicken. It was beautifully presented and well seasoned. My major issue was that several of the pieces of chicken had a really uncomfortable crunch to them. I've experienced the crunchy chicken breast before but never at a restaurant. It's usually when I buy cheap chicken breast and the chicken is on the undercooked side. 

Additionally, it was a bit pricey for me at roughly $22 for lunch including a $3 tip. 

Great ambiance, adequate staff... I really wanted to love it but unfortunately I was disappointed so won't return.

Disappointing night. We talked in and there were only 2 tables in the main dining room. The hostess was not at the front station and a server created us and started to seat us. The hostess took the menus out of his hand and said to follow her. She asked us if we thought it was cold outside. Okay? I said "no" and she said "good". She then took us out to the covered patio area and attempted to seat us at a table that was less than a foot away from a larger group with kids. The seating was on a shared banquette. I asked to be seated in the main dining room which had 14 tables open. She proceeded to seat us at a very small table right next to the table of three large gentlemen who were talking loudly. Really? 

The server created us about 3 minutes later and took our order. I said"We would like to start with a salad , THEN enjoy XXX and XXX. All of our food arrived at once with no plates to share or the usual tongs to serve ourselves. My Falafel Appetizer was not served with Pita. The server finally checked in on us, but by then, why bother. Food was Okay but I was too irritated to enjoy it. 

I was really in need of a relaxing night out and being crammed in a small corner next to three loud and large men in an empty dining room missed the mark. 

There was no management on site to oversee service. Just sad. Know I see why this restaurant has gone downhill.  When we left the dining room was still 90% empty and the hostess was still not at her station. (Must be a lot going on in the bus station where she spent most of her time)

Decided to visit Paymon's today and I was pleasantly surprised at the great service we received. The staff was coming by constantly to ask us if everything was ok, and our waters were never empty! Jaime was great with the hookah service and had great suggestions for flavors to try. We planned on staying two hours or so, but ended up staying for almost 5 hours! Will definitely be back in the near future. We had gone to the other location on Sahara about two months ago and was not impressed with that location's service.
One of my Vegas favorites. Great food and friendly servers! Gyro salad and Turkish coffee are my favorites.
Such a waste of my time i drove all they way from aliante to this place to find out that they are close  when they should be open   not coming back here for sure.

Authentic middle eastern food for this half Lebanese girl and close to my home! Middle Eastern food is very labor intensive so I would rather eat out when I crave the familiar foods of home. Large and welcoming this is one of the best in Vegas.
Great service! I had the mild yellow curry chicken. It was great! Others i my party had the kabobs which  looked great. Generous portions and  good basmati rice.

Absolutely looooove the bruschetta salad!!!!!!!! Its my favorite thing to eat there... Its huge and great!! My husband gets the combination plate, which he loves! The Athens fries are sooo good and its hard to stop eating then once youve started!! For dessert the baklava is sooo good!!!  I love coming here with friends, the husband and groups.. i like sitting in the courtyard between the actual restaurant and the  Hookah lounge. its like your outside but your not!

love this place....

I've been a fair number of times for lunch with work colleagues and service has always been good.  Today's service was on the slow side -- maybe the back to school business lunch people surprised the staff?  Anyhow, I ordered a cup of the lentil soup -- wonderful! -- and a side of the Athens fries (French fries with "Greek" seasoning).  Fries = comfort food to me and are pretty hard to mess up, so of course I inhaled them.  I like the casual atmosphere, the large number of vegetarian options, and relatively inexpensive prices.  Perhaps not the most "authentic" place to get Mediterranean food, but it's cheap-ish and reliable and generous with the portions.

Given these tough times, you'd expect a lot for a somewhat pricey meal. The whole Italian Mediterranean fusion was a bad idea. I seriously feel that this place will close down in the near future. 

My brother and I made the mistake of referring to GPS, rather than Yelp. We had lunch on a Friday afternoon. I liked the aesthetics, but SERVICE was POOR. The food reflected the poor service. I ordered the lamb kabobs for $16 not including t/t. The lamb was dry and rough. The dish had an Italian twist, which really took the authentic flavor out of the food. 

Service was the worst I have encountered in quite some time. There were about three small parties while I ate there, and about 5 servers. WTF were they doing? Certainly not checking to see whether the meal was ok, nor refilling drinks. I had to walk the bill up to a server that gave me attitude.  Also, there was an annoying teen (possibly owner's daughter) running about. 

Suggestions to the owner- Close shop or offer decent prices (happy hour), take the Italian out of the Mediterranean equation, rehire new staff (David K was our server- nice, but just delivered food), eliminate dishes that are not popular, and offer complimentary Hummus and Pita. Btw, I want my money back!

Oh Paymon's...

This has to be one of my favorite lunch places. The food here is soooooo good!
I really enjoy all of the amazing flavors they offer in their food. 

Their paninis are out of this world and you have to try the Athens Fries!
Their happy hour offers so many different options for you to choose from.

& if youre talking drinks... Stop in for the lychee martini. So good!

Yum! So lucky to be walking distance to this restaurant. Had the chicken pita and it was filling. My husband had the fries on the side and they were well seasoned. We bought had some delicious and guilt free iced tea! Will be back again :)

I always love coming here! When I come here I always feel welcomed and comfortable because of my hookah girl Cynthia! She makes the BEST hookahs and always has a genuine conversation with me! Thank you Cynthia for the great service and making me feel at home!

Wait...what?  I haven't reviewed Paymon's yet? 

I've been coming to Paymon's since I moved to Las Vegas in 2003. The food has always been awesome - from my meat eating days when I used to order the chicken pita to my more recent vegetarian leaning days.  My current favorite thing on the menu is a big bowl of lentil soup served with a few slices of pita on the side.  Comforting and flavorful - and a perfect size for lunch - which is when I usually end up here.  If you're in the mood for something a bit more substantial, the felafel or felamus (felafel and hummus) pitas and fatosh salad are great veg choices too.  The spiced fries are good - I rarely order my own, but I've been known to poach a few off of my husband's plate every now and then.

Can't comment on the hookah 'cause I don't smoke.
I have been here multiple times! It's clearly the best Persian/Mediterranean restaurant in Las Vegas! Fresh delicious food in a friendly environment and awesome music! Thanks Paymon! LOVE it :D
This is a great Greek restaurant. I love coming here when I am working at The Degree Student Housing.

This is not anywhere near Mediterranean food. Don't eat here. Spanish people cooking Mediterranean food, REALLY! the food sucked and had no flavor whatsoever.  Chicken tasted like rubber. This place is terrible.

Love this place, I usually get the gyro platter and the pesto hummus both are wonderful. They often do promos for Mother's Day and special holidays and I usually go in around those times with my family and they all love it. Customer service is always spot on!!! I recommend this place
Its a quiet, relaxed place to have Mediterranean food.  I like the atmosphere.  he fruit infused iced tea is great on warm days!

5 stars, for their variety. ive been trying something different as much as  i can. chicken kabobs are bomb. the dolmas is bomb(prolly my favorite) the different pasta dishes and casseroles !! and then the fires are super bomb too.

i remember coming and eating here all the time when i used to work off of howard hughes and trop...

best fries on the planet.

o and their gyros, mediterranean salads, and kababs are pretty darn awesome too. =)

Make your way over to paymons once and you'll be hooked. Stiff drinks and tasty mediterranean dishes await you. Make youre u get the ice base on your hookah. it burns all night long! 
Dont forget tuesdays are local nights and select appeitzers are half off!

4 different dishes all from different cultures done in perfection is a sign of an amazing place and chef!!! Sooo much good food :) we were visiting and found this place of yelp and it was great choice

After my 3rd or 4th time coming to Paymons  I had to make sure to leave a review. Paymon's is a good choice for a healthy lunch. The service was very good and the food quality was too. Sometimes during lunch hours they can get busy but I've never waited more than 5 minutes. I always order grape leaves, tabuli salad to share and a cup of lentils for myself. This go around I went with the chicken kabob which can take 15-20 mins to cook but didn't seem to very long (maybe because they weren't completely packed. I've heard the Athen fries are awesome I'll have to come back and try them !

This place has the most amazing seasoned fries! My husband and I ate here and he talked about the salmon for weeks. I lovde the vegetarian eggplant pesto and roasted pepper pita sandwich and the orange mint tea. Will definitely return here next time I am in Vegas.

I love Paymon's. The staff are so friendly and personable, the food is incredibly tasty and the atmosphere is so inviting. I love the decor. I recently had their lasagne and it was out of this world for taste and flavor.

Amazing food!!!! Try something new, it will be great. Stick with something you know and it will be amazing every time.

Great service, every time we go there the staff is friendly, accommodating, and radiate a relaxed atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date night, hanging out, or just a place to unwind after a long day/week.

This is the worst out of the two. The service is awful and extremely slow. The hookah wasnt smoking very well. The atmosphere is not calming and its small. Take the drive to Sahara for that Paymons it will be worth your while .

The best Mediterranean food I have ever had! Portion sizes are big so we shared a bunch of different dishes. Anthony was our server and he was absolutely amazing. We never went without anything, he was very caring and on point. Prices are very affordable as well. Will be def going back.

Food is good, service is great sometimes but this is mostly about the hookah. Apparently there is a "20 minute guarantee" on smoking time according to one of the waitresses. Hookah for me at home or anywhere else lasts more than 20 minutes. The hookah I prepare or smoke at places like the Olive can last 1-2 hours. A refill to  Paymon's is when your charcoal runs out, NOT your shisha. So, if your coals are burning out, they will charge you for an entire refill even though your shisha is still burning fresh. This is the only hookah place that I know that charges you for a refill just because your coals run out. I've experienced this everytime I come here. Two of those times, the hookahs weren't prepared properly and were at fault to the person that prepared them and the waitress still insisted on charging me for a refill. Um, no thanks. A refill should be if your shisha burns out NOT your coals. Bottom line. What a way to price gouge you.

My last meal in Vegas on my winter vacation was a bit of a last minute selection. My friend picked me up downtown and we had plenty of time for dinner before I caught my flight back to the DMV. He suggested Italian, and took us to a nice local place with the word "Amore" in its name. One problem - we forgot it was Valentine's Day. After opening the door to a huge crowd and a room full of heart-shaped balloons, we immediately turned around and discussed plan B. We joked that we were each other's Valentine's date, and then he asked me "Do you like Greek?"

Off we went to Paymon's Mediterranean Cafe. The large restaurant is cutely decorated and, like most Greek restaurants I've been to, they pack the tables a bit tightly. The front of the restaurant features an array of spices and blends that are related to the Paymon's franchise and are used in the restaurant. Despite the "holiday" crowd, we were able to walk in and grab a seat.

My friend insisted that we start with an order of their Athens Fries. It's basically just seasoned fries with a sauce - a bit boring I thought, but I trust his judgement. And WOW, I can see why these are called "award winning" fries ... their house seasoning makes them the best seasoned fries I've ever had, and the house dipping sauce was a nice accompaniment.

For dinner, I ordered the Moussaka. I get it at just about every Greek restaurant I go to, and use it as a "litmus test" of their food. This was right up there with the best I have ever had. Beautifully layered, and the béchamel sauce was outstanding. My friend ordered the Gyros Platter and it was so massive, and looked so tasty, that I almost had buyer's remorse. Almost.

The meal was a nice cap to my vacaton, and I'd be happy to make a return trip on any future trip to Las Vegas.

I love the food here!! I have tried countless things on the menu and haven't been disappointed so far. They have excellent Moroccan tea. Great vegan options! They will make your custom order any way you choose to have it. The Athens fries are incredible!!! I wish they had a better Mesa though. Other than that this place is the BOMB!

Fabulous!!! Fabulous!!! Fabulous!!! Oh, let me add absolutely delish!!!  The first place that actually thinks of vegans and vegetarians as people who eat real food!!! 
The lentil soup... hands down the best I have had!!! Can't even begin to tell you how sad it is I can't take a gallon back with me to Louisville. 
My husband ordered the Kibbeh platter and vegetarian grape leaves. He loved every single bite!!! The grape leaves seemed to be hand rolled and not the typical canned version. The kibbeh was extremely flavorful and perfectly cooked. It went extremely well with the fluffy basmati rice. 
I had a falafel pita which was so delicious and flavorful. Most can become dry but these were extremely moist on the inside. I chose a side of fries with my pita and the portion size was HUGE!!! I didn't care for the sauce given with the fries so I dipped them in a side of Tazikki which tamed the overwhelming amount of seasoning put on them. 
Other highlights were the cappuccinos were great, hot chai tea, and most importantly the service was friendly and prompt. We are making this a go to place every time we are in Vegas!!! Check it out!!!

I have been here several times for the happy hour in the hookah lounge. Very cheap drinks and food, both of which were pretty good. Hookah was great, wish we didn't have to have the cap over the coal though, it burns the tobacco way to fast, but that is a pretty minor inconvenience. Great music as well!

So I popped into the hookah lounge this evening to meet for a few drinks and some appetizers with my brother and sister.  My sister was already there and had already been served a drink.  Once my brother and I arrived my sister told us that once the server comes that we should order 2 of what we want because they take a mimute. A Hispanic man came to the table after about 15 minutes and took our order so we did just that... Ordered 2 drinks each!  Once we got our drinks we took our time and sipped on both of them and not once during that time did anyone check on us.  We then noticed that the Hispanic male was the bartender and not the server.  The server whom ignored us several times was a bigger Caucasian female.  We had tried to flag her down multiple times to take our next order and it never happened.  We watched her loop around all tables and simply ignore us.  I work in the industry and am all about great customer service, tipping well, believe in great manners, but felt as though we were treated poorly.  This all occurred on this exact date 1/18/18 at about  5:45pm

For finicky eaters who insist on fresh organic ingredients, stop and take a good hard look at Paymon's.  I had the pleasure of spending some time talking with the owner of the restaurant about his restaurants.  Yes, he has done so well, he has been able to open 2 more locations; this being his first.  

The food is flavorful and delicious with the perfect balance of seasonings.  The service is fantastic...perhaps it is because the staff are all "long timers"...you see, the staff at Paymon's are also part owners, so they WILL take care of you.  Your business, is their business and they love what they do..and it shows.  Just look at the awards that line the walls. Those aren't all of them...they ran out of wall to post all of them.

Seriously, you can't go wrong on whatever you order.  There's a side room that they fill with overflow from the restaurant.  It's called the Hookah Lounge.  If you have a penchant for the Hookah...visit the Lounge portion in the evening.

This place is terrible. The hostess was rude and the food is over priced! I ordered a falafel and a fatoush salad and both were disgusting. I paid 20 dollars. What a waste! The food is definitely not authentic. I do not recommend this place.

Went in Thursday afternoon for the food. Overordered, but both the hummus and chicken pita sandwich were good. The fries were a little too spicy for my liking, but I can see the attraction for others. Food service was very good, if a little slow.

Then went back after Thursday dinner to try the Hookah. The service here is top notch, and their product is good. They do check in on you to make sure you are good, but are not overbearing about it.

Went back yesterday evening, and the gentleman working recognized me and asked how I was. Same great service.

Definitely a recommend on both sides.

I've been going here for about seven years now, but only for dinner.  They have some super great kabobs and basmati rice combinations and outstanding greek salad.  Also love the hummis and the "Shrimp, Artichoke And Spinach Dip" is to die for!

I've tried several other places to get kabobs in town and none have measured up.

A note:  Go on Wednesday between 5p-9p and you get 25% off your check.

I am only rating this place as a hookah bar. Coming from Los Angeles, where hookah bars are a dime a dozen, I would have expected something on par in the City of Sin. I understand that the primary business of this place is a restaurant so again, I must reiterate, this review is for the hookah lounge of Paymon's cafe only.

The service is ok. My friend and I were greeted at the front desk. However we were directed to go towards to two other doors before we can even reach the hookah lounge. It would have been fine if we were escorted, but we had to find our way to the other side of the restaurant to reach the actual hookah bar. Once we actually got to sit, we were greeted by a woman who carried flavors of hookah and asked us what we wanted. I notice that the tobacco that they used are not of the best quality. Most of it are dried and some of it were mislabeled. As someone who has been smoking hookah for several years and have been to several Nargile bars all over the Middle East, I know what to look for. Our server was very attentive and we got our drinks and appetizers right away.

Our hookah came minutes later. First of all, I am not sure if their staff knows how a hookah works. The rubber seal on our pipe was so loose that air was escaping, thus not getting the air necessary to get a full smoke out of the pipe. I knew this, but I am not sure if their hookah preparer knew this. He kept messing with our hookah till I finally told him why it wasn't working. I told him very tactfully what needed to be done and he was able replace our hookah eventually. I also notice that they use the cheap Chinese made ones, not the good kind (Egyptian, Syrian, Persian, etc) but I am sure its for cost efficiency. The worst part of this place and thus why I am only giving it 2 Stars is the simple fact that THEY DON'T REFILL CHARCOALS. Charcoal service should be standard in all hookah bars. If I've had my charcoal changed every 15 minutes at a Hookah bar in downtown Bagdhad, why not in Las Vegas? Are they too cheap to have this service? All the hookah guy can do is adjust the air valve, which btw does not do anything to the charcoal. The charcoal will keep burning till its completely turned to ashes. 

If you're in Vegas visiting or a local, I DO NOT recommend this place at all. I gave it two stars because of the service and that is it.
amazing food very yum amazing fries eat here now very good people amazing fries got buffalo panini and it was amaze

First of all, this is THE first date place in town.  I had my FIRST first date here, and it seems like anyone I step out with suggests coming here.  I think it's just because it's turned into a bit of a comfort food place for the mildly discerning local.

I've tried almost the entire menu here and I've found that the things I like the most are those that are probably tried the least.  For those that forget that Italy is considered a Mediterranean country, don't shy away from their chicken marsala.  It's surprisingly good, even if the penne marinara served with it isn't the most harmonious of pairings.  The chicken fesenjan is tangy and refreshingly different, and the pastitsio (kind of a middle-eastern lasagna) is hearty, filling, and perfect for a rainy day.  Their Athens fries really are tasty and make up for the often disappointing hummus and questionable falafel.

The ambiance of this place makes up for its culinary shortcomings.  Sit in the courtyard if you can, it's a completely different experience than the dining room.  The fountain, which would seem gaudy in its size other places, fits in well among the couches, pillows, rich fabrics and stained glass windows of the Hookah Lounge.  Move on over to the Hookah when you're done with your meal - it gets even better over there.

Love the hummus and kabob trio! Its great to share dishes with a friend so you get to eat a little bit of everything. I ALWAYS get order envy and want to eat everyone else's food but my own. Sharing is caring and that way I get to have it all!!!!

First time I have been to Paymon's - the food was AMAZING! We had an appetizer platter, and greek salad. Servings were very generous, prices extremely reasonable. Service was great - super fast. Everyone was very nice. I was pleasantly surprised and will be going back.

Great food! The food is really good but the hookahs suck!! We had to call the waiter over 15 times to fix our hookah and it was very unenjoyable. Maybe I would eat here in the future but I will never smoke here again.

Great lounge place. We didnt like skittles hookah, but Lemonade was really cool! Nice service, delicious food. We took couple coctails, also were taste. If you want to relax, and spend time with your friends, perfect place! I definitely reccomend it.

When ever I'm in town this is one of the place i have to visit! 

first: the service here is amazing, everyone is super friendly as though they've known you for years.  They have great music playing and everything I have ever ordered has been really good.

Last time I ordered the GRILLED SALMON which was cooked to perfection and served with Mediterranean vegetables and Vermicelli Pilaf. (the Pilaf was delicious but the veggies were kinda weird... I would trade it with something else like the tabouli).

-remember to ask for the mango chutney - it goes great with the salmon.

Always good food and service, very attentive.  Consistency is always hard to find and Paymon's delivers.  My kids enjoy the selections as well and enjoy the games given to them while waiting for our food.

yelp should have 0 or - feedback system, I would have gave this place -10. The worst food and service I have ever had. Lets make it clear this is resraurant owned by a Persian guy and yet he does not know how to make his own food, how the hell are you going to maintain the rest of the stuff that are none Persian.

A) I waited 25 minutes for my food with nothing on my table!!! When you eat Persian food as soon as you get in they will need to bring you warm bread with butter with mixed vegtables and onion this is a must at the table. After getting deinks Then the server needs to ask you if you would need any salad, yougurt mix (cucumber or shallot) and then get your order. Kind of like how they bring you tortilla chips at Mexican food before you wait for your food.

After a long wait and my moms complain to Anthony the food came, I dont know what word to use but it was garbage and I mean litterly garbage. Tasteless, spiceless crab with premium pricing.My sister only ate the salad from her koobideb friends order was supposet to have white rice but it came with a garbage brownish mixed rice so they brought him another plate of white rice also servers learn your job chicken is always served with lemon on the plateand make sure it is not burned. My trio had dried, seasonless koobideh with burned chicken along with half cooked koobideh.

And the combination plate was another disaster, flavorless tastless stuff. We didnt eat a good portion of the food my mom said its not nice to be wastefull so she brought the food back for our little dog coco and guess what even coco did not eat the food she only ate the meats lol.

I found this place by doing a google search and they had two locations so I figured it must be good, oh boy I was mistaken. A note to everyone going here, if you are eating here you do not know what kabob should taste like and keep in my you are eating the worst kind possible. So do your self and your body a favor and go elsewhere
The food is great! The spices that they sell are fantastic and I made such perfect falafel at home with it. The happy hour at the Hookah Lounge has great prices and their staff is really great.
Definitely try the Flaming Saganaki Cheese. And of course their fries

Paymon's. I've been here enough to write this review with no compunctions or second guessing. 

Starting with the restaurant.. The food is all pretty decent, but none of it seems to be particularly well-executed. And then the bill comes. Now, it's not like this place is super-expensive or anything like that. But it's not cheap, and in the end, I'm never happy with what I've paid for.

Now, the hookah lounge is a bit of a different story. It's marginally comfortable (at best), the service is usually super-friendly, and the hookahs vary wildly in quality. Hookahs only last an hour, and that's if you're lucky, since they don't replace coals. And the cost is about $15. Most other establishments will get you about 2x as much smoking time for the same money. The big redemption is daily happy-hour. 5-7pm, including weekends, gets you half-priced hookahs and a bunch of appetizer and drink specials too.  At half-price, everything is instantly reasonable and worthwhile. Drinks, appetizers, hookahs, etc. Also, while it's not a very comfortable place to lounge and smoke, the decor and atmosphere is usually pretty decent.

I rarely come here to eat anymore, and hardly ever show up outside of happy hour. Everything, from the decor to the food, is just "pretty good," which to me is not enough for what they charge. But happy hour in the hookah lounge definitely makes the place worthwhile. 

PRO-TIP: No hats allowed in the hookah lounge. Take yours off first so you won't look like an idiot.

It has been years since I have visited Paymon's.  We went over the weekend and it was still as good as I remembered.  For a Saturday night it was not too busy.  I remember this place having long waits for service and a hip young crowd.  I guess things have changed slightly with new management.  Despite all that it was an overall good experience. The service was prompt and attentive.  The ambiance of the restaurant was pleasant and comfortable.  

I went with the steak kabob which was serve with grilled vegetables like onions, peppers, zucchini and served with a side of rice and Greek salad.  This dish was very fresh tasting and the ingredients were good quality.  My better half had the Falamus pita which has always been my favorite.  This is a falafel pita with hummus, lettuce and tomatoes.  You must get the Athenian fries for any meal.  They are seasoned so delicious and also come with this amazing dipping sauce that will have you licking your fingers for more.  

I was surprised to see they offered Italian, Greek, and Middle Eastern dishes. They are also connected to the Hookah Lounge which can be a nice and relaxing place to enjoy a few beverages.

The spicy french fries served here are enough by themselves to keep me coming back. The salads are delicious and come in gigantic quantities. You cannot go wrong when ordering any one of their pita sandwiches.

Paymon's is an institution! My dad used to take me here when I was a little girl and we needed some good Middle Eastern food that the other half of our family didn't appreciate. They have a plush dining room with attached hookah bar, and a covered patio that adjoins the two with a pretty fountain in the middle and ornate tapestries and curtains. There's a large menu selection offering Greek, Indian, and Middle Eastern food. 

A coworker and I just dined for lunch and we split a Greek salad which was abundant with fresh veggies, feta, and kalamata, tossed with a tangy lemon dressing. We split the combo platter, which came with tabbouleh, hummus, baba ganoush, tahini dressing, falafel, dolmas, seasoned fries, and pita. It was plenty of food for the two of us, and the falafel was perfectly crunchy and crispy on the outside but steaming and moist on the inside. 

I had the most incredible tea, it was a rose/mint combo, I didn't add any sweetener and it had just the slightest hint of honey! Great place, great service, always packed for lunch, local favorite.

We used to live in Vegas, and The Med was one of our favorite places to go smoke a hookah with friends for an evening out. It hasn't changed from what I remember, the food is consistently good and authentic.  I think we paid nearly $40 for lunch which seems a bit much for lunch for only two people.

was craving for some hookah after some drinks and a show, got in at about 1130 but they close awfully early for a place on the strip left at about 1, but it was a monday night.. was slightly disappointed about that

Food: Very good, definitely above average. The Kale Salad is excellent. 

Service: Excellent, the hostess and server were very polite and attentive. 

Atmosphere: Lovely place, that's the good. The bad, its extremely hot, unbearably so, I was sweating, my wife was sweating, even servers complained to me about it. I was told its set at 78 degrees, they need to adjust it to 72 degrees AT LEAST.

Conclusion: This is my first review, I had to make my opinion known here with hope that this location makes the necessary changes.

I'm usually not a huge fan of Mediterranean food, if I'm being honest. But Paymon's has some amazing food and a cool, chill atmosphere. I'm always here for lunch and have to get the Athens Fries. Try them and you will not regret it. It's a excellent local spot not too far from the strip and if you're in the mood for some solid Mediterranean food, this is the place you want to go to.

Came here with a large group, so I don't want to judge the service too harshly, but it also can't be ignored. In the restaurant portion, our group was pretty large and the service wasn't great. Everyone was nice, but the servers weren't able to answer simple questions about the menu items. We were told that the menu had recently changed, and they were still getting used to it. Not sure if I accept that reasoning, since it had been a week since it was changed. They also didn't seem to have enough people to handle the bar and the restaurant. Service was a bit slow, and seemed a little chaotic. Once again, I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt since our group was 20+ people. The Athens Fries and Garlic Fries were very good. The Kabob Trio was ok, but not nearly the best I've had. All of the kabobs were a little too dry for my taste. 

A few of us stayed to check out the hookah lounge area. It's a bit of a small lounge, but kind of cozy. I could imagine it getting cramped during a busy evening. The employees in the lounge were nice and checked on us. I ordered an Old Fashioned but it tasted nothing like an Old Fashioned. It tasted like soda water with a splash of whiskey. The Skittles flavor of hookah was pretty outstanding! I also liked that the music wasn't loud. So many places in Vegas play music on high volume, and it prevents any sort of conversation.

I think my experience would have been better if I came with just a few people. At the same time, there are so many other places that are so much better. Since I live across town, there wouldn't be a reason to drive all the way here for just an ok place.

This place did it for me! I really enjoyed the shawarma, kabobs and hummus. Loved the ambience in this place and the different rooms you can dine in depending on your mood. 

It was reasonably priced and delicious. I sat in the atrium room which had a lounge outdoor setting with all the trimmings of a water fountain for background noise and great artwork on the walls. 

The interesting thing about this restaurant is that it is a hidden gem tucked away inside a strip mall. From the outside I probably would of been sketchy but once your inside it's a gold mine 

I recommend this place to anyone looking for some great food and atmosphere.

Oh My Greek-ness! Great Food, Flavors & Portions. 

Falafel -  Fried Goodness!
Kabob Pita - Good but the meat was mediocre. The Greek Tzatziki sauce saved it.
Athens Fries - Bold & Flavorful! Tie it in with the dipping sauce -winner!

P.S. I'm a saucy kinda girl and all their different sauces are outstanding!

At first, I was dismayed, because the greeter at the door was kind of a prick. However, he eventually got us seated, and our server, Anthony, made sure to make up for any misgivings I had. My wife ordered the combination platter, and I ordered the Gyros platter. The portions were HUGE - I normally don't have leftovers to take home. I liked it at first, but, the more I ate, the more the salt content got to me. By about halfway through the meal, I got an idea of the sodium intake of your average bukkake star. My wife assures me that it was perfectly normal for Greek food, so I'll chalk that up to my inexperience with going Greek. The vegetables served alongside, though, were magical. I greatly enjoyed those - giving me half the rice and twice the veggies would not have been a bad idea. 

She liked almost everything on her plate except the dolmas - they were extremely bitter (even for grape leaves), and the consistency was like pudding, rather than rice. Other than that, though, she loved it, and was very happy with it.  She also truly enjoyed the lentil soup she ordered.

We'll be going back.

Great local spot. Has a good amount of regulars and once you visit you understand why. Food is good bar food, place is well known for hookah. Very good selection.

Bad part - service is a bit annoying.

Puff, puff pass, people.  Puff, puff, PASS.

This review is just for the hookah lounge.  (I love the food next door, but I don't think I'm qualified to critique it).

1 star for the triple apple.

Another for the ICED hookah.  That was a first for me.

Another for the great hostess who explained to us how the sealed bowl worked (and extended the life of our lovely triple apple).

Finally, a star for the Persian? Lebanese? art on the walls...great to gaze at during lulls in the conversation.

I can't give them a fifth star because EVERY time I'm there, they are playing crappy music way too loud for the intimate, exotic venue.  90's R&B is a triple apple buzzkill.  How about some goa trance?

Very good reasonably priced food, solid service - a great choice for a reasonably priced and quality mediterranean lunch or dinner.

Prefer to sit in the main dining room off the entry to the north vs. the annex to the west, but both are ok.

Gyros (sandwich or platter), chicken curry (spicy), falafel, hummus, seasoned fries and other items are all solid choices,  Very good quality.

Excellent service for a neighborhood restaurant - have been coming here for years and many of the wait staff have been here for years, and they have great attitudes.

Hookah lounge next door is fun too - if you are into cocktails and hookahs.

Worth noting that owner, Paymon, is a solid citizen, supporting efforts to enliven Maryland Parkway and an apparent supporter of UNLV next door.

Highly recommended for good quality, reasonably priced neighborhood dining.

My first time to paymons was awesome, ordered take out and the food was delicious, simple. My second time around it was not good at all. I ordered take out again, same thing, so I didn't bother to check it before I left which is my mistake but they gave me the wrong food and I live 30 minutes away -_- makes me a little sad because I really enjoy the thing I usually order. Might be a awhile until I return.

Athens fries, Frozen Hookah, fantastic shisha, and a full bar. I'll take two please lol. Paymon's 1 of 2 the original is great. First entrance cafe connected to a great resturant side connected to a tucked away provacative hookah lounge. A tri- level of fun.

This is a great place for hookah.

They have a great wait staff who is very attentive.  I've been asked how the service/food was at least a dozen times by the attentive wait staff, who were very nice and responsive.

They have a lot of different hookah flavors you can blend.  They also have a good selection of food, but the fries are a MUST!  They have the best fries EVER

Also there's a house DJ in the entrance area who plays some pretty good mixes.  Love this place and will be back for sure for the fries, house music, and hookah

Love it!  It's been years since I've been here and the experience was far better than my memory.  Anthony is a super server and Chris was an engaging and knowledgeable manager.  My gf had the sampler platter and I had the beef kabob and a local IPA (Joseph James Brewing).  Loved every moment.

This review is more in regard to a particular server as opposed to Paymon's as a whole. My friends and I are regular patrons of the place, for good reason, they have good hookah. But this location certainly misses the mark in it's customer service. 

Our server Cynthia, (we actually had 3 different people tending to us, but this one in particular was the one servicing our hookah) addressed our table as normal and began conversation by telling us she hopes she gets over this sickness soon, a throat infection no-less. Fine, that's our prerogative if we wanted to smoke after that. But not wanting to make her feel bad, we chose to do so anyway. 

We came in only for happy hour (5-7) for the prices. We ordered one of our hookahs 45 minutes before the end of happy hour and it did not come out until 5 minutes before happy hour was over. We could have smoked and ordered another bowl in that time. Cynthia apologized and said there was a mix up with one of tables, that was the reason for the delay. So, when we finished that hookah, I asked Cynthia if she could put this next order as happy hour pice being as their in up prevented us from doing so. She said she'd need to run it by her manager. So she did, came back, and said that was fine. 

When our bill came, it was not at happy hour price... we waited another 20 minutes for someone to come by so I could address this, and no one ever came. I went up to the bar to speak with Cynthia, or anyone really, and when she saw me come up to the bar, she quickly went off to the back. So I ended up speaking with another girl and she said the manager discounted $4 (not happy hour priced) at this point we were just tired and defeated and ended up paying for it. But I'm leaving this review here for others to please be cautious of Cynthia... 

Again, I enjoy Paymon's, but will specifically be requesting her not be our server.

Came here with our Marketing Team and had the best experience! Our waiter, Anthony, was amazing. Not only was he completely knowledgable about the food, but he was quick, efficient, and extremely nice and professional.  The food was superb. I had the Gyro Pita and was thoroughly impressed. We also had the Combo Platter. The falafel in the platter was delicious. I tried all of the sauces and my favorite was the Greek yogurt sauce. Yum! Would definitely recommend trying this place out. They have a hookah bar connected but didn't get to check that out. I'll be back though!

This is one of Las Vegas's most excellent places to eat. They have healthy, reasonably priced dishes. Not only is it Mediterranean food but they offer Italian and curry dishes as well. The service is also awesome - they always welcome me with a smile and treat me like a VIP. :) If you haven't been to either of their 2 locations, you must try it. My usual: the humus with pesto to start and then the Gyro or Bruschetta salad (oh! and the lentil soup is great for when it gets cold out). YUMMY!

This review is for the new Paymon's location in Henderson on Eastern. We were so excited to have a Paymon's on our side of town however this excitement was short lived. The garlic fries were amazing and arrived shortly after we ordered them. We also ordered a Gyro Salad that surprisingly required an up charge of $1 for feta that was not very fresh. Funny, I thought Gyro or Greek salad came with feta? We ordered pesto hummus that we never received, no refills on our drinks, I had water, on our hot Las Vegas afternoon. Anthony our server spent all his time conversing with his one other table who obviously he knew,; seated after us, received food before us, checked out and left all before we got our check. We sat and waited for our check for more than 20 minutes after we were clearly finished as we are with the new Paymon's in Henderson.

The servers are all so helpful and kind. I was fairly impressed to see them ALL go above and beyond to keep the customers satisfied on such a busy night! (That's hard to find at a hookah lounge, in my experience.) The food, like the hookah, is top rate. The portions you receive are generous for what you pay, and the taste is out of this world. Give this place a chance to WOW you; you won't be disappointed!

Service was fast and everything we ordered was great. We had a group of four and ordered the combination platter as an appetizer and it was definitely more than enough food for an appetizer. I ordered the quinoa tabouli and it was absolutely great, and there was so much food for such a great price.

We've been coming to the hookah lounge for a few years and the service has steadily been decreasing. We continue to come back because of the few employees who have been here since the beginning (who are great) and the great happy hour prices. One person who has been a big part of the decrease in the customer service is the bar manager...at best her service is mediocre. She is rude, doesn't like checking on tables, and is more concerned about feeding her friends free shots at the bar and talking to them. It shouldn't take 30 plus minutes to check back on a table, especially on a slow night. Hopefully they will pull it together because the food and drink specials are great here.
I love this cozy local restaurant. The food is delicious but I end up having the same thing every time...mousaka! The best around!

This is a hidden gem of sorts because this side of town is not known for its restaurants. So when I discovered this place not too far from work, I met a friend there for an early dinner at 4:30pm on a Friday night. A car was getting towed from the lot and there were paramedics treating some people at the nearby corner, so again..I don't think I would come here after dark--no matter how good the food is. 
The place was almost empty when we arrived, but when we left an hour later, the place was getting packed.
Service was ok. Not very attentive, but he was pleasant. Our food came out quickly and to order.
I was happy to see the many vegetarian and vegan options available. I was pleased with my soup and eggplant pita ( it was so big I took half home for later).
The background music was not authentic to the type of restaurant- top 40 pop music is not what I want to hear when coming to a Mediterranean establishment. 
We left with with full bellies. I would come back again during daylight hours.
Chelsea is amazing!!! She made the experience so much better. I had a problem with my drink and she remade it without hesitation. She runs the floor and I'm glad she helped us. I love this place!!!

Gyro was tasty, fries amazing with the dipping sauce! Only thing - the hookah. Granted it was happy hour but I wouldn't have paid more than the $8. I got the thief mix and another girl described it perfectly - tree. I think it was the white grape that gave that tree bark flavor. But I still kept it - was a long day and refills are $13. I was also sad you can't get more coal, you have to refill.  I felt like I didn't smoke that long. My hookah came right after I got my food, so I ate and then smoked. Maybe an hour? I personally have a harmony bowl and kaloud lotus so my own argileh last forever with one head and maybe 1 coal refill. Great place though! I'd go again!

If I can't remember exactly what I ordered - that means it wasn't too special right? Either way, I know that it was good - we got an appetizer of dips to share and then I had some sort of pita sandwich that was really excellent. Beer selection wasn't half bad. I had a Peroni and someone else was able to order Moroccan beer (who knew?!). 

The best part was our server - Laura, I think. She was fantastic. And the really faint smells of hookah trickling in from the room next door. Hookah and hummus - what more could you want from life!?

Came here looking for low-cost decent Mediterranean food, and we got exactly that. The tilapia florentine had really great flavor and the artichoke hearts on it were great! I wish the tilapia was a little less soggy, but the flavor was good, so I wasn't too upset over the texture. The pasta with it was ok, nothing noteworthy. I also had some of the tandoori chicken, which had great flavor and was more like a chicken tikka because it was in chunks rather than a whole breast. The zucchini with it was tasty! It is kind of weird leaving once they close, because you have to go through a big weird door that isn't by the main entrance. It was kind of frustrating because it seemed obvious that we were trying to leave, but none of the workers offered to show us how to leave until we asked.

Wow was I proven wrong. After my initial post, the manager reached out to me. I was invited back on the house and have come back multiple times since. Not only did the initial waitress I had challenges with apologize, we have had stellar service experiences since. I have been blown away with the service recovery! I may have to make this my happy hour hot spot.
Das Essen dort schmeckt sehr sehr gut. Es ist eine schöne ruhige Atmosphäre freundliche Angestellte und viel Auswahl.
Great food all the time. Much can get busy and hostess is not always on point to great you but that is as bad as it gets. Food vs price is right! Sit outside if available or at least on the patio.

Went the other day with my cousin and had pretty good service. I love eating in the indoor courtyard area because there's no music playing..all you hear is the fountain and the lighting is so crazy soothing as you eat and chat. I had the chicken curry but it wasn't as spicy as I wanted. And when you order tea with friends just get one pot! Once my friend and I both ordered tea and we each had to finish a whole pot because its like $5.

I love paymons ! Especially their happy hour on hookah , food && drinks ! :D good place to unwind after a long day . 

They have a nice relaxed ambience , play good house music , and their food is good . The servers come around regularly and check to make sure your hookah is still hitting well . 

We always get their hummus dip and Athens fries . The Athens fries are addictive ! My favorite thing to eat there .

Went for dinner with friends. Ordered the kibbe platter. Was "ok" ... everyone's food was badly over salted.  Service was terrible. Constantly had to hunt down our waiter. It has been several years since I have dined here...definitely has gone down hill.

Paymon's is just OK. Like most things in Vegas, Paymon's is kind of a parody of something else that exists elsewhere in reality. 

Also like most things in Vegas, it is too expensive. 

The spicy fries are good, but I'm still burping them up. 

Feta is extra.

Judy is awesome.

Wife and I decided to have Friday lunch at Paymon's in Maryland and Flamingo. Sat right away and served with a smile. Not our 1st time and it's nice to see that the same servers have been here for years. I guess I'm extrapolating that it must not be a bad place to work and the employees have been content to work here for a prolonged amount of time....But enough of that. I had the Moussaka which was delicious and fresh as always. Wife had the eggplant pita-which had very fresh vegetables, feta and pita bread. She always douses it with the house-hot sauce. A Racy Red Sauce. 
Good place to go if Mediterranean is what's attracting your taste. They've got the menu to satisfy Greek, bit of Italian and Middle Eastern. Always a solid choice for us.

Love this place.  Have been going there for 14 years and always get great food and great service.  We especially like Denise as our waitress.  As soon as we are seated, she brings us our drinks without even having to ask.  She remembers our favorites and gives great suggestions.  A great server!  My favorite is the feta pita!
My kids like coming for the pita and hummus and the pizza is pretty good too! Large enough for the 2 to split.

Paymon's needs to condense their menu and focus more on the food they are putting out. 

I ended up here because Stephano's my go to Greek restaurant was closed. The atmosphere at Paymon's is so dark and dungeon like. I looked over the menu and saw that in addition to having standard Greek fare they also had Indian and Italian food which made me question the authenticity of the food. 

I started with a regular hummus and for my entree I chose the gyros plate. The hummus was slightly bitter but had a smooth consistency. I could tell the pita bread was low quality and store bought because it tasted like cardboard and had a spongey texture. This was the most unauthentic pita bread I have ever had at a Greek restaurant. 

The gyros plate looked sloppy and did not taste freshly made. Later on, I found out from the manager that the gyros comes frozen. I was not at all surprised because the texture and taste reflected meat that has been previously frozen. 

I hope the owners look into improving the quality of their gyros and either make it in house or find a local supplier because anyone that has had authentic/high quality Greek food will not want to eat here.

My friends and I were craving hookah. Instead of walking by the right side of where the restaurant seating is located the two big double doors with the carpeted entrance is closest to the hookah lounge by the courtyard on the left. We walked in and it was pretty packed for a Monday around 7pm. When my group stood there and the server just passed us without really acknowledging us, another server finally said we can sit where ever and then theyll be right with us. Maybe I was blind but there should be a please seat yourself type of sign. Love the dark interior with well lit framed art works to display. There were so many interesting displays to look at such as different hookahs on the shelf, hanging crystals and just the memorabilia gathered to immerse your eyes into. I saw the happy hour sign from 5pm-7pm at the end. The one TV above the bar was showing hockey then wrestlemania which I thought was pretty interesting. After two cabs, hookah, hummus dip and athen fries came up to be ~ $40.

Came here on a Saturday night for some beers and food. Friends came to smoke hookah but I don't smoke so I won't be reviewing that.

We sat down in the left area of the restaurant. It is dimly lit with lots of decorations on the walls. The furniture is pretty chic and comfortable to sit on. The tables are a tad on the small side, the only reason being because we ordered a ton of food and had trouble keeping our drinks and plates somewhere stable. 

The food was great! I had the Athens fries (good), calamari (good), and babaganoush (my favorite!). We also had a side of chicken tenders but I think those were of the frozen variety. Very pleased with the food overall. Beers were reasonably priced. 

Service was great too. Our server came to check on us regularly, and the hookah guy (sorry dude forgot your name!) was super awesome. He mentioned he only works saturday nights I believe? Anyways, he was super friendly while we chatted with him.

Bill at the end of the night was super reasonable for the amount that we consumed. Will definitely be coming back again!
I used to go here back in the 2000's. It was always good, but not great. That has changed. Went there a week ago and the service and food was top notch. I'll be back.
Great place to take a date... Eat in the hookah lounge, it has low lighting and they play chill music. I recommend the kabob platter and the fries. Good service. I will definitely be back soon.

Large fatoush salad please! I got mine with chicken for an extra $3.95. They only give about 1/3 of a breast cut into strips, so probably not worth the added cost. The salad itself was large, and priced around $9. The dressing was great, and all the veggies crisp. Our waitress was very attentive, sweet, and did a great job. The kitchen staff whistle as they cook, and since the kitchen is visible (and audible) from the dining room it made me want to not come back. I would definitely order take out, but dining in whilst being tortured the whistles of cooks, no thanks. 

Finally, the interior lighting is a bit odd. Overall the 'cafe' (indoor seating) is super dim, but there are random spot lights distributed throughout so there are super intense bright places and super dark places on each table. Their menus are in those shiny plastic sleeves, so they are extremely hard to read. They do have a takeout menu that isn't laminated, so grab one of those on your way in if your vision isn't so great.

Now, great Mediterranian food is kind of a specter in the world or consumer edibles. Its out there, and people talk about it; but when it comes down to it... Its only ever kinda good, or good for the price, or the atmosphere but never have I heard, or said, "Outstanding."

Outstanding is barely appropriate for my first experience here. Interestingly enough, I searched "Delivery" on Yelp, and this Paymons came up high on the list... Strange, because they don't deliver. Which is fine, i like living in Las Vegas and being able to drive around our beautiful city; driving down Maryland Pkwy at 30mph is excrutiating, but worth it when you get here. Its neatly kept in a non descript mini mall across from Target and Buffalo Exchange.

The food was beyond excellent. There was an interesting sauce that came as default chicken sauce that just made me... I dunno, not my cup of hummus. But the white tzaziki is incredible. Great consistency and not watery or over cucumbery. The chicken is tender and marinated all the way through. The kabob (kubideh) is meaty and well seasoned. My only gripe is if you get it in pocketed form, its all meat on top and salad underneath. Im going to try wrap form next time.

The Athens Fries are beyond phenomenal. The only fries in the entire world that I gladly munched on cold. I was floored and full and satisfied for under 30 bucks and didnt even touch the Greek Salad yet. The best takeout experience I've had in Las Vegas across any genre of food. There is a lot of competition for pita and kabob and hookah, but with this visit and this experience and this food. This is my only choice.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  The food is good, the atmosphere is nice, and the service is great.  The hookah lounge is also great.  I highly recommend the salmon.

I'd ordered beef kabobs. They were overpriced and didn't live up to the value. The kabobs and veges were so burnt. I felt like I'm eating myself to cancer. I had to stop eating. It was a disappointment since I heard it was a pretty good place and I was excited. The food didn't really have any flavor beside being burnt. Maybe I'd ordered the wrong thing. Maybe I should have ordered a gyro, that might be better. I'm not going to drive so far just to try there other dishes though.

so yummy..
their greek salad..their lentil soup..taboulli etc..
the store located next to it sells the salad dressing..and the red sauce served on the table.
back in the day..id  bring my big purse and take the red sauce home with me! shame!!!! not really..
Their kabobs are great..take a while so if you know thats what you are ordering then place it early!
the dishes are so secretive here (like the greek salad dressing) even paymon's  wife has no clue how to duplicate it..(from her mouth to gods ears)
the hookah lounge out back is so fun..great date spot..or place to go with the girls..

I'm very indecisive on what to eat so I ended up here because they serve all kinds of Mediterranean food. We started off with calamari and Athens fries. I like both but calamari was a tad over cooked. For our entrees we ordered the kabob trio of chicken, lamb, and beef and angel hair bolognese. My son settled for chicken strips and fries. Everything came out almost at the same time so we scuffed down the calamari to make space on the table. food was good and huge portions. Definitely bring your appetite. I really wanted dessert but there was no way. I was too full. From hostess, waitress and busser. It was all around friendly service and deliciously huge portions of food.

I've been here a few times hoping it would get better. the food is okay, inconsistent quality. the saganaki is ALWAYS cold when I order it and pretty flavorless. The falafel is also dry and the wrap had old lettuce.  Overpriced in my opinion for the quality of food.

My boyfriend and I just dined here tonight. We really enjoy Paymons and we are frequent customers here. We really liked our waitress Sunshine. We wanted to sub the salad with rice since we already had salad and they did not have it. Although our lamb was undercooked, she understood and quickly took it back to the kitchen to have it cooked. Paymons decided to comp our dessert to make up for it and Sunshine gave us 2 serving of the rice pudding. Thank you Paymons and Sunshine!

Being a Las Vegas native, and a frequent of the Sahara location, I was extremely upset that their "policy" was that they could not refill our coal for our hookah.. we had to strait refill our hookah, $18, even though our current hookah was more than adequate. Every hookah bar we have ever frequented has allowed us to refill our coal as we pleased...  the supervisor was unable to service us so we left to Azuza down the street and had a great time!
The Arabic coffee jolted life into my taste buds as soon as it touched my lips. Outstanding service and food

We came here and feasted, we were staying at the mgm grand and decided to venture outside the strip as mostly that's what we did to find some cool local spots this was one of them greek and middleeasten combination which was real good and they were very generous on the amount of food, I liked the pita bread they had, gyro was good too forgot what else we ordered but it was all good. Also attached to this place is a real dark chill hookah lounge. Though that was different, especially this was in a Plaza. Uber was the best way to travel cheap ride in and back

Been going here since 1998, when it was under a different name.  Food is basically unchanged over the years, and is good for a tasty sit-down Mediterranean / Middle-Eastern meal.  I like the Fesenjan [sp] chicken which is a Persian dish, supposedly  a natural aphrodisiac, but I seriously doubt that.  Fries kick butt, and later in the day /evening you can smoke the hookah!
I gave it 4 stars because it has a nice atmosphere and the waiter knows what is in the menu and could describe the portions of food you get.. it's next to a hookah bar

I've been coming here for probably 15 years. The reason I keep returning and even bring clients or friends is, because of the amazing food and awesome service. I always sit in the hookah lounge and even if it's busy, I get great service. I always ask for Cynthia. She is personable, but also professional. Cynthia has given me outstanding customer service every time even when she's been slammed. I not only recommend Paymon's, but also Cynthia as your server. Great atmosphere to chill, for a date or even business.

We had dinner on a Saturday evening around 8:00 p.m.  There were other people in the restaurant, but it was not very busy.  The service was very good.  Our waiter was attentive and friendly.  There is a decent variety of food choices on the menu from Italian and Greek to Middle Eastern.  Our food was very good and the portion sizes were very large (enough that we could have probably split an entree).  There were a lot of left overs to take home!  Dinner for two with an appetizer was around $45.  They also have a bar and hookah lounge that we did not sample.  Overall a very good, economical experience with attentive waitstaff and good food.
This used to be one of my favorite places but they recently changed the menu..eliminated some items and upped the prices.. I'll miss you guys!

The Gyro and fries were good.  The price might be a little bit high for some, but that didn't matter too much for me.
