However the service was a bit slow.  I caught a cold later that night that I think might have come from here due to retaliation for my brother in law's anger at the waitress for making us wait.

I didn't go into the "Hookah" area, since I don't do that stuff, plus my mom, sister, brother in law and niece was with me.  Doing that would tarnish my perfect image.

Not the best place to go if you just want to get a meal with your family, but If you want to do other things, maybe this is your thing.

One of my first stops when I hit town with good friends, best friends have been going here for years with my best friend Briana V. I love the service Monica is the best bartender and most of all the athens fries, and pita and hummus. Yummy.

Came here because of the good Yelp reviews when we were looking for a restaurant off the strip but not too far off, thanks Yelp!

+Location: Easy to get to off the strip and lots of parking

+Ambiance: A little kitschy but very welcoming, tons of awards everywhere so you know it's good.

+Food: Hearty big portions of Mediterranean food that you can definitely share.
+Steak/Chicken Kabobs: Nicely cooked, juicy inside and served with salad, grilled veges and rice.   I definitely think two people can share this unless you're super hungry.
+Combination Platter: A smorgasburg of different appetizers, I think this is something fun to eat and share as a group.  Easily shareable between 3-4 people.

+Service. 

+Price.  Definitely quality food with large portions and great service.

My first favorite for Mediterranean food! Not sure what to order? Well, let me help you out...the Gyro sandwich and the fries with their special seasoning is always a winner!  The pita bread always tastes so fresh, the lamb is tender and flavourful and all the toppings are just a bonus!  Honestly, I've had other food on the menu in the past but once I tried the gyro and the fries I was hooked and haven't ordered anything else since except for the Greek salad,  hummus and baklava which are also delicious. With all of the Mediterranean restaurants popping up, I still haven't experienced anything better.

I'm not sure if we just caught this place on a bad day or what happened but the service was unbearably awful. I do have a few good things to say so let's start with that. 

The food was great. We had the Athens Fries, and Dolma appetizers. My friends also had the mozz sticks and said they were good. I was totally impressed by the Dolma dish. Tender grape leaves stuffed with angus ground beef, tomatoes and rice in a tangy tomato sauce. I've been craving them ever since! The fries are delicious too. Coated in some kind of seasoning with a side of this creamy aoli sauce. That sauce you could put on tree bark and I would be good. Great happy hour deals 50% off all appetizers and signature drinks. The Lychee Martini was pretty good as well.
The hookah flavors were great as well. We tried Blueberry Vanilla with a touch of cinnamon... Tastes like French toast so amazing! Ill be coming back specifically for that. 
Now into the bad... Unfortunately this completely out weighed the good. First, I say down I'm the hookah lounge part for about 25 minutes with no menu, and no recognition at all. I finally went up to the bar where the waitress was and asked if she could stop by. She held up her finger and said one minute in a very snappy tone. Mind you the lounge was not that busy at this time. I sat back down and about 15 minutes she came over after I waved my hand at her. I ordered a glass of wine & asked if it was on happy hour, she said yes. The rest of my party arrived a few minutes later & we all sat there for about 30 minutes with no service. And still no wine for me. One of my friends approached the bartender to order the rest of our drinks and he said they would be brought out to us. After waiting 20 minutes and seeing our drinks just sitting there on the bar I got up and brought them over. When I was at the bar retrieving them I told our waitress we would like to order. She got out a pen & paper and said what would you like? I was t sure of the exact order everyone wanted so she told me to go ask them and she would be at the computer when I was prepared to order. Now in all the years of experience of dining out or working in restaurants in general I was blown away by this. She actually wanted me to go get the order of our table and walk back to the bar to order. While taking my drinks as well. Wow, not cool bro.
The hookah chic was no help either. She kept forgetting the flavors and had to ask us several time what we ordered. And to top it off I had 6 glasses of wine over the period of our 4 hour dinner and when we got the bill not one glass was offered at happy hour. When I asked about this, this was her response "oh I didn't ring up any of your wine until the end and it's 10pm now." 
 Such a disastrous experience. If the food  wasn't so amazing I'd never return but since it is ill give Paymons one more shot. But if I receive service like this again my next review won't be as nice. Get it together people!

The service was very good, the portions large (biggest gyro I have ever seen), the gyro salad was fantastic, the restaurant clean and the passion iced tea delicious. I would definitely come back to Paymon's when I come back to Vegas. You can't only eat on The Strip -- get out in town.

I can see below who the fake reviewer is. I'll let you guess, but come on, I hate that. There's no need to supply a fake review, this is a Las Vegas favorite with a couple of locations.

 The only reason I know about this place is because I used to be a local, and I knew it when it was plastic lawn chairs and flourescent lighting. My old las vegas chess buddy turned mathematician turned magician took me here and it was overwhelming. it is now a chic dimly lit casbah of lush, with nice curtains, a hookah bar in the back, gold handcarved heavy frames over original paintings, lush, luxiourious, and....cheap?

it's basically the same dirt cheap prices, $12 for an entree, etc. and the waitstaff are friendly and local. I showed them some magic and the entire staff gathered around our table. One of the staff members ran away into the kitchen, he really believes in voodoo, we laughed behind his back. we even went out with the waitress to see a chamber music show at UNLV, that's how friendly friendly gets. Try their bruschetta salad--yum, and I've always liked their Mediterranean standards babaganoosh, etc.Really good fries too.
Loved this place!  the food was great and the hookah lounge was awesome!  I hope to stop by for hookah and food every Vegas trip!

Good place if you want to have a quick kebab fix. Hummus and baba ganoush was extremely good.The rice was flavorful and fluffy . The kubideh was succulent and tasty. The steak kebabs was just ok. Overall a nice mediterranean
place to have lunch.

This place is outstanding. Honestly, I could give a five star rating just for the Athens fries alone (as one reviewer noted, these are the real deal, and they sure as hell are). Hell I'd go out of my way to stop in here just for these. That being said, pretty much everything in here is five-star all the way.  We've been here 3-4 and we just can't get enough of the place. You can order pretty much anything on the menu - kebabs, curries, gyros, and you will not be disappointed. The hummus sampler is amazing too (get some baba ganoush as well).  Service is always great as well and the place just has a really nice ambiance about it, regardless of whether you are inside or out in the courtyard.

This is right by UNLV which is a great place for after classes or work to wind down! It's located in a plaza on the south west corner of Flamingo and S. Maryland Pkwy.

My favorite is their fries! I love just coming and hanging out with friends after a long day for some fries and beers. It's seasoned perfectly and delicious and definitely something I get every time I go to either Paymon's locations.

Another item I got was their fried calamari, which was surprisingly pretty good as well. It was seasoned perfectly the couple of times I got them, but it's just your average calamari.

The broiled ground beef kabob is delicious, it just left my mouth watering for more and I would always try to eat it all in one sitting, but end up taking some of it home for a snack later which still tastes amazing! It's never overly cooked and always seasoned well and has a savory taste to it. 

A safe choice always is their gyro platter or sandwich, it's just a typical gyro and isn't too special, but if you're unsure what you want it's always a good back up plan!

When they have the all you can eat pasta, it's a always a great deal especially when you're with friends and are unsure what to eat for dinner that night. You might as well! 

Overall it's one of my favorite places for mediterranean and one of the top contenders for best in town. I haven't been to another place that's as good as they are yet, but I'm looking!

Our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Came here tonight with my sister. We ordered all our favorites...Athens fries, lentil soup, Greek salad and chicken curry. The food was amazing as always and Randall our server saved the day. He went out of his way to check on us when we requested our soup and salad be served sooner. Long story short we appreciated the extra special service and will be back!

Great food, great selection - crowded at lunch though. Quality cuisine, their hummus is superb. I love their spanakopita (spinach pie with feta cheese); my wife loves their salmon. Their curry is excellent; service is prompt. The only thing that was average was their Tandoori Chicken - I've eaten lots of east Indian cuisine - not quite as much flavor.  Overall, hard to miss when you come here.

Love this place! Used to come here all the time when I lived in Vegas. They have this Mediterranean market attached next door as well. For a while, I used to think this place was just called the "Hookah Lounge". I would pass this place everyday since I lived near it until I just tried it, and fell in love. I didn't realize it is a small chain around Vegas. I'm not big on the hookah, but love the food and decor. Everything here is great. I love their flaming saganaki and their moussaka. I also love their lychee martini. And over the years they keep changing the place a bit, but always awesome.

The waitress did not know the food or what ouzo was or how to serve it. No ambiance. 
The food was great had Baba Ganosh which we shared and found delightful. 
The lamb kabob was very tasteful and tender however the rice was dry but acceptable. 
The special cold soup was great for hot days. 

All in all great food

I love mediterranean food, but I don't get this place. Though the hookah lounge is beautiful and romantic, every single time I've tried to eat something at Paymon's, I've been disappointed at best and at worst, even angry.
If you get a sandwich, expect lots of bread and very skimpy fillings (unless you count lettuce). If you get a salad, expect very little of anything except lettuce.
Maybe if I were a lettuce-atarian I'd like the place.

Visited May 19th, @6pm. Ordered kobideh. Waiter asked how I wanted it cooked. He offered MR, M, or well. Never in 63 years of my life I have been asked this before. 
The plate consists of 2 kobideh, salad and a small portion of rice. No bread. I had to ask for more rice and bread (1.75) extra.
The kebob was under cooked. Not Persian recipe.  Rice dry no butter served. Flat taste. Greek salad ok but I did not go there for that. Totally disappointed.
Waiter did not come to ask how things were. $17 f or this plate is outrageous. The bill includes a comment card wit h no question about the customer. I sent an email never got a response. This is not Persian food.

Used to be one of my favorates.  Went here the Last 4 times and service is progressively getting worse.  I don't have a lot of time to expound on details but, unless you're okay with a mystery white foamy sauce on your tabouli after asking if you could order extra. maybe go somewhere else.  Terrible service.  It's a shame cause I used to love this place.  It will be a while till me or my friends and family will trust them again.
This is one of the go-to places for my wife and I. Great food, great service, great ambiance. The only problem I have with this place is I can't stop eating. I leave stuffed to the gills every time.
The food was ok. Alissa was awesome and energetic. She noticed we were cold and offered us a hot tea when we walked in.

It's not really authentic. Maybe I'm not ordering the right stuff, it's barely good. If it was dirt cheap$ then I could give it an extra star. The service has always been pretty good and it's a cool spot for a big group. The food is just bland.

I was at paymons again last night. I have been going there since I moved here seven years ago, but never wrote a review. I keep coming back for the rich tasting food and the clever ambiance of both the lounge and the patio-like area. Last night I was reminded of the superb service that is seamless and friendly as to be natural and look easy. I am always treated well, and last night Brian the hookah guy and the lovely Julia attended me at the bar. She made me a Bloody Mary with paymons spices and it was just as savory and spicy the way I ordered it, and consistently delicious. Julia and Brian show their professionalism with regal style and efficiency. I also like the Tabouli with quinoa. It is my favorite salad, but the gyro salad is a close second. The curry they have is also a great take on the dish. I am a curry fan and the unique take on the dish keeps me coming back as I cannot find its equal. I will end with saying thank you to Julia again for that amazing Bloody Mary, her continued efficiency, and her beautiful smile. Of course I will just tell her next time I go in.

I've been going to Paymon's on Maryland for over 20 years. Usually I dine in, but I've also gotten pick up to take back to my place of business for lunch. I just about always order the hummus pita wrap. When I dine in, they put the hummus within the wrap, but when I've gotten this as a take out, they put the hummus on the side so I have to spread it on the pita myself. If I wanted to do self food prep, I bring my lunch from home. Today when I called in my order from pick up, I asked that the hummus be put on the pita as it is done when I dine in. When I picked up my order, I did not look within my wrap, but when I was going to enjoy it, noticed that there was no hummus. I called over there to log my complaint and was on hold for over ten minutes. Finally I was told they were too busy for the manager to talk to me, but she asked for my info and that next time I visited I'd get a free one.

service was great but the food lacked that mediterranean spice i wanted.  i ordered curry chicken and didn't like it at all.. way way to much rice and 5 very small pieces of chicken.. over priced and the lack of ppl in the establishment made my party feel like we smelled like a cheep las vegas whore.  
if you like paying a lot for crappy food then by all means check this hole in the wall place out...

Here's an LV best kept secret!! This little gem was AWESOME!! The gyro plate was OUTSTANDING! Those Greek fries were DEE'LISH! Everything else that was ordered was equally outstanding! Service was great and definitely a go to spot again!!!

My experience at this restaurant did not go as planned. I normally love Mediterranean food but this restaurant really changed that for me. My family was doing a takeout at 1 A.M. and the drive was 40 minutes round trip. The lady at the front desk told that our food would arrive in 15-20 minutes, when it actually took well over 45 minutes for our food to arrive. You would think that if they took their time with the food everything would be perfect about the meal, but you'd be crazy to think that. The dish we ordered, the beef koobideh, was supposed to come with a salad, but none of our meals came with that. How could they forget a vital part of the meal when there were no other customers in the restaurant? The rice did not even taste fresh which was a let down because I am very fond of rice. This meal was definitely not worth $64.
Best happy hour in Vegas hands down. Every day 5-7 $8.00 hookahs! 1/2 off apps and drinks. Amazing!
Later we went to see a show and we both got sick from the dinner...hate to post it but people need to know .diarreah.  seems as I read reviews it's happening a lot.  Bad meat...poultry?

Hookah lounge is cozy and accommodating. Didn't eat, but I enjoyed a few drinks and a great bowl of hookah. The service made the experience even better. Jaime is a hookah master and very attentive, friendly, and professional. Betty IPA is on special, drink it you like IPA's. Will definitely bring my friends back for a hookah session again soon.
I recommend this place to everyone. Food was good and you can even smoke hookah !

My favorite Mediterranean food place in Las Vegas! I always stop here after a weekend in LV.

Seating/ Service: the patio seating area is so casual, the seats are comfortable and the employees here do a great job at maintaining that vibe. They aren't intrusive while still making sure you always have what you need (water, sides, check, etc.) 

Steak Plates/ Kabobs: so good. They are juicy, hot and fresh. But the plates are so big you can definitely share one with someone. 

Athens Fries: my favorite fries. Especially dipped with tahini and hummus.. I'd even recommend to have them with the yogurt sauce. They are always so hot and fresh with the perfect amount of seasoning. I love them. 

Honestly, I've yet to be disappointed by anything here. Everything is made fresh and delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone in the Vegas area.

It's colorful to see jewel-like hues walking into the Restaurant. Colors of turqouise blue amidst magenta and purplish color tones of the upholstered chairs, the curtains and the painted walls. Rather cheerful. But our hostess led me and my Mom to another room where it had low-lighting. Mom commented it to be a little dark for her liking. Tables were adorned with electric candlelight. A flowing fountain decorated with cherubs  was in the center next to the exit door. Tables and padded chairs were set up around the room, as well as a few green plants. Hard to tell if they were real live plants or faux. A cozy atmosphere. A painted wall lends an air of romantic mystique. 

Whenever dining in a Meditterranean restaurant like this which serves Persian and Mediterranean cuisine, an order of hot mint tea is my favorite beverage to go along with such cuisine.  Especially that vegetarian food is healthy and favored, for starters the "Stuffed Grape Leaves" was delightfully juicy. It's a great vegetarian dish, a version of Greek Dolmas. It's listed on their menu as an Appetizer. Rice and herbs were wrapped in soft grape leaves and served with tzatziki sauce that complements it well. We had the pleasure to dine on the not so obscure "Chicken and Beef Kabobs" which was served with rice, and vegetables. The "Athens Fries" were delicious in its seasoned rendering which is served with a dipping sauce. Time went by before our meal was served.  The male waitstaff was attentive, friendly and patient.

Adjacent to the room we dined in had a few patrons entering and leaving the "Hookah Lounge" room.  It is where "shisha" or flavored tobacco from a common nargile (or hookah water pipe) is shared by patrons on a table. We did not enter nor try a "hookah". Although it is unlike nicotine smoking, it is one habit I prefer to not even desire to try. 

From the time we arrived to the time we left, there were a constant set of diners arriving and leaving the restaurant.
Great service. they bent over backwards to make us happy. The hummus is a must and the anthens fries are so good!! Drink menu is great. Food came out quickly.

This place is classic, and it took me 15 years of living in Vegas before finally landing here for dinner. Every table around us had plates of fries so I assume they're delicious. We went a little lighter. 

I ordered the chicken curry dish. I LOVE curry. I can't say this is the best curry I've ever had, but it was decent. The chicken was cooked well and the portion was a full two meals.

The Big Guy got the ground lamb kabobs. He loved them. 

Overall I'd say the place could use a little make-over and a deep cleaning, and I definitely want to go back and try some of those fries

This place left me very satisfied after the meal.  The place offered a variety of interesting dishes, had pleasing decor for setting the meal experience and the service was very attentive.
     If you're vacationing, make sure your room has a frig cuz you're likely to have leftovers!  The kids had pasta and pizza(Italian), I had Fesenjan(Persian chicken with pomegranate sauce) and hubby had chicken curry(Indian).  All the dishes were well portioned and incredibly delicious.  I'm just salivating just thinking about the experience.
     If you're looking for interesting and delicious food and not a buffet fan, definitely try this place out.

I love their food. I was craving it. I wanted a chicken kabob. They sat me in the courtyard and proceeded to ignore me for 15 minutes (yes I timed it) so I left. The waiter cleared the table near me then took the order of the guy sitting next to me. It's like I wasn't even there. Their service is usually hit or miss. Tonight was a big miss.

I had the combination kabob platter, Hummus, and tabouli (done right) The service was great and they had a wide variety of dinner options. 

The wine list had some great choices and prices reasonably. You can get a much better value for your money if you are willing to get away from the strip where everything is overpriced and overhyped. 

I'll come here again.

Paymons is pretty gluten free friendly! I'm not a fan of their menu redesign (it's less descriptive). The food is consistently yummy, especially the chicken curry and Athens fries! The service depends on who is serving. Today we had a very friendly, helpful female waiter. There is an older gentleman who is on waitstaff who has always been rude to our group.

Paymon's is a great little hidden gem. I've only gone for lunch so far. I'm pescatarian so I typically go for a salad and a small dip spread to share. They're menu has options for most diets and they offer lunch (half) or dinner (full) sizes to a lot of their menu items. The dining environment is on the casual - business casual side. Dished range from $10-$17 (w/add ons). 

Recommended pick for a veggie: 
The Kale Salad approx $10
(Kale, red onions, garbanzo beans, pine nuts, sliced dates and topped with goat cheese. Tossed in a balsamic-date dressing.)

Dips:
Hummus
Yogurt - Cucumber 

My heart is still set on trying their "Athens Fries" they smelt unreal!!! So I will be back!

If you're willing to take a short ride off the strip, head to this local place for some excellent Mediterranean food. 

We came for a late lunch on a Friday and were seated immediately. We each got a pita wrap (they are GIANT here!) and shared an order of fries. 

I got the gyros wrap and my friend got the falafel hummus one. It was so much food we just had a snack before our concert and pizza after. Really... very substantial meal! And not just quantity... very high quality.

Drinks were refilled proactively and often. I look forward to visiting again on another visit to Vegas!

Cruised on over to Paymon's for lunch after coming from the tattoo parlor.  I'm not a particular fan of Mediterranean food but I was looking to grub on something out of my ordinary so off we went to Paymon's.  There are so many good options here for both the carnivores and the herbivores out there so I was actually pretty overwhelmed with all the choices to choose from.  I've had the spanakopita (?) and the falafel pita sandwich here before and they were pretty good actually.  I almost caved in and chose the falafel but I noticed that they still have the AYCE pasta going for $8.95 so I went with that instead.  So much for going out of the box right?  They have a good selections of noodle types and pasta sauces so I had myself a few bowls and left happy.

ALSO make sure to grub on some appetizers if you're extra hungry.  The athens fries and the spinach-shrimp dip are killer!  They serve their fries with a sweet mustardy spiced dip (not sure what's in it but it makes good lunch convo to try and speculate) and pita bread with their spinach dip, which is a nice touch instead of the usual chip and dip monotany.  Overall a pretty good place to come and relax and have a nice lunch.

This applies to the Hookah lounge only as the meal and service we had in the restaurant was great.

They have posted on the door their "dress code" which seemed a bit silly as this is a pretty informal place. It is the basic stuff, no shorts, sandals, tank tops, hats, etc. Well two of our group had hats on and we were told immediately we had to remove them, no problem.

Upon sitting us down and taking our order we noticed not one but two people wearing baseball hats similar to ours. When we asked why we were told because they are girls and the rule is for guys only. After a quick trip to the bathroom I noticed that in fact the sign says only "no hats" 

So being a bit of a jerk I asked again why the double standard. I was told the rule is for guys and if we don't like it we can leave. I asked to speak with a manager and they sent over this lovely british or aussie lady that was unnecessarily rude stating that they have had gang problems so no hats for guys. Apparently there are no hookah loving female gang members...

When I pointed out that her sign didn't say only guys can't wear hats she became irate and asked the two hat wearing non-gang member ladies to remove their hats. She then returned and said "there, now no one is wearing a hat, are you happy?" I told her I would have been happier if she acted in a professional manner and not like a child. 

Our actual waitress tried her best but the experience was ruined and we will not be back.

I wouldn't expect people to stop going here based on my experience over the silly hat rule, however you may want to skip the hookah bar with an admitted gang problem, something tells me their sexist no hat policy won't keep them out lol.

One of my favorite places to go. 

Service Is lacking. A few times we have waited lengthly amounts of time before someone even gets our drink order. 

The food makes up for it though. As others have stated. The Athens Fries are SO good! Seasoned yummy goodness, the sauce is amazing too. The hummus is great, and it comes with plenty. All of there pitas are on point as well. You can get them in either the folded pita or pocket. I recommend the folded. They are huge! I have also had the Spinach Pie. Wasn't my favorite. I found it overly soggy and lacking in flavor.  


I love that after your finished eating. You can just hop over to the other side for some, after dinner Hookah. Also reasonably priced.

Great combo plate w/ more food than I could eat for lunch. They are happy to substitute cucumbers for pita if you are gluten intolerant.  Great service!  Will keep beverage filled & do beverage to go as well.

Great ground lamb kabob and Mediterranean rice.  The food is authentic and great for price. Service was a bit slow, but we came at a time when the rush started.  

Casual dining but fantastic food

What a great place to hang out with much of locals in Las Vegas ! We are from San Diego and it was my first visit ! The owner welcomed us with excellent service and really good music ! The best hukkah lounge in Las Vegas . I loved everything about it ! My friend (farnaz)  and I (shirin) would  love to thank Paymon and his wife for their excellency to run their business so awesome ! We look forward to go back and visit again ! I would highly recommend this place if you are looking to ha e some good ambiance , dance and great food along hukkah ! Cozy and very well decorated also.

Good, quick mediterranean dishes - best purchased for lunch.  Yes, this place can get pricey (dinner, naturally) but it's a good lunch spot.  I have visited this establishment on three occassion (2x for lunch and 1x for dinner).  In the three times I've visited, I ordered the following:

Gyro - lots and lots of meat.  Although, I wasnt thoroughly impressed with the lettuce and tomato (I like romaine lettuce but it's just a preference thing).

Kabobs - for dinner, this is a lot of food.  The lamb and sirloin were cooked perfectly - tender.  The meal included rice and a salad.

Overall, I am happy with their spices and flavors.  It's a good place to go when craving something different.  

Also, they do sell their spice blends...good to know so if you're inspired to prepare something at home...go here to get the spices!
I like this place.... good food & pretty good service; they always smile... the hookah lounge is a little small but quite cozy... they have friendly pricing in regards to their drinks...

This place holds a little sentimental value for me and my family.  I remember coming here for the first time over 12 years ago.  The place is always clean with great service.  My mom loves the lentil soup and my dad really likes this cheese appetizer (forgot the name).  My 11 year old son is adamant they make the best calamari and marinara on the planet.  We both can't get enough of their teas which come in individual kettles.  If you're in the las vegas area and haven't gone to Paymans yet you should definitely try them out!

Mediocre food, terrible service, & management that leaves a lot to be desired! A group of us went here for my birthday this past July ( I know, it's been awhile), & it was by far one of the WORST dining experiences I've ever had! The hostess was rude & standoffish from the word "go"(she acts as though you're bothering her because she has to seat you). A friend of ours in the group was told he had to change his shirt ( he was wearing a tank top) or leave. When I inquired as to why, the server told me that no tank tops were allowed. I guess he must have missed the lady 2 tables over from us that was wearing a tank top as well. Thankfully, our friend had an extra shirt in his car, but by that point I was already angry about a policy that wasn't posted anywhere, & enforced by an obnoxious server who shouldn't  be in any kind of customer service position. 

Our food took forever, it was far from great, & we kept being pressured about smoking the stupid hookah. Far from even a decent birthday dining experience, & when the manager was called about the ordeal, he took down my number & I never received a phone call back from him. If there was a zero star rating, that's exactly what this place would get. Please' don't waste your time or money here.

Love it here! The lamb is flipping awesome! The spicy fries are pretty darn good as well. We almost always have tea here, and it is very good. There is a hooka lounge here as well, so you can sit with friends and have a puff and a cocktail after dinner or before. I am pretty sure they have a locals night as well, some percentage off your bill or something.
The decor is nice, a bit dark, but it does have more of a lounge feel..
However, I must say I have been to the restroom here 2 times on different nights and oh man, not the best smelling bathroom.. uugghhhh

After spending 3 weeks in Greece, cruising through the Greek Islands and Turkish coast, I was craving Mediterranean food even after I got home.

Meat combo platter: Lamb kabob - well seasoned but weak on the spices (probably toned down for American taste buds), chicken - slightly dry, steak - superb. Chicken Fesenjan - WOW!!! and I don't even like chicken. 
Baklava: Walnut and Pistachio filling - very authentic ingredients. However, it was soggy, and not enough honey.  It was obvious that it had been sitting around for more than a day. 

I seriously need to purchase another flight back to Greece, so I can have fresh baked Baklava 5 times a day.

Plus for the hummus and the staff. Fresh made hummus and warm soft pita. Can't go wrong.
Minus for the gyro. Less than flavorful. Pita bread was decent, but the meat was bland as can be. I was really surprised at that.
Athens fries were awesome though, with that dipping sauce they have. I'd go back, just stay away from the bland gyro.
P aymons is a great place to eat, the serving size is awesome.  the food is delicious. I have been going here for years.  I don have one complaint.

Paymon's is a great place to go when you just feel like eating out but have no specifics on where or what. We usually get a combination dip with hummus and another dip (bouranni, lebni, or cucumber yogurt) and an entree to share. That's the way to go if you want enough food for two for cheap. People often say the hummus isn't that great here, and I wouldn't be surprised if it really isn't. I'm not a big hummus aficionado though, so I don't mind it. We also got the Athens fries for the first time the last time we went, and they were good...just not as good as they're hyped up to be, I suppose.

We got the Pastitsio for the entree that time, and it was very good and filling. It's sort of like lasagna, but different. We've gotten the gyro platter before, and I think that's always a good choice. Boyfriend likes the baked kibbe, but there's better things on the menu to me. We finished it off with some rice pudding that was yummy yummay.

The service is always great and fairly quick. The place is clean with a seating choice between the dining room or the courtyard. There's a mini market and a hookah lounge attached, both to which I've never been, but it just makes the place a little extra special.

I can't believe I haven't yet written a review of this place, because it was fantastic! I was given a gift certificate and enjoyed the opportunity to try out a new place for free. 

My friend and I had a veritable feast, sharing a beef/lamb sausage entree with rice, pita and three different dips, Athens fries, and finished the meal up with baklava. We were so stuffed that we had a meal and a snack out of the leftovers later. 

The tzatziki was amazing.  I love any kind of dip, so the hummus and the baba ganoush were welcomed. The baba ganoush was smokey, unlike any I had ever had. I stuffed my face with what seems like several pounds of deliciousness over the next few days. I loved trying different bites of different things--fries, pita, sausage--in the different dips. Definitely worth the five stars alone!

It did get a little spotty with service, however. We arrived at 7pm with nobody else in the joint, and then it all the sudden got slammed, and our table was in the crossfire of forgetfulness. It was no matter, though, because we were so hungry and filling our bellies with the deliciousness of Paymon's that we didn't care!

I went here with Debra R and Jose R for lunch. I got the tandoori chicken. Debra R got the salmon and Jose R got a kabob plate and the spinach pie. The food was kind of good. This place sells seasonings and spices. We got some new seasoning too.

Love this place for a nice date or small gathering of friends. The food is tastey, the setting a little on the intimate side. The food can also be served on the hookah lounge. All together it's an inspired take on Mediterranean cuisine and has a neat energy to it.

My boyfriend's parents are always wanting to take us here but we've never made it until this recent trip. I have to say, I'm impressed with their selection and their meticulous labeling of everything.   
We started with the combination platter and that was delicious, generous portions. I ordered the soup and fetosh salad: the soup was a bit watery and salad, the salad was enormous and flavorful but if you don't like a tangy, lemon dressy then I'd ask for the dressing on the side because it's covered in lemon.  There was a little mix up with other saldas but, overall, everyone liked their food. The water was really attentive and helpful. We sat in the back room between the main entrance and the hookah lounge and it was quiet, which was great to talk. 
Overall, I'd definitely suggest a visit and would go back to try a few other things.

Been coming here for years, back in the day when hookahs were actually flavored tobacco and not flavored herbs, used to come here for happy hour in the hookah lounge, but most recently usually come here for dinner after work. Typical order is yogurt cucumber dip for the app, which I could eat for my meal. Another standard meal is the gyro salad, the gyro meat is perfect, not tough or greasy and the salad dressing is so flavorful. Or if you feel like fish, try the Greek salad and add a salmon filet, omg so good. Not sure what secret spices they use on their salmon but man I love it. A great Persian dish is the fesenjan, it's an acquired taste, and not esthetically pleasing to the eye, but it's rich with pomegranate flavor and other spices, and the rice is cooked to perfection (the rice here is probably one of my favorites in town). I stepped out of my Mediterranean box tonight and had the falafel pita and I was very disappointed, very dry, not tasty at all.  And to finish dinner, try the rice pudding-so good. I'm not a huge fan of baklava, but I have to say it's pretty good here as well. Oh and the iced tea! How can I forget the iced tea! I usually drink a gallon when I'm there.

By far the best I have had anywhere! Everything from the  grape leaves to hummus and lean is awesome and that is just for appitizers! I had the kibble and it is cooked to perfection. My grandmother is Lebanese and it is on part with her perfection of cooking. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for middle eastern food in vegas!

Probably my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. I have been eating here for about 11 years now and have never had a bad experience. The staff is always friendly and remembers your name and order. The food is excellent and comes out very fast, even when it's busy. Well done.

When we got there, half the restaurant was empty.  Still, they sat us directly next to the door that led to the next room, which also led to the bathroom hallway.  After about 2 minutes of having the door directly behind me open and close repeatedly and watching people emerge down the hallway, I had us move to one of the corner tables next to the window- most of the tables next to the window were empty.

We ordered fries, which were okay but not great and cost too much.

I repeatedly had to ask to have out water refilled throughout the meal.  At one point, I had to get up to get their attention.  Again, the restaurant was not busy.

Then, I ordered the eggplant parmesan.  Big mistake- the eggplant was too flat and way too dry.  The spices did not complement the food.  The pasta itself was okay, but the sauce was really watery and again the spices did not work.  And it cost a lot more than it should have considering.

I ate less than half the meal and then took the rest of the meal home with me planning to eat it for lunch the next day.  Then, on second thought, I realized there was no way I was going to be interested in eating the leftover, and I gave the rest away.

I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 star because the friend I went with says that it's usually better than what I experienced- she loves coming here.

This was my first time experiencing this type of food. My boss is a frequent food connoisseur and ordered great food. She chose the combination Platter and a Gyros Salad all of which we shared. The combination platter came with hummus, tabuli, stuffed grape leaves, falafel, yogurt-cucumber dip, baba ganosh and athens fries. All of them were amazing!!! So exciting! The athens fries were delicious. I absolutely love myself some fries and these were incredible. All of this was pretty new to me and I certainly enjoyed the variety. The salad included fresh vegetables, Greek dressing, gyros meat and tzatziki sauce on a large bed of greens with Greek olives. This was my first time having gyros meat and I would definitely go for it again! The atmosphere was so cute! It was very comfortable and I enjoyed sitting out by the fountain. It made our experience that much better. Such a quaint little place!

Can't believe I've never ate here prior to today. I liked the feel of the restaurant. It was pretty slow b/w 6-7 on a Saturday. Great food options and portions. Wide selections of drinks too. Hookah lounge side has happy hour.

Everything about this place was spot on last night! Service was exceptional - we had HEATHER wait on us & her energy was contagious!!! So bright & pleasant. But most importantly our food was so good! My husband was stuffed, satisfied & couldn't even finish all his food ... @ 250 lbs, 6 ft tall with muscles - that was unusual. speaks to the really good portions which weren't overpriced & the flavor. He had a combo lamb plate and I had the eggplant parmesan. We shared hummus ... rich & tasty! We really enjoyed this place. No crazy crowds or lines - just good food & good service!

I remember when this used to be called the Middle Eastern Bazaar then the Mediterranean café.  Have always liked their falafels, spanakopita, dolmas, salads, hummus and Athens fries. Yesterday tried their curry chicken and it was delicious!  Will frequent this gem more often.

I'm super picky about Mediterranean food. It's so easy for restaurants to get away with under seasoning the food, not using enough sauce and making everything taste super dry, and using canned or boxed ingredients.  Paymon's far exceeded my expectations.  There were so many choices and flavors, and everything was fresh and delicious.  I highly recommend the appetizer platter.  The falafel were amazing (I generally do not like falafel at all), the flavors they used were just right (not too overpowering) and there were so many yummy sauces to play with.  The baba ghanouj was also super delicious.

This place was so Yum Yum!

Stopped in for lunch today and it was packed but we got seated right away!

I had a incredible tasting chicken rap in pita "it was huge and plentiful with some very delicious fries!  I got so full!  Food came out in a very timely and warm!

Our Server David was very professional, Army Veteran, took care of the table and all our needs!

The atmosphere was nice!

Totally recommend this place for family, friends, co-workers, and a nice date!

A must go!

Why is it that every visit ends up with me having to piss like a race horse?

Oh, I remember, it's the iced tea.  I drink gallons of it!  And when it's time to leave, I get a fresh to-go cup.  I have been coming here for years (16 to be exact) and my bladder never fails to get maxed out.  Paymon's is one of the few places I can think of that still brews this brand of passion fruit flavored iced tea.

But the pee tea isn't the only reason I come here.  It's also the Athen's fries.  Yup.  I eat fries at a Mediterranean restaurant.  But these ain't your run of the mill fries.  They have a crazy tasty seasoning and a dipping sauce I could pour over everything.  I have tried a lot of the menu items with some hits and misses.  However, I always fall back on my reliable favorites: gyros salad, lebni, hummus and baba ganosh.  And I used to love stealing some of the buttered noodles from the kids...until they stopped leaving leftovers.  

Besides the food (and tea), they open up the hookah lounge at night and are open till late.  I've only been to the lounge about three times, but it's a decent spot.  Reasonably priced drinks along with access to the entire menu can make for a looooong night.  The only downside IMHO is that they use a cheaper hookah tobacco that doesn't last as long, burn as evenly and isn't as strong as the higher-end stuff (Starbuzz, anyone?).  An apple bowl would be a nice option, but they don't even offer it.  And they could be more attentive to the coals, though I guess that's irrelevant since the tobacco doesn't last very long anyway.  Regardless, like I said, it's decent.  And I don't come for the hookah.  I come for the tea.  And I run for the urinal.

Went here today with my boss for lunch. We came before the lunch rush and we had an awesome waitress. We had three appetizers, hummus and pita, dolmas, and greek yogurt w/ cucumber.

The dolmas I had never tried before today, but the were good. The hummus was so yummy and my waitress was sweet and kept refilling my pita plate and even brought me some to take home since I couldn't finish the large hummus.

The iced tea was really good to and came with mint leaves and an orange slice which was a nice touch! I plan on going back soon, but 11:30 seems to be the key, as at noon it was hectic!

We had dinner here just the other night, and always try to sit in the courtyard. It is so nicely decorated, you definitely don't feel like you're in a strip mall in Vegas! I had forgotten how late they stayed open and felt like I was keeping the servers, but when I asked them they laughed and told me they didn't close until 1am (this was a Thurs.) and to take as long as we wanted. Very nice and they checked in appropriately. We all split the vegetarian sampler of baba ghanoush, hummus, tabbouleh, dolmas, really great falafel, lots of olives, and fresh slices of tomato ( I may be forgetting a few items). It was all drizzled with olive oil and served with warm fluffy pita bread. Oh I forgot to mention the best part...Athens fries! Served with various dipping choices. It was great for the 3 of us, perfect for sharing. Next we decided to share the moussaka meal and the spanikopita meal. The spanikopita meal came with a yummy sort of vegetable stew and a really good salad of romaine, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese with a tasty dressing. The moussaka meal came with the same salad and a big mound of rice. They were both soo good we had forgotten how full we were from the sampler and over stuffed ourselves! We've been coming here for what seems like forever, I don't know exactly how long they've been open maybe since the late 80's as I remember my mom taking me when I was young. Either way it's delicious and just writing about it makes my mouth water :)

To quote a friend when we first stepped into Paymon's: "Great 80's Music and Great Hookah... This place gets 5 F*CKING STARS in my book, TRICK!"

He was right. 

I gave this place 5 stars for a number of reasons:

1st: Hands down has got to be one of the best places I have ever smoked at other than my place. 1 or 2 puffs... gets the job done. To quote the great Crisco.. "High like a KITE, KITE, KITE... been token all NITE, NITE, NITE... all night long... let me hit that... HOOKAH!

2nd: the service here is way superior than any hookah place i've been too, and even better than any other restaurant establishment as well. Very prompt, fast, and attentive. 

3rd: the food was very fresh... we order the sample platter and were treated to very well cooked Mediterranean cuisine.  The pita bread tasted like as it was hand made the second we got there, the humas was delightfully tasty, the falafels we're cooked to perfection, the fries were extremely crisp and well seasoned... just everything on the plate was a good buy.  

No doubt will this place be part of my Vegas routine when I stop by in town again. KICK ASS!!

Review of the lounge side.

Bar service is spectacular. 
Jaime is by far the best followed by John.
The table side service is wanting and needing more help and attentiveness.
The food is fantastic.
Service again on the lounge side is very much dependant on where you sit.

Just awful!! Never again!  I ordered curry chicken with rice, what I got was something that tasted like 3 tablespoon of salt, overcooked, dry chicken and and the rice was so greasy I can use it for polishing my furniture! The service was even worse! The waitress acted like she was doing me a favor by showing up to work. God forbid if you ask her for refills! Wow! Very disappointed with the owners of this restaurant if you are truly Persian than you know better than to serve "dog food" to your customers. Here is a helpful hint  try to hire middle eastern cooks. hello! You think Mexicans know anything about curry chicken or Kibbah. OMG! Really?

Yum!  I love this place.  They have an extensive menu ranging from Italian to Mediterranean.  I opted to have the Chicken Kubideh plate that came w/ 2 kabobs, basmati rice with BUTTER, and salad.  I also had the combination sample platter with their awesome french fries, hummus, baby ganoush, and falafels.  Their falafels here are really good!  Bursts w/ flavor.  And their fries!  OMG! Their fries!  A must have on the side!

I'm definitely coming back to explore the rest of their menu!
I go out never expecting much from anywhere but this place couldn't even meet bare minimum requirements.

The food here is awesome! I ordered the gyro platter. It comes with vermicelli romaine salad that had feta and awesome meat. It came out fast AF and was good AF. I ordered a vodka drink and it is good too. Oh and they play good music. I will come here again for sure.

Best gyros and awesome Mediterranean style fries. This is a great Mediterranean restaurant which serves quality and quantity. The plates are huge the gyros are huge and the menu is full of options you would never make at home. Come here for a good meal that doesn't disappoint your taste buds

Great food, great ambiance, good fun. Very eclectic Mediterranean selection with enough American to please the kids. Eat the Athena spiced fries, and everything else! More greek than Arabic, but still a large menu guaranteed to please the whole family, and the more discerning food lovers!
My favorite Greek in Vegas. Ice tea is tropically delicious. Greek salad always fresh. Falafel just right. Hummus yummy.

I met a few friends here for happy hour in the Hookah Lounge.  On Tuesdays, it's happy hour for locals from 5 p.m. - 1 a.m.  I got there at 5:30 and left by 7:30 because that is how I roll.  My soul is older than I appear.   

On to the important stuff!  This was my first time, so I got a little confused by the sign near the door I came in and ended up at the hostess stand.  She was kind enough to walk me over to the Hookah Lounge.  Very friendly and not bothered at all my general lack of direction.  

I had two very delicious mojitos.  Our server was apparently doubling as a bartender as well, because I saw her behind the bar.  There were several servers who stopped by to check on us and service was freaking fabulous.  Even better, we were that group with a crap ton of credit cards, and our server took care of it without any issues.  

I tried the Athens fries and Calamari.  I had the fries at Bite of Las Vegas which is why I wanted to come here in the first place.  It was NOT just the beer talking at Bite of LV.  These fries are good! Calamari was okay.  I had a bite of my friend's hummus and found it to be pretty bland and a little runny for my taste.  Overall, I loved the vibe of this place.  Will definitely come back!

I've been coming to Paymon's for awhile now for lunches during the work week and it's always been bomb.com...  Time to give some props with the details of this past lunch visit with the work crew celebrating the department "mom's" birthday.  Lunch party of 6 please... 

Service: 5/5 Shout out to our server "Robert B" and the efficient kitchen staff who took care of us with a full lunch crowd. After taking our order, in about ten minutes the Pesto Hummus, Side Fries and Dinner salad were on the table. Less than 7 minutes later, everyone had their individual entrees.  Robert stopped by frequently to make sure everyone's waters and Ice Teas were fresh.  I had to take home about 1/4 of my Giro Platter and he packaged it up for me.  They brought out the complimentary Birthday Baklava with extra spoons to share.  From sitting down to closing the bill, the whole lunch experience was under 1 hour WITH the extra birthday dessert.  Fantastic....#1 af!

Food: 4.5/5 The freshness of the vegetables and the high quality of the ingredients utilized has always stayed consistent with my lunch visits at Paymon's.   Today we went with the:
Pesto Hummus Full sized:  The Pesto compliments the hummus so well and both were very fresh.  They came out with 2 half slices pita bread for size of us and asked if we wanted more.
Athens Fries:  Seasoned fries that were fresh but not too hot.  The Seasoning and the dipping sauce is amazing.  Has the same effect on me that the Caine's sauce has, but I digress..
Gyros Platter:  The plate was huge and covered evenly with the pilaf, meat and the salad.The thinly sliced Rotisserie beef and lamb was very tasty.  Delicious.  The Vermicelli pilaf complimented the meats and the house salad on the side was fresh with a nice dressing.  So much food I had to take some home. (see pic)

Value: 5/5  Great value for the quality of food and the portions I received.  
$3.25 Athens Fries half size.
$8.50 Full sized Pesto Humus that was enough for our party of 6
$12.95 Gyros platter that had so much food I had to take some home.  For those that know me, they'll know how powerful a statement that is as my tolerance for eating through fullness is 4 out of 5 stars on a bad day.  ijs..

Ambiance: 4/5 Smartly decorated with Mediterranean art and accents throughout the restaurant.  The tables and chairs were spaced perfectly to walk through a full restaurant without bumping into anyone.  Entrees served on big plates which I always appreciate.  I can get claustrophobic when it comes to food on my plate.  I'm working on it...

Summary: I still have yet to stop by for dinner but I see a dinner visit coming soon as EVERY lunch experience I've had so far has been a positive one.  They have Italian, Greek, Middle Eastern/International and Indian entrees.   I haven't tried any of their Italian dishes but that is absolutely happening on the next mf visit. The menu is extensive, food is tasty and the service has been consistently good.  I see a visit to the Hookah lounge coming too, but that is another yelp story...enjoy... =)

We arrived here and all the doors were locked. Each sign said use the other door. Finally we had to go through the hookah lounge. There was no hostess. Inside decore was ghetto. Wobbly tables. Ordered the athens fries. Very good. The restaurant also has its own cayenne hot sauce, which was surprisingly good. The food came out and the portions are huge. I got the veggie platter that came stuffed grape leaves, falafel, hummus and baba ganoush. Everything was one note. Nothing stood out. Wife got the chicken kebab. The chicken was okay. The rice that they served with it was not okay. Tasted and looked old. Weird notes of cinnamon. The area surrounding was ghetto. Wont be coming back.

I AM SO IN LOVE after last night! 
So, yelp doesn't list it as a Hookah lounge, but IT IS. I have been to hookah spots before, but I think this might just be my favorite. I used to go to the one on Sahara about 2 years back, but this one is a lot more "personable" IMO. 
And, you guessed it! They have a awesome HAPPY HOUR (if you know me, you KNOW those are the fastest way to my heart :)! 
The food was delish! I vote for the wings and pita pizzas...during happy hour, you can get a hookah for about 7 dollars and I'm a huge fan of "chocolate mint" or mixing "strawberry and lemon"....

Most of the staff is super friendly and makes sure you have everything you want/need. We ate good, they had good music, had a good hookah and great times.... All for less than 30.00! An amazing way to wind down at the end of the day. Please, do yourself a favor and try this place at least once. You'll be glad you did. :)

Terrible service especially in the lounge (hookah) area. The girls are so rude ALWAYS, and unfortunately i am not talking based on visit , been there couple times as the location is convenient to me, but every time i was disappointed..
The food is ok but so oily and they use so much lemon on everything.

Paymon's is authentic Middle Eastern the way Carrabba's is authentic Italian - it's not.  

But they have good cooks who do a good enough job that it doesn't matter.  I shared the combo platter with three others, and it had all those unique dishes that you come to a place like this for: Tabouli, Baba Ganoush, Hummus, something else I can't spell or pronounce correctly unless I have a cold.

My meetup group decided to come here and I enjoyed the chance to check it out.  I've driven by many times but never ate here.  What's with the name?  Is that Lebanese or something?  I'm too tired to really care.  

I did not have time to try the hookahs.  I'm not even sure what a hookah is - I always thought it was a glass contraption college kids used to hide the smell of the weed they were smoking.  Or a stage prop from Alice in Wonderland.  I guess I'm not gettin jiggy with it.

I saw no strippers while I was eating here.  Minus one star.
Such a great place to eat there food is awesome! !! Tammy c... has been are server 3 out of 4 times she is the best and they all work as a team...love this place. ..

Very Excellent Food five star for that 
If you want excellent service there is a lady I don't know her name but she was not our server , older brown hair where's it up in a bun. The next time I go there she will be my server . I really noticed she did an excellent job at all her tables. Our server guy older gentleman salt and pepper hair. Not a good server. We ordered appetizers when we were serve them we did not have any plates to serve ourselves.  My friend had to get them . About 5-7 mins later he came with plates he turn right around he saw we didn't need them. He pretty much ignored us toward the end of the meal then he was trying to be as nice if he can be.

I came here around 10pm.  I ordered the chicken kabob plate.  It was pretty delicious.  The rice was nice and fluffy.   the side vegetables came out a little burnt, but that's to be expected.  It's a little pricey for what you get, but the service is fantastic.  Very attentive.

Had lunch here the other day. They have a cold cucumber/yogurt soup that was pretty tasty. Had raisins in it which were not my favorite but it was still pretty nice on a warm day. 

The Gyro sandwiches are huge. I couldn't finish my entire pita and ended up eating most of it with a fork. I think a little more tzatziki sauce would have helped the flavor profiles. Lots of meat and the roasted red peppers are quite tasty. 

I would definitely go back to try some of their other options.

Came here after a terrible experience at Azuza. Complete opposite experiences! Although there was a big private party in the main room, we were able to sit in the indoor patio area. Quick service, great music, friendly waitress, and great drinks. Will definitely be back.

THE best Mediterranean place I have ever been to. The food is very flavorful, the menu has a lot to offer and I can go there with my vegetarian friends. Service is somewhat lacking but the food makes up for it. One of my favorite places in Vegas, or any city, for that matter.

I always use to come here a few years ago with 2 of my girlfriends and it became our favorite happy hour spot until they moved out of Vegas. 

Recently decided to start bringing a couple of my coworkers by and they absolutely love this place. Especially our girl Jessica! She is so sweet, fun and always takes good care of us. 

Also Gabriel he knows how to make some good hookah and takes good care of us as well! 

So if you're looking for good hookah spot to just relax and chill with some friends, I recommend you come by here. Especially during happy hour 5-7p :)

We like this place. We have been there a number of times whenever we visit from San Antonio, Texas. In San Antonio, we go to Pasha's regularly. 

Here are some differences. Paymon's has much more atmosphere. but, the food is generally better in Pasha's. In Pashas, as soon as you sit down, you are served with a free 10 inch round hot fresh naan bread along with a saucer of olive oil containing spices. And they replace it often, all complementary. 

Paymons give small pieces of dry cold triangles of pita bread. 

We would tell Pashas to improve their atmosphere, and tell Paymons to consider serving the fresh hot naan bread.
Forget about the Vegas buffets! This place has 4 different types of ethnic food for a great price. The locals only vibe is a relief from the tourist traps. Can't wait to go back.
Love this place. Always great service, stiff drinks, amazing food, and very comfortable atmosphere. Have never had a bad experience here, perfect place for a guaranteed good night.

Really good food & good price, big portion, nice environment & servers!!Love to come back asap!! We all like our food a lot.. We had combination platter for appertizer, salmon platter, chicken pita sandwich, baked kibbe platter, gyro plater. DELICIOUS!!

The BF and I visited the hookah lounge here during happy hour, and the prices are spot on! 

Drinks and food are half off, I'd recommend the Pear-sian Drop martini ($4), the Pesto Pita Pizza ($3.50) and the Athens Fries ($4?)

We were immediately greeted by friendly and helpful staff, and presented with a tray full of hookah flavors to smell. Pretty simple and awesome concept, considering flavor choices at other hookah places can be hit or miss. It was $7.50 for a hookah, but we opted for the $10 "frozen" hookah, containing a gel much like the stuff found in those frozen cups that keep your beer cold. 

The atmosphere is lush and exotic feeling, and they played great classic rock. I'm tired of euro-trash house music and trance, people! 

The hookah smoke was perfect and taste was great, but THEY DON'T REFILL COALS DURING HAPPY HOUR! WTF! What a waste of a good bowl. It had a good 30-40 minutes left in it!I knew the price was too good to be true. That's my only gripe about the place. I'd rather pay $10-15 for a place that has coal service. 

Paymon, goddamn it, change your coal service policy and I'll consider giving you 5 stars!

Wonderful place!  Homey and delicious Mediterranean food... I had the combo plate and it was all good ... lentil soup was excellent...service very good  I will surely be a regular here since they have so many choices and yummy food.  
Great find and walkable...yay

Pretty chill place. I love the decor. Great drink selection. Service is great too!

Stole a couple of fries from a friend to try as I had already eaten dinner. The spices that coated the fries were excellent. Didn't need ketchup or their special sauce.

Delicious! The food is consistently exceptional. The wait staff is great! I go there because the Persian and Mediterranean food they serve is right on! From the Mediterranean Sampler Platter to the various types of kabob, to the fragrant basmati rice, it's all perfect every time! Both locations are wonderful, but the original is still my favorite! Yum! This place is on any food tour I have when people visit.
This is nice place to chill out. Good flavoured hookah. Tues drinks only $6 . Will b back if crave for hookah

Great place to stop in for a healthy mediterranean meal.  Fairly priced with good service.  I had the steak kabob and it was tasty and juicy.  PRO TIP: Wednesdays = 25% off entire bill for customer appreciation day!

I have been here 3 times. The worst part is that I live in Green Valley so it is a bit of a drive. I have had a few dishes, but I love the salads and the dessert. Especially the baclava because it is so sweet and flakey. I order it on every visit. The staff is always friendly.

The decor in the middle room makes you feel like you are in a courtyard somewhere which was nice.  The service was flawless.  The food itself was great!  I had the Persian dish which was sweet, savory and a little salty all at the same time.  The grape leaves were some of the best I've had (we got two orders to go just to take them home with us).  So glad we decided to try this place!

I had not been to Paymon's in over a year when I overdosed on Mediterranean food. On Wednesday I had a work meeting here, and I was a little worried because I still cannot stomach Mediterranean food. I really wish I could because I really enjoyed it, and my wife loves it. Anyway, on to the food. Right now they are running an AYCE make your own pasta dish for $8.95. Now that is a sweet deal! I wasn't paying for my lunch, but I also didn't want to break the bank. I had the bow tie with garlic butter, and couldn't finish the entire portion (yes, I am weak, but hey it was a work meeting). The noodles were cooked well, and the sauce was good. There were a few veggies in the pasta, but really only for texture. The veggies were amazing, and I wish there had been more of them. 
I am only giving Paymon's the 3 stars because I didn't eat anything that is difficult to make or out of the ordinary. I will say that our service was INCREDIBLE and the place was hopping because it was lunch time. Service here as always been good, but this guy was better than good. 
I'd probably go back for the AYCE pasta, and now maybe I can take my wife on a date there because I can have something inexpensive while she indulges on her favorites :-).

Both the food and the hookah are great!   It's central and located close to UNLV- it's a great place for everyone to meet if you all live on different ends of town. The atmosphere is quite stunning, I just love the inside of the hookah lounge.   I have eaten many items on the menu over the past few years.  The greek salad and kabobs are great.  The hummus is to die for and even more of an interesting twist is to try the hummus with pesto.  YUM!  The athens fries are so good- I could eat three servings to myself.  The pita pizzas with pesto sauce are fabulous.  They also have an excellent tropical tasting iced tea blend (I am not a big iced tea fan and even I love this stuff)  Cherry, vanilla, mint is my favorite hookah combo.  Paymon's  is a must try!  You will not be disappointed!

I love Greek food! Unfortunately, Paymon's is average or slightly below average in quality. 

I stopped by for lunch around noon. There was a party of 12 in front of us, so it took the hostess about 5 minutes to greet or acknowledge us. Not too bad.

I ordered a pita gyro, Athens fries, falafel as an appetizer, coffee, and  baklava for dessert. 

The good:
Athens fries. Fresh hot and excellent seasoning. 
Coffee. Very hot and smooth.
Falafel. Two people in my party had never tried falafel, but really liked Paymon's take. Excellent.

The bad:
The gyro. This was my main course and the worst part of my meal. The meat was heaping, but was cold and unappetizing. It must have been sitting a very long time before being served. I came here for a good gyro and was unhappy with the fare.

Do yourself a favor and drive a block away to Stephano's across the street from UNLV. The gyros at Stephano's are superior.

I always enjoy some good Mediterranean food and Payton's was no exception! The menu had a wide variety of entrees including a few Italian dishes. Their hummus and pita were amazing! I stuck to the basics with a salad which was delicious however, everyone at the table ordered something different. Each of these entrees were great!

1 Star cause I had (no choice) just received my food to go, I went to open the bag and grab the plates at the bottom of the bag was a roach!!! I threw the bag away with the food beyond DISGUSTED!been working allday was looking forward to a nice meal very disappointed and a waste of 2 gyro fries and 2 kids meal money just Burned!.

Just had a haircut at Shag Me, and was looking for some sustenance afterwards. Paymon's was fairly close so my friend and I went in for a quick bite.

When I dine with my gluten-free friend, the first thing we do is ask if they have GF menu items. The hostess said they in fact do! We settled down into a cozy table in a dimly lit dining room. Tealight candles illuminated the tables. The hostess gave us a laminated sheet that had a list of their gluten-free items. My friend noticed that the fries were on the list, but there would be a high chance of cross-contamination.

As we were just looking for a quick bite, we decided to order some hummus (served with cucumber slices) and veggie stuffed grape leaves (dolmas). I ordered the broiled chicken kabob to take home. The hummus was quite smooth and creamy, though I wish we had something else to dip with than the cucumber slices (carrots? celery?). The stuffed grape leaves were okay, I would have liked a bit more seasoning.

The server was friendly and checked on us often. I got my chicken kabob just as we were ready to leave. I didn't check the chicken kabob until I got home, which was unfortunate because I saw that it included the vermicelli pilaf. The server saw that we were ordering from the GF menu (it was just a list of menu items, no description). I would have liked for it come with just plain basmati rice, as I wasn't entirely certain if the pilaf was gluten-free. For next time though, I will make doubly sure what sides are included with the entrees.

This is the best Mediterranean restaurant in this part of town. They have a huge menu with a variety of options and they are all good. Let me get out of the way that you are coming here for the food and the food alone.  The actual restaurant isn't fancy or in the best part of town. I've been here several times and they always take forever to greet you when you walk in. Move on because the food is worth it. 

My favorite starters are the pesto hummus and the Athens fries. My mouth is watering as I type this. Their hummus is perfection to begin with, but the pesto topping just takes it to the next level. The Athens fries are loaded with a savory seasoning and served with an addictive sauce on the side. 

I order the same entree every visit. That is the gyros platter. This is definitely enough food for at least two people. The lamb is thinly shaved and full of flavorful. The rice is my favorite because it contains pine nuts which is a nice addition and really adds to the flavor. The house salad is yummy and covered in plenty of traditional Greek dressing. When I came here for a work dinner we all had different items and everybody was happy with their dishes.

Call me a  snob Mediterranean connoisseur but I came from the Valley ,so this is not a true Mediterranean restaurant to me. The menu has Italian food on it... minus 1 star. Minus another star for the fact that the gyros come out stone cold and taste like it was made 3 days prior. 

I add a star back because the atmosphere is enjoyable and it's great for a party of 8++ It's hard to find a place to accommodate so many. The fries are a killer and probably the best dish of the house. I have to give this place some slack because we are in Vegas so I really can't expect much. As for the best Mediterranean restaurants check out my other reviews.

This place is a hidden treasure. This is a place you want to go to escape the Vegas strips over priced mediocre food. They're famous for their ice tea and french fries. Judy sold us on those items. French fries were very flavorful. You have to love garlic to like these fries. The ice tea was tropical. I can't put my finger on it but it was refreshing on a hot october day. The first time I was there got the gyro. That was tasty and a huge portion. They're whole  menu portion is huge. This last time I went I had the ground beef kabob (Koobideh). It was really good. I ended up taking that back to the hotel. It saved me later that night when I drank a little too much. Over all really tasty. Judy was wonderful.

I was so disappointed when we took out of town friends to one of our favorite restaurants and it was a lackluster experience for all.  The server found us after about 10 minutes, the cocktails were more like moonshine, and the spicy chicken curry (which we've had many times) was awful.  It was more like two cups of spicy seasoning was added instead of a proper amount.  The server didn't even offer to replace it for one of the guests who couldn't eat it.  My hubby (the spice lover) painfully choked it down.  The only reason I'm giving two stars for our last experience is for the ambiance and the Athens fries. We'll stick with W. Sahara.

Come hungry!  

Paymon's is about a 5 minute walk from UNLV.  Very convenient for students who don't want to lose their prime parking spot & are tired of subway and the menu at the SU.  

You can dine in their courtyard or inside.  Sitting in the courtyard doesn't actually mean your outside... It is another section of the restaurant where there is a water fountain, some trees, and lots of frames to look at on the wall.  This place has a lot of charm and it feels like you're outside without having to dread the heat (or ummm cold.) 

One thing you must get when you're here is Athens Fries!  Crispy fries with their special seasoning sprinkled on top accompanied with the most addicting dipping sauce.  I could eat just that and be satisfied, its that good! 

The servings here are really big.  After devouring some Athens Fries, I never have enough room to finish my entree.  Got the gyro and had enough left over for the next meal.  I ended up finishing it in the library during my study break and it still tasted just as good and it doesn't get soggy!

The infamous Athens fries here are definitely to die for! Great to start out with. We continued with the gyro with feta cheese (added for free) and it was amazing. I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food so it was nice to eat at a place that had it done right. 

Our server, Anthony, was also very nice and enthusiastic. I now have a new lunch place during the school week to visit :)

This is another one of my neighborhood restaurants. Their portions are generous, enough to share if you are just looking for a quick bite. My friend and I used to go here at share a platter of Grilled Chicken Kebob. We would ask the waitress to substitute the rice for baba ganoush and hummus, and add some tomatoes and cucumbers instead of the pita bread. Perfect amount of food to fill you up during your lunch break if you are at school. They have a large tea selection, which all kinds of fresh tea. They carry an assortment of black, green, and herbal teas and coffee. 

They have delicious desert. I have tried the chocolate cake which is so rich but sooo good. It is ordered from the cheesecake factory. They also have baklava.

I have tried their fried cheese appetizers which are very good.

This place also has a hookah lounge but the lounge is separated from the main dining area by another courtyard dining area. 

Great place to come for coffee and desert! I have always been happy with the service here and recommend this place to all my friends.

I haven't tried everything on their menu, but

Love this place. The food is tasty. The hummus & baba ganoosh are super. The lentil soup is great. So is the falaffel. Really, never had anything bad there & I've eaten there several times. Often crowded, which alsp speaks alot about the place, too.

I got carry out and the staff was very pleasant, on the phone and in person.  The dolmas were terrible, did not taste homemade at all.  The white pita was very good, the wheat, not so much.  The saganaki was terrible, burned almost!  The calamari was good.  

The food was okay to below-average, I probably would not return and will not drive 30 mins out of my way to get carry out again.

Please don't go here! I went through the wrong door, sat down, everyone being served except me! Talked to a waiter, he got the hostess, she gave us menus and we got ignored again! Talked to the hostess again and she said that she would get us a waiter, that's when I set my alarm for five minutes and no one came to help us! We left! Please don't go here!

I have come here multiple times and the food is usually good.  The last time I went, I was served old meat. The quality was just terrible. There was no texture to the meat, it wasn't tender at all, it was just soft, chewy old meat. 

I'm not sure if it was because it was made as a to go order, but the meat quality was unacceptable. On top of that, I was forced to get my food to-go because of a sudden new policy stating that if any food was previously ordered as to-go, then it could not be transferred as a sit down. I would understand peak hours, but there were only two tables occupied in the entire restaurant. My to-go order was not even ready, but I was told that I was not able to dine in due to already making an order, even though I wanted to order more food to dine in. This did not affect just me, my party was not able to dine in as well due to the fact that I had placed a to-go order appetizer and therefor would not be allowed to eat the food at the restaurant. 

I have never felt more unwelcomed at a restaurant and after the quality of food received I will certainly not be returning.

Thank you Paymon's for being open on a weekend day. This may sound odd, but I was put off by Stephano's down the street who was closed on a Saturday when I attempted to try them for the first time. Luckily Paymon's was located right down the street.

I put in a to-go order with the very congenial hostess when I arrived. They had just opened, but as I waited for my order, what seemed like regulars streamed in at a decent pace.

For my husband and I -

An order of Athens fries - a HUGE portion with oregano and other flavorings peppered all over, and it also came with their very distinct fry dipping sauce which I loved.

Two gyros - these were amazingly large and actually served for our lunch on Saturday and our lunch on Sunday as well. I was so pleased with how big these were and the amount of meat allotted to each. The meat was also succulent and delicately flavored. Of course I had mine with tzatziki sauce which was heavenly. My husband opted for his on the side and actually ended up dipping his portion of the fries into his. 

I would definitely recommend Paymon's. Their food was beautifully done, full portioned, and the wait for my take out order was mere minutes.

When I arrived the waiter was very attentive.  He took my order right away.  I ordered the humus, falafel giro.

Humus was creamy and tasted swell.  Also the pita bread was fresh plus the falafel was huge.

Unfortunately the taste was just alright.  I have had better in Portland. If the food was awesome I would have given them five stars!

This is the best place in town, weither you had a hard day and want to relax, hangout with your friends , or even watch the game 
Always make me feel at home
Great happy hour and their shots are like double for 1 
The staff is amazing 
And the foods really good 
Perfect place for any mood
Great service delicious food. Thank u for being in the UNLV coupon book with free fries!!

The food was....okay.  The service was....okay.  What was not okay was showing up with a friend wearing a sleeveless $300 shirt and told he couldn't come in to the hookah lounge because of their "dress code" and watching some bimbo walk in with sandals, cut off shorts and a tank top and no bra.

This is NOT an upscale place - they're in a strip mall - and they should be pleased to greet any guest walking through the door.

I have always been happy with this place, never had a bad meal, never had bad service, just an all around friendly place with good food and good atmosphere.

I would definately recommend this place as it is one of the better places in Las Vegas that still believes in giving you the value for your money.
