The waiter asked what we'd like to drink and I replied, "ALL OF THE WATER, please." He obliged. Oh god, best water ever (granted, I was basically dying of dehydration at that point, so perhaps that had some effect on my perceptions). 

We got an appetizer of hummus, which was good. My only complaint is that I like my hummus a little more flavorful than theirs is--- like, a lot of garlic vs theirs, which is a bit bland. Not sure I'd get the hummus appetizer again for this reason, but if you're a fan of less garlic, then you'll be happy.

For the main meal, I got the gyro salad which was absolutely phenomenal. My friend got a fattoush salad, which she loved. 

Will definitely be back.

With their two locations, they are pretty well known through the valley, the menu take extensive to a whole new level, , from traditional feel good foods to semi exotic middle eastern foods, most done well.

I waited to do a review of Paymon's until i had had a chance to try a few of their dishes.

The curries...If you are in any way shape or form a curry fan, avoid them, though well cooked, they taste like something out of a jar, not good.

Chicken Parm...Oh yeah, this is the stuff, a very well done chicken parm is hard to find, they nail it, just a little hint though, skip the pasta and go with the Athens fries, yes I know, I hang my head in shame, but they make such a great combination.

Spaghetti Bolognese ...An ok interpretation of a classic dish, I have certainly had better, I have also had far worse.

Fesenjan...My wife's favorite, a little to sweet for my tastes, but she raves about it so it must be good.

I can honestly say, the service has been good each time we have been there, the empty coke glass test get's passed every time, so I am happy.

All in all a good place to eat when you need a wide variety of dishes to choose from.

Food is great but the hookah was very disappointing. I have  been here a few times and enjoyed the place a lot. After bragging about it to my friends we all decided to go and we were extremely disappointed. The waiter came back maybe 10 times to fix our hookah and every time was worse. We always get the same flavor but this time it was way too strong and sometimes way too lite after just a few min. Of smoking it. It gave us all stomach aches too. Again the food was amazing but not so much the hookah.
Food was ok, portions were big. Waiter forgot drink order, hummus wasn't tasty and Chai iced tea wasn't sweet as usually is also discover cards not accepted.

I enjoy this spot for the food, but I also like the environment.  Good music, colorful decor, and a nice seating area towards the back that has a kind of outdoor feel, with plants and bright colors.  There is usually a crowd at this restaurant, but service has always been good when I've been there.  I really like their hummus and taboule. I've also gotten takeout there a few times with no problem. There's a store attached to the restaurant where you can buy different foods and other items from the Mediterranean.

For the price you pay?  This place is amazing.  Not only was the food fabulous, but the ambiance was refreshing for Las Vegas.  It was soothing and quiet and intimate.  

My husband had the Chicken Marsala and raved about it for days.  I had the Combination Platter with Hummus, tabuli, stuffed grape leaves, falafel, yogurt-cucumber dip, baba ganosh and Athens fries and loved it.  Our food was top notch.  The price was wonderful and the service amazing.

If you love Mediterranean food, this is the place to go.  And since it is off the strip, there is easy parking and it is right up the street from the Boulevard Mall.

Penne pesto and homemade Hummus are to DIE FOR. Also they have a great selection of wine, good service, and a pretty awesome hookah lounge in the next room. Overall had an excellent experience and will def be back here!
Hostess was rude not welcoming at all when asked if we could sit at another table she had a very bad attitude.

Paymon's offers vegan options!  As a starter I couldn't decide if I wanted hummus or baba ghanoush.  Sunshine, my waitress, suggested I get a half and half plate so I might enjoy both.  The baba ghanoush is over the top with a wonderful smoky flavor and creamy texture.  Then I ordered some of the Athens fries, large serving.  More than I could eat.  Finished with a roasted beet salad.  Salad was really fresh with a house dressing, walnuts and both red and golden beets.  Beets were perfectly roasted with sweet earthy flavors.  Will dine here the next time I am in Las Vegas.

Manager refused to allow us a second coal for our hookah. This was a first for me. Her excuse was that we were already there for 45 minutes and should be done by then. We had dinner there plus drinks in the lounge with our hookah but our business wasn't good enough in the end. Very disappointing as we were entertaining Middle Eastern friends from out of town and they were equally surprised at our experience.  Won't go back.

Fantastic.

We went with some friends we were visiting in Lake Havasu, and this is a place they used to frequent while in graduate school at UNLV. Katie talked very highly about Paymon's and after eating there I can see why.

I had the chicken skewers....to die for.

The hummus....to die for.

We smoked, we drank, we ate and it was all fantastic.

I was invited by another friend to enjoy the 5pm to close happy hour on Tuesday nights. Of course I am saying yes to that! He goes pretty much every week and raves about it. 

We got there early to assure we had a corner table and ordered some drinks and food. My friends order the kabob that had chicken, lamb and beef. Supposedly it was so good that a second round had to be ordered! I read on here about the fries to that's what I ordered and WOW those are yummy. I did take some bites of the kabob plate and the meat was tender and flavorful. 

The waitresses know my friend since he comes all the time so they were good to us. We never had to flag them down to get drinks and they were over to the table ready to get a drink for any new person that happened to join us. With the great atmosphere, people, food and drinks, it was one of the best nights I have had in a long time. I will definitely have to come back on Tuesday's for happy hour and to try out some more of the food options.

So bae and I decided to hit this place . He said it was a great spot so I gave it a try . I got here and the ambiance was very easing . We went ahead and chose and spot and was greeted by kristyl. She was amazing very attentive and such a burst of energy . She was sure to check on us often . We came during happy hour so the prices were amazing (5-7) . When we decided to order hookah Jaime came over and asked if we wanted to chose or get a surprise . We let him do his thang and was probably the best decision we made . We proceeded to order food and that to was great . This is hands down the best hookah spot in town . The environment is very mellow, relaxed, and soothing. We will be coming back for sure this was an amazing pick !

Passing through town and found this on yelp. We eat Mediterranean all the time and this place did not disappoint. I would recommend this to all my friends. The staff was very helpful and had just the right amount of interference. Not too often and enough that we could get refills on drinks or additions to our meal.

My cousin picked Paymon's for dinner one night during our last stay in Vegas so I ended up dining here a couple of days ago. Paymon's is located a couple of miles off the strip so it was nice to get away from all the lights and hustle bustle for a change. At the peak dinner time the restaurant was empty with only two other patrons inside. It also felt very small like only a small section of the restaurant was open for dinner service (I'm not sure but I'm guessing there was a hookah section to the left which ate up some of the space of the restaurant making the open section look tiny). The lighting was also very dim which made for an intimate setting not a family eating environment.

The server who took care of us was very friendly and made the dining experience more enjoyable that what it was. Most people in our group got standard Mediterranean dishes like the Gyro Platter ($11.95) and the Chicken Kabab ($15.95) along with a side of fries ($2.95) and some kids pasta ($3.75). I decided to be a little more enterprising and got the Fesenjan ($13.95) on the recommendation of the server (he did mention that it was a sweet so in case I did not like sweet I should get something else). The wait for the food was very long. After 20 minutes we were just about to cancel our orders and leave when the first plate was delivered which was slowly followed by other orders.

Taste-wise it was hit and miss with more misses than hits. Let's start with the good stuff. The Chicken Kabab was hands down the best dish served. The kabab was completely cooked through yet nice and juice. The rice and other stuff on the plate was also good. The gyro was hard and rubbery like it had been chopped up earlier and refrigerated and then was microwaved before being sent to the table or alternatively it could be that it was grilled for so long that it had become completely dehydrated and fit for the dustbin. The Fesenjan which is basically Iranian chicken stew made from pomegranate molasses and ground walnuts that give the stew a sweet and tart flavor, was by itself very good but the white rice in the center was almost raw like it had been hurriedly steamed and added to the plate. Maybe steaming the white rice was the reason for the extremely long wait but that's what my gut feel is as the rice that came with the Chicken kabab and the gyro platter was the flavored rice which was cooked right. Anyway it made eating that dish almost impossible and even tough I was hungry I could not eat more that half of the Fesenjan which was a shame as it was pretty good.

Overall I was not completely satisfied with Paymon's. If it would have not been for the friendliness of our server I would have rated this place only 2 stars. I'm not sure if I will return.

I love greek food,  particularly gyro.  I had high hopes for this place,  but unfortunately,  was dissapointed with the gyro they serve here.  The menu is extensive,  mostly Italian items,  it seems - but some greek too.  My husband tried moussaka for the first time,  and it was very tasty.  I ordered a gyro salad,  and the gyro was not fresh off a rotisserie.  It was bland and tasteless.  I did not even finish it,  which is a first for me.  I'm sure there are more delicious dishes here,  as it seems popular - just stay away from gyro.

It's was showing that it's open till 1 Am and when I gone there it's was closed.  There was 2 guys 1 in kitchen and 1x waiter. I nocked the door and was shouting but even they didn't come to say sorry. 

I am too hungry and I too upset.

Had Paymon's for the first time today (10/26/11) while out for lunch with Jen S. 

Definitely wasn't wowed by the prices. I'd say they could decrease their prices by about 20% and they'd be on target. I don't know who in their right mind would spend nearly $14 on their combo platter.

I had the fasjan (sp?) It was good, but not worth the price. If there was more meat, yes, but there wasn't. 

Greek fries. Meh, over seasoned. It looks decent but I've definitely had way better Greek food for sure.
Always great! The combo Plate has everything you need!the falafel is the best ive had in vegas! Cant say much more never had hooka there but ate and ate yummy food.

I am a fan!

The pesto hummus is amazing and a very large serving, I dig the vibe in the restaurant and the service was great! I had the gyro sandwich and it was HUGE! Definitely delicious and worth going back for.

It's a casual place, but a unique spot for a date. The parking lot is kind of tight, but that's expected for the area. I love that they offer so many different types of cuisines. They also offer a good selection of wines, which we enjoyed with our meal.

After you dine, you can go next door and smoke some hookah as well! Unfortunately, I don't live anywhere near this restaurant, so I can't go often. But I will definitely be back!

This place had a great vibe and amazingly delicious food, at 11pm at night!!  We got the combination platter from the late night menu and it was more than enough for two people (at $15.95 it should be!).  The falafel was great, and the baba ghanoush and hummus were some of the best I've ever had!  The addition of the "athens fries" was surprising but they were delicious too, especially dipped in the hummus or tahini hehe!  Even though it's a bit pricey, I wouldn't hesitate to go back here again.

No more... I've been a loyal customer for 15 years.. Food isn't what is used to be.  After an incident with the manager today, who needs to take a course in Customer Service, I'm done... Too many new/better restaurants in that area that treat customers respectfully, Paymon's is off my list!

This is one of my FAVORITE neighborhood places.  I've learned a lot about Mediterranean foods since my first visit in 2013.  Everything I have tried here seems to get better and better with each visit.  Great food, great choices and just a jewel of a place for lunch or dinner.  And yes I am partial to the back dining area it is cozy and comfortable.

Worst gyro plate EVER!!!! I ordered food to go and I think they gave me cold leftovers! The gyro meat was cold and dry and the hummus was literally just blended garbanzo beans - NO SEASONING or flavor whatsoever - the meal was quite bad and I could only tolerate the rice...

Such a great restaurant and lounge. I always loved dining in the atrium with the skylights and beautiful art work on the walls.

Our waiter 'Anthony' was very attentive and gave us plenty of time to sit and relax before ordering lunch.

My gyro platter was very tasty and i loved the fresh greek salad and rice that came with it. My friend said his falafel pita sandwich was very good.

Very nice lunch and atmosphere.
Highly recommend if in the area of East Flamingo and Maryland Pkwy.

The Best mediteranian food anywhere! Juicy morsels of Gyro served by the young fledgling waitresses  and seasoned to perfection. The higher prices are worth it given how amazing the food is. They also have choces of the best seasoning selections I have found.

They stop serving to go food at 9pm.
Meaning they can bring it out on a plate. But they cannot put it in a container and let you go on your way. 

Why would I want to eat at your establishment? Its dark as night. Im alone. It makes no sense why i cant get it to go. 

So weak.

Solidly good Mediterranean food!  I had a bowl of lentil soup and my companion had a salad.  Both were plentiful and good.  The service was attentive and friendly at lunch time.

I look forward to going back the next time I'm in town.

This is one of my favorite places! I love the atmosphere and the food! Denise is a great server and so is Carissa. They always get my order right since I am one of those particular orders. I love the Greek salad and chicken Marsala. I have to eat here every month or I go into a craving mode. They also have a baby changer in the bathroom which is helpful when you have kids. You would be surprised how many places don't have baby changing stations. The only thing I'm not crazy about is the neighborhood. I wish they would have another location in Henderson!! Overall this place makes my taste buds happy and I'm a fan!

I love this place!! been going for years infact my grandfather used to shop at the little arab market next to it. i LOVE the greek salad. all i need is a greek salad and some fries .Another good dish is the artichoke shrimp dip.   im not to big on the entrees but they usually come out good . the pita bread is fluffy . mMMm
Fantastic tea menu!!! love to sit in the indoor patio. i LOVE this place if i could i would eat there everyday.

Paymon's is a real blessing for Las Vegas. Consistently amazingly good quality food that can be as health conscious as you want to make it. Take my word for it, Paymon is a little bit closer to G-d than the rest of us and you WILL leave satisfied.

**Restaurant Review Only!**

Atmosphere really makes the culture & the cuisine come alive. Spacious, decorated in fine Mediterranean style, & really gets you engaged in the culture of the food. I can see why this place has won so many 'Best of Las Vegas' awards, because when I was sat I was immediately greeted by a friendly server who was very knowledgeable about the menu & overall kindness goes a long way. I expressed it was my first time at Paymon's, & he did an excellent job to explain & guide me through the menu.

Purchasing the felafel pita, it was the only item I was going for until my server offered me to test out their famous Athen's fries. While french fries are often redundant & boring to myself, I have to say Athen's fries are quite possibly the greatest fries I've EVER had! The seasoning with the side-sauce for dipping compliments each other so finely I had to hold myself back from scarfing the fries down before the pita. The felafel pita itself was delicious as well.

I'm interested in returning here again to try out more of their dishes, since the atmosphere & the flavors of seasoning they use in their food truly won me over (as well as the attentive service I got!) Never was familiar with Mediterranean cuisine, but Paymon's has me officially hooked! :)
I love theirs chicken kabob and chicken curry. I always go totgis restaurant when I am in Vegas.
The tandoori salmon was amazing. It is served with basmati rice. We also had a side of humus and some grape leaves.

I had a really bad experience with this restaurant. I ordered through bitsquad for take out. I received a wrong order and when I called to speak to manager on duty "pepe " he said I hafta blame bitesquad. The manager was super rude. I would never try this place again.
Been coming here for years and today on a busy Sunday Valerie Cynthia and Jon displayed what great customer service truly is.

This place has always been my family's favorite and they never disappoint. We sit in the courtyard every time and always get the best service! I love the ambiance and the food is extremely flavorful. Here in Vegas it's hard to find restaurants that stand out and truly "stick around". Since I was a kid we have been coming here for all of our special events! The fries, pastas, salads, and everything else is so good and come in big portions! I love this place so much and I would highly recommend it to anyone!
Great food. Nice staff. Large portions. Very friendly atmosphere.  Will be back many more times.

This is a two part review. 

The cafe portion of Paymon's is actually quite nice, and is the only reason one should patronize this business. The food overall is delicious, with a variety of Mediterranean with some American fusion and South Asian cuisine rounding out the menu. The Athens Fries are without the best French fries I've had at ANY establishment, so they are a must get when going. Otherwise, the rest of the menu is fairly consistent in quality (not necessarily authenticity) and should be experimented with. The gyros, pastas, kabobs and curries have all been worthwhile dishes to try in my opinion. Lastly, the cafe has some great ambiance, especially during lunch time, with plenty of natural lighting and well-done decor.

Paymon's would be worthy of a 4 or a 5 star review if only the cafe were being reviewed. Unfortunately the attached hookah lounge prevents that. Simply put, Paymon's serves some of the worst and most overpriced hookah in the city. It's actually appalling how bad it is, given the quality of nearly everything else about the establishment. First, Paymon's uses molasses, an extremely inferior alternative to sheesh a tobacco. Flavors are weaker, and the amount of smoke produced is pathetic. This goes hand in hand with absolutely mind-boggling decision to use instant lighting charcoals. The charcoals are of very, very low quality and burn out easy, which is why Paymon's uses a metal cover to insulate the heat of the coal, a practice that typically results in burning the bowl. The ultimate kick in the groin is that despite using coals that are low quality and burn out quickly, additional coals are NOT free, when practically every other hookah lounge will give you at least 2-3 coal refills, if not more on request. Overall, despite the ambiance and food menu, the lounge is definitely not worth it if you were expecting a good hookah experience. Stick to the cafe.

A great place to wind down your week if you're not in the mood to do anything crazy. Excellent place for date-night (and you'll witness the validity of that statement on your next visit by all the other couples lounging around) My wife and I have been going here at least a couple times a month for the last year or so.

 I'm not crazy about the food selection, although that is not primarily why I go here in the first place. I smoke a mixture they have called "The Thief," which is one of the tastiest flavors I've ever had while smoking hookah, and I have been know to grab a smoke here and there for the last 12 years or so when smoking hookah wasn't "the cool thing to do" as it come to be.

On that note, Paymon's has been one of the first players in Las Vegas to have a hookah lounge. They've been around for 10 years plus I would guess.

Try to go on a night where the Salvadorian guy (forgot his name) is working; he really knows how to take care of people and is great with the hookah. This place is really relaxing, the drinks are tasty, and the quality of music that creates the vibe is hard to come by anywhere else.

Very good falafel plate.

Yes what everybody else said--  Athens fries r great

Excellent latte, too!

Great Food!! Very extensive menu. We ordered the appetizer sampler, the lentil soup, Tunisian Vegetable Stew and Lamb Gyro. All items tasted awesome! My wife is vegetarians so this was a great option for her to try something new. Also a quick drive from the strip. Definitely coming back!

i've never had meditteranean food until i went to paymon's.  my aunty and uncle are regulars here so they did the ordering. damn did we have a lot of food on our table for just four people!  

besides the athens fries i don't recall what we had, but they were all so delish. those fries though, are something else! everything about this place is awesome- the food, waiters/waitresses and atmosphere! 

did i mention that they also have a hookah lounge?  pretty chill place to be. i'm from hawaii and can't wait for my next vaca to have some paymon's again!

Came here last week to try out their Hookah.  Upon entering the Venue, you are greeted by a sign that says please see host to be seated with an arrow pointing to the right.  Following the directions we make a walk that deems us awkward through the restaurant just to get to the host.  We say we want hookah and they point us back to our starting point.  I ask a random worker about hookah and they point us to another room that is actually to the left and said we can just go right in.  (Whats up with the misleading sign?)  

After sitting down we wait for 10 - 15 minutes just to get a menu.  another 10 minutes for the order to be taken then after the order was taken, we wait another 10 to 15 minutes for the waitress to come back and asked what we ordered again.  The place wasn't even busy.  

The Hookah and drinks come out and I was really disappointed by the quality.  Really basic sub par quality that you can DIY at home.  Cheap Egyptian style bowl with the basic lid literally straight from a discount smoke shop.  I was hoping the Hookah wouldve been good since it IS a hookah lounge.  Not to mention probably the worst selection of early 80's music available.  Fans and doors were wide open as well so no chance of blowing o's are doing anything with the little hookah smoke their hookah's produced.  

If I didn't know about hookah I guess it wouldn't have been super bad just okay and nothing special.

I love coming here for happy hour! The half priced hummus/falafel/stuffed grape leaves/Athens fries are to die for! The dipping sauces aren't all vegan, but definitely vegetarian. Tea selection is wide & varies. Staff is always friendly and knowledgeable about tea/food/hookah selection!

The food is not the best but the hookah was great 
, will go there again because the service was very good

The food was some where between adequate and good.

On the other hand, the service was some where between less than adequate and bad.

A couple of other things...

- Can some one explain the appeal of falafel?  They almost always taste greasy and sit on your stomach like a brick.  No exception here.
- For some reason the pita bread here tasted like it was a week old.  Taste, texture and look it looked like some cheap store bought pita like substance.  How does that happen?

Not sure I'd return.

Short review that I will hopefully update at a later time.

We had planned on going to Paymons after having a couple drinks at The Garage last weekend.  Paymons says its open until 2 am. At 1:10 they were closed. Located on hookah lounge door btw.
Perhaps an emergency. I was totally disappointed though. :(

We are coming back before 1 am soon!

Honestly, not a big fan of Paymon's.

I've never had a single dish here wow me (usually overcooked) and I think it's overpriced for what you get. 

The atmosphere is nice and they do have a nice hookah lounge that I find to be it's only saving grace. Not a place I recommend or even enjoy going to for a meal, but if you're there it does the trick, just not outstandingly. 

Overall, go for hookah, go elsewhere for food.
